REDMART SERIES B SSA
This Amended and Restated Subscription and Shareholders’ Agreement(the “Agreement”) is made on 2 July 2014.
Between:

(1) GARENA INTERACTIVE HOLDING LIMITED(Company Registration Number: 225951), a company incorporated in the Cayman Islands and having its registered address at The Grand Pavilion Commercial Centre, Oleander Way, 802 West Bay Road, P.O. Box 32052, Grand Cayman KY1-1208, Cayman Islands (the "Investor");

(2) VISIONNAIRE VENTURES FUND I L.P.a limited partnership, having its registered address at Maples Corporate Services Limited, Ugland House, P.O. Box 309, Grand Cayman, KY1-1104, Cayman Islands, C/O Visionnaire Ventures, 500 3rd Street, Suite 240 San Francisco, CA 94107, USA ("Visionnaire");

(3) SB PAN-ASIA FUNDa limited partnership, having its registered address at 13F A wing, Kyobo Tower, 465, Gangnam-daero, Seocho-gu, Seoul, 137-920, Korea ("SBPA", together with Visionnaire the "Visionnaire Investors" and each a "Visionnaire Investor");

(4) EDUARDO LUIZ SAVERIN(holder of Brazilian Passport No. YA598263), residing at 8 Paterson Hill #16-01, Singapore 238567 ("ELS", together with Visionnaire Investors the "New Series B Investors" and each a "New Series B Investor");
(5) THE SEVERAL PARTIES whose details are set out in Schedule 1 (Series A Shareholders) (the "Series A Shareholders");
(6) ROGER EMMETT EGAN III(Passport Number: 447591798), an American citizen residing at 7 One North Gateway, #14-08, One North Residences, Singapore 138642 ("Roger");

(7) VIKRAM PRAKASH RUPANI(Passport Number: Z2500518), an Indian citizen residing at 80 Farrer Road, #02-07, Gallop Gables, Singapore 268855 ("Vikram", together with Roger, the "Founders" and each, a "Founder"); and

(8) REDMART PTE. LTD.(Company Registration Number: 201104957D), a company incorporated in Singapore and having its registered office at 3A Jalan Terusan, Sagawa Express Building - Level 2M, Singapore 619302 (the "Company"),
(collectively, the "Parties" and each, a "Party").
Whereas:

(A) The Company was incorporated in Singapore on 1 March 2011 and has, at the date hereof, an issued and paid-up share capital of S$5,998,482.80 comprising 120,000,000 Ordinary Shares (as defined below) and 204,788,624 Series A RCPS (as defined below).

(B) On 15 July 2013 the Investor, the Company and the Founders entered into a subscription and shareholder’s agreement (the “Series A SSHA”) to which the Series A Shareholders later became parties pursuant to deeds of ratification and accession.

(C) The Investor and the New Series B Investors have agreed to invest in the Company by subscribing for new Series B CPS (as defined below) in the Company on the terms and subject to the conditions set out in this Agreement.
(D) The Company has also entered into the Series B Convertible Loan Agreements (as defined below).

(E) To regulate the relationship of the Shareholders (as defined below) inter se as shareholders of the Company following the subscription of the Series B CPS and the conversion of the Series B Convertible Loan Agreements, and to regulate the conduct of the business and affairs of the
Company, in the spirit of mutual confidence and co-operation, the Parties have agreed to amend and restate the Series A SSHA on the terms and conditions hereinafter set out.

(F) As at the date of this Agreement the Company has 48 shareholders. Following the issuance of the Series B CPS pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and the Series B Convertible Loan Agreements the Company will have in excess of 50 shareholders. As the Companies Act does not permit a private company limited by shares to have more than 50 shareholders, the Company must convert to a public company in order to issue the Series B CPS.

(G) In connection with the entry into this Agreement, certain Shareholders (including parties who will become shareholders pursuant to the conversion of their Series B Convertible Loan Agreements) have requested to re-organize their holdings in the Company after Completion in respect of 43,702,652 Shares in aggregate, representing 7.19% of the Shares. Pre-emption rights on transfers under Clause (Transfer of Shares) and tag-along rights under Clause (Tag-Along Rights) have been waived and will not apply to such transfers.
It is agreed:
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Definitions and Interpretation
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: In this Agreement and in the Schedule unless the context requires otherwise:
Inclusion.p: "Affiliate" means in relation to any corporation, any other corporation or individual (as the case may be) which is the controlling shareholder, holding company or subsidiary of such corporation;

"Amended Articles" means the amended and restated articles of association of the Company from time to time, which shall as at the Completion Date be substantially in the form as set out in Schedule 5 (Amended Articles);
"Board" means the board of directors, for the time being, of the Company;
"Business Day" means a day (other than a Saturday, Sunday or gazetted public holiday) on which commercial banks are open for business in Singapore;
"Companies Act" means the Companies Act (Chapter 50 of Singapore);
"Company Indemnified Person" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;

"Competitor" means any company, partnership, business, legal entity, collective or sole trader which operates, engages in or owns interests in (i) grocery retail, (ii) convenience stores selling ambient and perishable goods, (iii) an e-commerce platform, and/or (iv) logistics;
"Completion" means the completion of the issue and subscription of the Series B Investment Shares in accordance with Clause ;
"Completion Date" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;

"Confidential Information" means any information which is proprietary and confidential to the Company including but not limited to information concerning or relating in any way whatsoever to its distributorship, franchise or other arrangements, principals, any of the trade secrets or confidential operations, processes or inventions carried on or used by the Company, any information concerning the organisation, business, finances, transactions or affairs of the Company, its dealings, secret or confidential information which relates to its business or any of its principals', clients' or customers' transactions or affairs, its technology, designs, documentation, manuals, budgets, financial statements or information, accounts, dealers' lists, customer lists, marketing studies, drawings, notes, memoranda and the information contained

therein, any information therein in respect of trade secrets, technology and technical or other information relating to the development, manufacture, analysis, marketing, sale or supply or proposed development, manufacture, analysis, marketing, sale or supply of any products or services by the Company, and plans for the development or marketing of such products or services and information and material which is either marked confidential or is by its nature intended to be exclusively for the knowledge of the recipient alone;

"Control" means the possession, direct or indirect, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract, or otherwise;
"Data Room" means the information provided to the Investor and the New Series B Investors in electronic form at https://www.dropbox.com/sh/duet6fd8mz3iien/AAAS_YuUF4MAKtVKGkcXTUdFa;

"Deed of Ratification and Accession" means the deed to be executed by a purchaser, subscriber or transferee of shares in the capital of the Company under which such party agrees to be bound by, and shall be entitled to the benefit of, this Agreement, as if an original party hereto, substantially in the form set out in Schedule 6 (Deed of Ratification And Accession);
"Deferral Period" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "Director" means a director at any given time of the Company;
"Disclosure Schedule" means the Disclosure Schedule as set out in Schedule 7 (Disclosure Schedule);

"Encumbrance" means any mortgage, assignment of receivables, debenture, lien, hypothecation, charge, pledge, title retention, right to acquire, security interest, option, pre- emptive or other similar right, right of first refusal, restriction, third-party right or interest, any other encumbrance, condition or security interest whatsoever or any other type of preferential arrangement (including without limitation, a title transfer or retention arrangement) having similar effect;

"Enlarged Issued Share Capital" means the issued share capital of the Company, immediately after Completion, on a fully diluted basis on the assumption that (a) all securities convertible into or exercisable for shares of the Company are exercised and converted to the fullest extent of their terms, (b) all securities issuable pursuant to contractual or other obligations of the Company existing at Completion are issued and (c) all shares of the Company reserved for issuance to employees, consultants or directors of the Company are issued and exercised in full;
"Equity Sale" means a sale by Shareholders to third party purchaser(s) for all or at least 75% of the Shares of the Company;
"Equity Sale Shares" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause (b); "Exchange Act" means the U.S. Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended;

"Excluded Registration" means (i) a registration relating to the sale of shares to employees of the Company or a subsidiary pursuant to a share option, share purchase, or similar plan; (ii) a registration relating to an SEC Rule 145 transaction; or (iii) a registration in which the only Ordinary Shares being registered are Ordinary Shares issuable upon conversion of debt securities that are also being registered;
"Indemnified Person" means an Investor Indemnified Person entitled to indemnification under Clause or a Company Indemnified Person entitled to indemnification under Clause , as applicable;
"Indemnifying Party" means (i) in relation to an Investor Indemnified Person, the Company; and (ii) in relation to a Company Indemnified Person, the Investor;

"Intellectual Property " means patents, trade marks, service marks, logos, get-up, trade names, internet domain names, rights in designs, copyright (including rights in computer software) and moral rights, database rights, semi-conductor topography rights, utility models, rights in know-how and other intellectual property rights, in each case whether registered or unregistered and including applications for registration, and all rights or forms of protection having equivalent or similar effect anywhere in the world and any rights of the same or similar effect or nature which now or in the future may subsist;
"Intellectual Property Rights" means:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: in respect of Intellectual Property developed and owned by the Company, the Intellectual Property, including the right to sue for past infringements of any of the foregoing rights; and
in respect of Intellectual Property not developed and owned by the Company and which is used by the Company, means the right of the Company to use such Intellectual Property;
Inclusion.p: "Investor Director" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;
"Investor Indemnified Person" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "Investor Reserved Matters" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;

"IT Contracts" means all arrangements and agreements under which any third party (including source code deposit agents) provides to the Company any element of, or services relating to, the IT Systems, including leasing, hire purchase, licensing, maintenance and services agreements;

"IT Systems" means all computer systems (including associated software), hardware, databases, associated source codes and compiled code, web-interfaces, business logic, preparatory materials, user manuals and other related documentation) used by the Company, including without limitation the Websites;

"Majority Shareholders" means Shareholders excluding the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors who hold in aggregate at least 75% of the Shares excluding Shares held by the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors;

"Notice of Participation" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "Notice of Transfer" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "Offer" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;
"Option Pool" means the 20,000,000 Ordinary Shares available to be issued by the Company to its employees under the Plan;
"Ordinary Shares" means the ordinary shares in the capital of the Company; "Permit" means:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: permit, licence, consent, approval, certificate, qualification, specification, registration or other authorisation; or
a filing of a notification, report or assessment,
Inclusion.p: in each case necessary for the effective operation of the Company's business, its ownership, possession, occupation or use of an asset or the execution and performance of this Agreement;

Inclusion.numbered_5_para: in relation to an individual, any spouse or children of such individual or trust for the benefit of that individual or spouse or children of that individual;
in relation to any corporation, any other corporation or individual (as the case may be) which is the controlling shareholder, holding company or subsidiary of such corporation; or
in relation to the Investor and each New Series B Investor, any investment fund or investment vehicle co-invested by the Investor or the New Series B Investor (as applicable);
Inclusion.p: "Plan" means the employee stock option plan of the Company in effect or to be in effect as at the Completion Date;
"Preference Shares" means the Series A RCPS and the Series B CPS;
"Preference Shareholders" means the holders of Series A RCPS and the holders of Series B CPS and whose names are registered in the Company's Register of Members;
"Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table" means the pro-forma capitalisation of the Company following Completion as set out in Schedule 2 (Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table);

"Qualified IPO" means the closing of a firm commitment underwritten public offering of Ordinary Shares and the listing of such Ordinary Shares on a reputable international stock exchange (including without limitation stock exchanges in the United States, Hong Kong and Singapore), at a public offering price per Ordinary Share of at least three (3) times the Investor's Series B Share Price per Series B Investment Share (as adjusted for share splits, consolidations, etc.) and with gross proceeds in excess of US$50,000,000.00;
"Qualifying Series B Investor" means a Visionnaire Investor who is also a Substantial Holder;

"Registration Expenses " means all expenses incurred in complying with the provisions of Clause (Registration Rights), including without limitation, all registration and filing fees, exchange listing fees, printing expenses, fees and expenses of auditors and counsel of the Company and the fees and expenses of no more than one counsel selected by the Investor to represent the Investor;

"Registration Request" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "Remaining Offer Shares" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause (a); "Securities Act" means the U.S. Securities Act of 1933, as amended;
"Series A RCPS" means the series A redeemable convertible preference shares in the capital of the Company, having the rights, preferences and privileges set out in Article 4A of the Amended Articles;
"Series B CPS" means the series B convertible preference shares in the capital of the Company, having the rights, preferences and privileges set out in Article 4B of the Amended Articles;
"Series B Convertible Loan Agreements" means loan agreements entered into between the Company and certain individuals and entities as set out in Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table
pursuant to the terms of which the aggregate principle outstanding pursuant to the loans shall be converted to 70,629,690 Series B CPS at Completion;
"Series B Investment Shares" means the 113,977,203 Series B CPS to be issued at Completion;
"Series B Reserved Matters" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "Series B Share Price" means S$0.1667;
"Series B Subscription Proceeds" means the monies received by the Company in respect of the Series B Investment Shares;

"Shareholders" means the Investor, the New Series B Investors, the Series A Shareholders, the Founders, and any other person holding Shares in the capital of the Company who has executed a Deed of Ratification and Accession pursuant to the provisions of this Agreement;

"Shareholding Proportion" means in relation to any Shareholder at any given time, the proportion in which the Ordinary Shares for which that Shareholder holds (and/or would hold if such Shareholder’s Series A RCPS and/or Series B CPS were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) bears to the total number of Ordinary Shares issued in the capital of the Company (on a fully converted basis at the then applicable conversion rate);
"Shares" means the Ordinary Shares, the Series A RCPS and the Series B CPS; "Substantial Holder" means:
Inclusion.numbered_6_para: a Shareholder who holds Ordinary Shares (and/or would hold Ordinary Shares if such Shareholder’s Preference Shares were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) constituting at least 5% of the then total number of Ordinary Shares issued in the capital of the Company (on a fully diluted and as converted basis at the then applicable conversion rate); and

a Visionnaire Investor for as long as (i) the Visionnaire Investors jointly hold in aggregate Ordinary Shares (and/or would hold if the Visionnaire Investors' Series B CPS were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) constituting at least 5% of the then total number of Ordinary Shares (on a fully converted basis), and (ii) the Visionnaire Investor holds on its own in aggregate Ordinary Shares (and/or would hold if such Visionnaire Investor's Series B CPS were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) constituting at least 3% of the then total number of Ordinary Shares (on a fully diluted and as converted basis at the then applicable conversion rate);
Inclusion.p: "Surviving Clauses" means Clauses 1 (Definitions and Interpretation), 21 (Termination), 22 (Announcements), 23 (Costs), 24.1, 25 (Illegality), 26 (Notices), 28 (Entire Agreement), 36 (Counterparts), 37 (Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act) and 38 (Governing Law);
"S$" or "Singapore Dollars" means the lawful currency of Singapore;
"Tagging Preference Shareholder" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;

"Third Party Confidential Information" means any information which is proprietary and confidential to a Party (other than the Company) including but not limited to the terms and conditions of this Agreement;
"Third Party Purchaser" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "Trade Sale" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;
"Transaction" includes any transaction, act, event or omission of whatever nature;
"Transfer" means any voluntary or involuntary sale, assignment, conveyance, pledge, encumbrance, hypothecation, gift, distribution or other disposition or transfer;
"Transferring Shareholder" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ; "US$" means the lawful currency of the United States of America;
"Violation" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;
"Visionnaire Board Observer" shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Clause ;
"Warranties" means the representations, warranties and undertakings made by any Party contained or referred to in this Agreement and "Warranty" means any of them;

"Websites" means the websites and associated web-portals operated by the Company in connection with its business as located at https://redmart.com, http://redmart.ph, http://redmart.cn.com, http://redmart.hk, http://redmart.vn, http://redmart.com.sg and http://redmart.sg, as well as all content, materials, scripts, program code, business logic, interfaces and domain names comprised therein; and
"WMW Loan Agreement" means the S$750,000 loan agreement entered into between Wong Meng Weng (as lender) and the Company (as borrower) dated 23 October 2013.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: In this Agreement, a reference to:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: a statutory provision shall include that provision and any regulations made in pursuance thereof as from time to time modified or re-enacted, whether before or after the date of this Agreement and shall include also any past statutory provision or regulation (as from time to time modified or re-enacted) which such provision or regulation has directly or indirectly replaced;
"this Agreement" includes all amendments, additions, and variations thereto agreed between the Parties in accordance with its terms;

"person" shall include an individual, corporation, company, partnership, firm, trustee, trust, executor, administrator or other legal personal representative, unincorporated association, joint venture, syndicate or other business enterprise, any governmental, administrative or regulatory authority or agency (notwithstanding that "person" may be sometimes used herein in conjunction with some of such words), and their respective successors, legal personal representatives and assigns, as the case may be, and pronouns shall have a similarly extended meaning;

"fiscal year" means a period in respect of which an audited profit and loss account of the Company has or is to be prepared for the purpose of laying before the Company at its annual general meeting, whether that period is a year or not;
"month" is a reference to a period starting on one day in a calendar month and ending on the day immediately preceding the numerically corresponding day in the next succeeding calendar month;
"written" and "in writing" include any means of visible reproduction;
"Clauses" and "Schedules" are to the clauses of, and the schedules to, this Agreement (unless the context otherwise requires); and
"paragraph" is a reference to a paragraph of the Schedule in which such reference appears.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Unless the context otherwise requires, words importing the singular shall include the plural and vice versa and words importing a specific gender shall include the other genders (male, female or neuter).
The Schedules form part of this Agreement and have the same force and effect as if expressly set out in the body of this Agreement.
The headings in this Agreement are inserted for convenience only and shall not affect the construction of this Agreement.

Any thing or obligation to be done under this Agreement, which requires or fails to be done on a stipulated day, shall be done on the next succeeding Business Day, if the day upon which that thing or obligation is required or falls to be done falls on a day which is not a Business Day.
Unless otherwise specified, all warranties, representations, indemnities, covenants, agreements and obligations given or entered into by the Founders are given or entered into jointly and severally.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Effective Date
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: This Agreement shall come into effect following Completion, except for Clauses 1(Definitions and Interpretation), 2 (Effective Date), 3 (Timing of Completion), 4 (Issue and Subscription for Series B CPS), 5 (Warranties, Covenants and Undertakings), 20.1, 20.3, 21 (Confidentiality), 22 (Announcements), 23 (Costs), 24 (General), 25 (Illegality), 26 (Notices), 27 (Further Assurance), 28 (Entire Agreement), 29 (Assignment), 30 (Variations), 31 (Remedies And Waivers), 32 (Several Obligations), 33 (No Partnership), 34 (Time Of Essence), 35 (Force Majeure), 36 (Counterparts), 37 (Contracts (Rights Of Third Parties) Act) and 38 (Governing Law) which shall come into effect immediately upon the entry into this Agreement.

The Parties hereby agree that effective as of Completion the Series A SSHA shall be superseded and replaced in its entirety by this Agreement and that with effect from Completion the Series A SSHA shall terminate, without prejudice to any accrued rights and liabilities.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Timing of Completion
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Prior to Completion the Company will use all reasonable endeavors to procure that the Company is converted to a public company.

Each of the Parties that is a Shareholder as at the date of this Agreement shall exercise its voting rights for the time being in the Company to approve the shareholder resolutions to convert the Company to a public company.
The Investor will, and will (subject to compliance by the Investor Director with his fiduciary duties) ensure that the Investor Director will:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: approve the conversion of the Company to a public company as a reserved matter under the Series A SSHA and the articles of association of the Company;
agree to call an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders to approve the conversion of the Company to a public company; and
approve the declaration of interests by Directors and the statement in lieu of a prospectus to be filed in connection with the conversion of the Company to a public company.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Completion shall take place on the third Business Day following the Company notifying the Investor and the New Series B Investors that the Company has been converted to a public limited company (the “Completion Date”).

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Issue and Subscription for Series B CPS

Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Series B CPS
Inclusion.p: On the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the Company agrees to allot and issue to the Investor, and the Investor agrees to subscribe and pay for 47,990,401 Series B CPS (representing 9.07% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table), for an aggregate subscription price of S$8,000,000.00;

the Company agrees to allot and issue to Visionnaire, and Visionnaire agrees to subscribe and pay for 29,994,001 Series B CPS (representing 5.67% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table), for an aggregate subscription price of S$5,000,000.00;

the Company agrees to allot and issue to SBPA, and SBPA agrees to subscribe and pay for 29,994,001 Series B CPS (representing 5.67% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table), for an aggregate subscription price of S$5,000,000.00; and

the Company agrees to allot and issue to ELS, and ELS agrees to subscribe and pay for 5,998,800 Series B CPS (representing 1.13% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table), for an aggregate subscription price of S$1,000,000.00.

Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Pre-money Enterprise Valuation
Inclusion.p: The Parties hereby agree and acknowledge that the Series B Share Price is based on a pre- money enterprise valuation of S$70,000,000.00 of the Company, based on the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table.

Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Simultaneous Completion
Inclusion.p: None of the Investor nor the New Series B Investors shall be obliged to subscribe for any of the Series B Investment Shares unless the subscription of all the Series B Investment Shares allocated to such Party is completed simultaneously.

Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Completion
Inclusion.p: Completion shall take place on the Completion Date at the offices of the Company at 3A Jalan Terusan, Sagawa Express Building - Level 2M, Singapore 619302 (or such other place as the Parties may agree).
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: On the Completion Date:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the Company shall allot and issue to the Investor and each of the New Series B Investors, and the Investor and each of the New Series B Investors shall subscribe and pay for, such number of Series B Investment Shares as set out in Clause as being allotted and issued to each of them, at the Series B Share Price;
the Company shall deliver to the Investor and the New Series B Investors:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: a certified true copy of the shareholders' resolution of the Company approving:
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: the adoption of the Amended Articles; and

the allotment and issue of (A) the Series B Investment Shares pursuant to Section 161 of the Companies Act and (B) the Ordinary Shares to be issued upon conversion of the Series B Investment Shares (or any of them) pursuant to Section 161(4) of the Companies Act;
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: a certified true copy of the resolutions passed by the Board:
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: approving the allotment and issue of the Series B Investment Shares;

approving the entry into the Register of Members of the Company, the name of the Investor and the New Series B Investors as the holders of the Series B Investment Shares and the making of such other entries into other corporate records of the Company as may be necessary; and
authorising (or ratifying, where applicable) the execution and delivery of this Agreement and the execution thereof, where necessary, under the common seal of the Company; and
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: original share certificates in respect of the Series B Investment Shares subscribed by the Investor and the New Series B Investors; and
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the respective Parties shall pay the full subscription price in respect of the Series B CPS set out in Clause as being allotted and issued to them in Singapore Dollars by way of a cashier’s order, telegraphic transfer to an account designated by the Company (and notified to the Investor and the New Series B Investors not later than five (5) business days prior to the Completion Date) or in such other manner as may be agreed between the Investor and the Company or the New Series B Investors and the Company (as applicable) in writing.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The respective Parties shall not be obliged to perform any of their obligations under Clause
unless Parties representing in aggregate a minimum of ninety (90) per cent of the subscribers of the Series B Investment Shares perform all of their obligations under Clause 4.5.
Without prejudice to any other remedies available, if in any respect the provisions of Clause
are not complied with by any Party on the Completion Date, the Company or the Investor may:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: defer Completion to a date not more than five (5) Business Days after the Completion Date (and so that the provisions of Clause shall apply to Completion as so deferred);
effect Completion so far as practicable having regard to the defaults which have occurred (without prejudice to its rights hereunder); or
terminate this Agreement:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: with respect to such non-compliant Party, where Parties representing in aggregate a minimum of ninety (90) per cent of the subscribers of the Series B Investment Shares have performed all of their obligations under Clause 4.5; or
in its entirity, where Parties representing in aggregate a minimum of eighty
Inclusion.p: (80) per cent of the subscribers of the Series B Investment Shares have failed to perform all of their obligations under Clause ,

(save for the Surviving Clauses) following which no Party shall have any claim against the terminating Party and the terminating Party shall not have any claims against the other Parties for costs, damages, compensation or otherwise, save for any claim by the terminating Party against the other Parties arising from antecedent breach of the terms hereof.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, the Investor and the New Series B Investors shall be entitled, by way of written notice to the Company not less than five (5) Business Days prior to Completion Date, to nominate any of its Permitted Transferees as the subscriber for its Series B Investment Shares.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Warranties, Covenants and Undertakings
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Each Party warrants to the other Parties that, as at the date of this Agreement:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: all actions will have been taken so that the execution and delivery of, and the performance by it of its obligations under, this Agreement shall not (i) where applicable, conflict with or result in a breach of the its memorandum and articles of association or other constitutive documents, (ii) infringe, or constitute a default under, any instrument, contract, document or agreement to which it is a party or by which its assets are bound and (iii) result in a breach of any law, rule, regulation, ordinance, order, judgment or decree of or undertaking to any court, government body, statutory authority or regulatory, administrative or supervisory body (including without limitation, any relevant stock exchange or securities council) to which it is a party or by which it or its assets are bound, whether in Singapore or elsewhere;
all relevant statutory, governmental or other approvals for the transactions contemplated herein have been obtained; and

it has full power and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement and the agreements contemplated herein, and to consummate the Transactions contemplated hereby and thereby and that this Agreement and all such other agreements and obligations entered into and undertaken in connection with the Transactions contemplated hereby constitute its valid and legally binding obligations, enforceable against it in accordance with their respective terms.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Company represents, warrants and undertakes to and with the Investor and the New Series B Investors that (except as otherwise specified in the Disclosure Schedule):
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: on Completion, the 47,990,401 Series B CPS which the Company has agreed to allot and issue to the Investor shall have been duly authorised, allotted, validly issued and fully paid-up and shall represent 9.07% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital;

on Completion, the 29,994,001 Series B CPS which the Company has agreed to allot and issue to Visionnaire shall have been duly authorised, allotted, validly issued and fully paid-up and shall represent 5.67% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital;

on Completion, the 29,994,001 Series B CPS which the Company has agreed to allot and issue to SBPA shall have been duly authorised, allotted, validly issued and fully paid-up and shall represent 5.67% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital;

on Completion, the 5,998,800 Series B CPS which the Company has agreed to allot and issue to ELS shall have been duly authorised, allotted, validly issued and fully paid-up and shall represent 1.13% of the Enlarged Issued Share Capital;
the Series B Investment Shares shall on Completion be free from all and any Encumbrances and no person has or shall have any rights of pre-emption over the Series B Investment Shares;
the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table as set out in Schedule 2 (Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table) is true and accurate in all respects and will be implemented by or immediately after Completion;

save as provided in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table, no third party has any right or option (whether or not in force and binding as at Completion) to be issued new shares (in the form of Ordinary Shares, Series A RCPS, Series B CPS or otherwise) in the Company (whether by way of a fresh issuance of shares, the right the conversion or through issuance of existing treasury shares (if any)); and

as at the date of this Agreement and the Completion Date, the warranties set out in Schedule 4 (Representations And Warranties) in connection with the Company are/shall be true and accurate in all material respects and there is/shall be no information the omission of which in Schedule 4 (Representations And Warranties) might make such information misleading or inaccurate in any material respect.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Warranties shall be separate and independent and save as expressly provided in the Disclosure Schedule, shall not be limited by reference to any other Clause or anything in this Agreement or any other paragraph of Schedule 4 (Representations And Warranties).

If prior to Completion, any event shall occur which results or may result in any of the Warranties being unfulfilled, untrue, inaccurate or misleading at Completion, the relevant Party, upon becoming aware of the same, shall immediately notify the Company, the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors in writing thereof prior to Completion and the Company and the Founders (or any of them) shall make all such investigations and/or do all such acts concerning the event or matter which the Investor or the New Series B Investors may require.

No Party shall do, allow or procure any act or omission before Completion which would constitute a breach of any of the Warranties if they were given at Completion or which would make any of the Warranties untrue, inaccurate or misleading if they were so given.

Save for this Clause (Warranties, Covenants and Undertakings) and Schedule 4 (Representations And Warranties), no Party makes any other representations or warranties, express or implied, to the other Parties and each Party acknowledges to the other Parties that it has not relied on or been induced by any other warranties or representations made by the other Parties or their respective representatives to enter into this Agreement.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Use of Proceeds and Exercise of Rights
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Company shall, and the Shareholders shall procure that the Company shall, use the Series B Subscription Proceeds for business expansion, for working capital in accordance with the budget and business plan of the Company as approved by the Board and for repayment of the WMW Loan Agreement.

Each of the Shareholders shall exercise its rights as a shareholder of the Company in a manner consistent with the provisions of this Agreement. Where to give effect to all or any of the provisions of this Agreement a resolution of the members of the Company in a general meeting is required under the laws of Singapore or under the Amended Articles, each of the Shareholders shall exercise its voting rights for the time being in the Company and take all such actions, things and steps as lie within their powers as are necessary to give effect thereto.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Board of Directors
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Investor shall be entitled to request the appointment of one (1) Director (such Director being a person who is not engaged or involved (whether as an employee, director, officer or substantial shareholder) in any business which is in competition with the business carried on by the Company as at the date of such appointment) (the "Investor Director"), and (for the avoidance of doubt) each of the Shareholders shall exercise its rights as a shareholder in the Company to procure the appointment or removal, as the case may be, of any Investor Director whose appointment or removal, as the case may be, is requested by the Investor. The right of appointment of the Investor Director conferred on the Investor under this Clause shall include the right of the Investor to remove from office at any time and from time to time such person appointed by it as a Director and the right of the Investor at any time and from time to time to determine the period during which such person shall hold the office of Director.
Inclusion.p: The Parties further acknowledge and agree that for so long as the Investor retains the right to appoint the Investor Director, the Investor shall also have the right to nominate a member to each committee constituted by the Board for the administration of the Plan.

In addition, subject to Visionnaire being and remaining a Substantial Holder, Visionnaire has the right to designate one (1) representative to attend all meetings of the Board and all Board committees of the Company in a nonvoting observer capacity (“Visionnaire Board Observer”). This Visionnaire Board Observer shall initially be Mr. Keith Nilsson of Visionnaire and any replacement shall be subject to the prior approval of the Board (acting reasonably). The Company agrees to provide the Visionnaire Board Observer with copies of all notices and materials provided to the Directors at the same time and in the same manner as provided to the Directors. If Visionnaire ceases at any time to constitute a Substantial Holder it shall no longer be entitled to designate a Visionnaire Board Observer and the right to attend meetings and receive information under this clause shall not apply.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Every request for the appointment or removal of a Director by the Investor shall be in writing and signed by or on behalf of the Investor, and shall be delivered to the registered office for the time being of the Company. Whenever for any reason a person appointed by the Investor ceases to be a Director, the Investor shall be entitled to appoint forthwith another Director.
Immediately upon Completion, the Board shall comprise three (3) Directors, being Roger, Vikram and the Investor Director.

Subject to Clause (Reserved Matters), all decisions of the Board shall be taken by a simple majority of the Board. The chairman of the Board shall not be entitled to a second or casting vote at any meeting of the Board or at any general meeting of the Company.

The Board shall meet at least once every fiscal quarter in Singapore or any other place as the Board may decide for purposes of discussing reports and other matters. All Directors (including alternate directors) shall be entitled to receive appropriate notices and minutes of all Board meetings.

Each Director present personally or by his alternate shall have one (1) vote at all meetings of the Board. The quorum of all meetings of the Board shall be two (2) Directors of whom one shall be the Investor Director or his alternate; provided that where no quorum is present at any duly convened meeting, the meeting shall be adjourned to seven (7) days thereafter at the same time and place. The quorum shall remain the same for any adjourned Board meeting and if a Board meeting is adjourned for a second time due to lack of quorum, the quorum for such re-adjourned Board meeting shall be any two (2) Directors.

Discussion at all meetings of the Board shall be duly recorded by such person as the Board may direct and minutes of such meetings shall be drawn up and circulated to all the Directors at least two (2) Business Days prior to the next meeting of the Board.

Subject to Clause (Reserved Matters), a resolution in writing signed by a majority of the Directors shall be valid and effectual as if it had been a resolution passed at a meeting of the Board duly convened and held, as long as such resolution(s) in writing shall have been circulated to all the Directors (including the Investor Director), and may consist of several documents in the like form, each signed by one or more persons. For the purpose of this Clause , "in writing" and "signed" shall include approval by fax and telex, or via electronic mail. Such resolution in writing shall be effective as of the date of the resolution or, if the resolution is signed in two (2) or more counterparts, as of the last date appearing on the counterparts.

A Director shall not be prohibited from voting or being counted in a quorum at any meeting of the Board in respect of any contract or arrangement in which he is or may be interested provided he has disclosed the nature of his interest in accordance with the memorandum and articles of association of the Company and all applicable law (including Section 156 of the Companies Act).

The Company shall reimburse all reasonable expenses of the Investor and/or his alternate, related to all Board activities, subject to prior written approval of such expenses. The Company further undertakes to provide customary directorship insurance coverage for, and maximum indemnification of, the Board (if required) for the purposes of any initial public offering of the Company's securities.

The provisions of this Clause (Board of Directors) shall apply mutatis mutandis to any subsidiary of the Company, with the consequences that references to the "Company" shall be construed as referring to such subsidiary, and the Shareholders shall procure that the Company exercises its rights as shareholder in such subsidiary(ies) to give effect to this Clause (Board of Directors) as applied to such subsidiary(ies).

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Reserved Matters
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Where questions arise or resolutions are proposed at any general meeting of the Company or any meeting of the Board or committee of the Board (as the case may be) in respect of the following matters (the "Investor Reserved Matters"), the affirmative vote of the Investor or his representative(s), attorney(s) or proxy(ies) at such general meeting, or of the Investor Director at such meeting of the Board or committee of the Board (as the case may be) of the Company shall be required to decide on such questions or pass any such resolutions (as the case may be):
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: any amendment or change of the rights, preferences or privileges of, or the restrictions provided for the benefit of, any of the Preference Shares;

the authorisation or creation (by reclassification or otherwise) of any new class or series of shares having rights, preferences or privileges senior to or on a parity with any of the Preference Shares;

any increase, reduction or other alteration to the issued share capital of the Company, and/or any sale or issue of any equity or debt security or instrument or warrant, option or other right to purchase any equity or debt security (save for any shares issued pursuant to the Plan or upon conversion of the Preference Shares);
any amendment or waiver of any provision of the memorandum and articles of association of the Company;

authorisation of any obligation on the Company to declare or pay any dividend or distribution and any change in the policy of dividend distribution or any action that otherwise results in the redemption or repurchase of any equity security;
any sale or disposal of the whole or a substantial part of the business, goodwill or the assets of the Company, or any subsidiary;

any resolution to approve the liquidation, dissolution or winding up of or the initiation of bankruptcy proceedings against or any application for the appointment of a receiver, judicial manager or like officer for the Company;
any merger, acquisition, consolidation, or reorganisation of the Company;
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: any recapitalisation, reclassification, split-off, or spin-off of the Company;
Inclusion.p: (j) any sale, mortgage, pledge, lien, charge, lease, transfer or otherwise disposal of any of the material assets of the Company;

(k) any approval of or amendments to the annual budget, business plan and operating plan (including any capital expenditure budget, operating budget and financing plan), other than as approved by the Board;
(l) any material engagement in any business materially different from that described in the then current business plan or cessation of any business undertaking of any subsidiaries of the Company;

(m) incurring any borrowings, indebtedness or assuming any financial obligation or issuing, assuming, guaranteeing, indemnifying or creating any liability for borrowed money in excess of S$1,000,000.00 in aggregate at any time outstanding unless such liability is incurred pursuant to the then current business plan of the Company;
(n) the lending of any moneys other than placing of deposits with banks and financial institutions, other than in the ordinary course of business;
(o) making of any acquisition, investment or any expenditure or other purchase of tangible or intangible assets in excess of S$1,000,000.00 in aggregate over any twelve
(12) months unless such acquisition, investment, expenditure or purchase is consistent with the then current business plan of the Company;

(p) entry into any material agreement or contract with any party or group of related parties under which the Company's aggregate commitments, pledge or obligations to such party or group of related parties are unlimited or potentially exceed S$1,000,000.00 over any twelve (12) months or in the aggregate;

(q) engagement or entry into any transaction or agreement with a value in excess of S$1,000,000.00 (either in terms of aggregate transaction value or annual consideration payable) with any of the Company's affiliates, Shareholders, Directors or other related parties, other than employment agreements (save as provided in Clause (s)), stock and option agreements and similar arrangements;
(r) any change in the size and composition of the Board or any committee thereof;
(s) any appointment, termination or determination of the Chief Executive Officer, President, Chief Operating Officer or Chief Financial Officer of the Company;
(t) any material change to the accounting methods or policies adopted by the Company or any appointment or change of the auditors of the Company;
(u) the selection of the listing stock exchange or the underwriters for the Qualified IPO or any resolution to approve the valuation and terms and conditions of the Qualified IPO;
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: any disposal of or dilution of the Company's interest, directly or indirectly, in any of its subsidiaries;
Inclusion.p: (w) the institution, commencement, defence, compromise or settlement by the Company of any litigation or arbitration or administrative proceedings in excess of S$1,000,000.00 on a per matter basis (except for collection of debts in the ordinary course of the business of the Company);
Inclusion.numbered_6_para: the approval of the audited balance sheet and profit and loss account of the Company and any report or statement accompanying such balance sheet and profit and loss account;
Inclusion.p: (y) the establishment of any new employee stock option scheme or phantom employee stock option scheme of the Company (save for the Plan) or any amendment to the terms of the Plan (including the size of the Option Pool of the Plan); and
(z) the transfer of any Shares to a Competitor before the fifth anniversary of the Completion.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Where questions arise or resolutions are proposed at any general meeting of the Company or any meeting of the Board or committee of the Board (as the case may be) in respect of the following matters (the "Series B Reserved Matters"), the affirmative vote of the Series B CPS Shareholders holding a simple majority of the Series B CPS at a class meeting of Series B CPS Shareholders or a general meeting of the Company shall be required to decide on such questions or pass any such resolutions (as the case may be):
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the authorisation or creation (by reclassification or otherwise) of any new class or series of shares having rights, preferences or privileges senior to or on a parity with any of the Series B CPS;

incurring any borrowings, indebtedness or assuming any financial obligation or issuing, assuming, guaranteeing, indemnifying or creating any liability for borrowed money in excess of S$10,000,000.00 in aggregate at any time outstanding unless such liability is incurred pursuant to the then current business plan of the Company;

the authorisation of any obligation on the Company to declare or pay any dividend or distribution on Ordinary Shares and any change in the policy of dividend distribution or any action that otherwise results in the redemption or repurchase of any Ordinary Share;
any repurchase of Ordinary Shares, except upon termination of employment of an employee of the Company at cost pursuant to the terms of the Plan or other arrangements approved by the Board;
any amendment or change of the rights, preferences or privileges of, or the restrictions provided for the benefit of, any of the Preference Shares;

any authorisation or issuance of any equity or debt security (other than as permitted pursuant to Clause (b)) or instrument or warrant, option or other right to purchase any equity or debt security (other than as permitted pursuant to Clause (b)) or instrument in the Company having rights, preferences or privileges senior to or on a parity with any of the Preference Shares; and
any amendment or waiver of any provision of the memorandum and articles of association of the Company which would restrict, amend or change the rights, preferences or privileges of the Series B CPS.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Subject to Clause (f) above, where a resolution is proposed at any general meeting of the Company in respect of (a) the disposal of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company or its business; or (b) an Equity Sale (either event, a "Trade Sale"):
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: a simple majority of the votes cast by the holders of Ordinary Shares present and voting at a general meeting of holders of Ordinary Shares, whether in person or by proxy, approving such Trade Sale; and
a simple majority of the votes cast by Preference Shareholders present and voting at a general meeting of all Preference Shareholders, whether in person or by proxy, approving such Trade Sale,
Inclusion.p: shall be required to pass any such resolution.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Shareholders' Meetings
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The number of Shareholders necessary to form a quorum for the transaction of business at a meeting of Shareholders shall be two (2) Shareholders present personally or by representative, attorney or proxy, one of whom shall be the Investor, whether present by representative, attorney or proxy, and at least one of whom shall be one of the Founders. All matters raised at a meeting of the Shareholders shall, unless otherwise required by the Companies Act, the Amended Articles or Clause (Reserved Matters), be decided by ordinary resolution of the Shareholders present at the meeting.

If within half an hour from the time appointed for holding the meeting a quorum is not present, the meeting shall be adjourned to seven (7) days thereafter at the same time and place and no notice needs to be given to the Shareholders in relation to such adjourned meeting. The quorum shall remain the same for any adjourned general meeting and if a meeting is adjourned for a second time due to lack of quorum, the member or members present at such re-adjourned general meeting shall be the quorum.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Finance for the Company
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Shareholders agree that the finance for the business of the Company shall be provided by
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: additional equity financing and/or (b) loans and other credit facilities from the Company's bankers and other parties on such terms as the Board may, subject to the Investor Reserved Matters and Series B Reserved Matters, agree.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: It is hereby agreed that none of the Shareholders shall be required to provide any form of security or comfort in respect of any banking or credit facility granted to the Company or any of its subsidiaries or in relation to it or its businesses. In the event that undertakings, guarantees or any other securities are provided by the Shareholders or any of their respective related corporations to any third party or parties in connection with any credit or banking facilities to the Company, the Shareholders shall, unless otherwise unanimously agreed, provide the same in proportion to their Shareholding Proportion (or in such other proportion as may be agreed by all the Shareholders) and on a several basis.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Information Rights
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: For so long as the Investor continues to hold any Shares, the Company shall and the Shareholders shall exercise their rights as shareholders in relation to the Company so as to ensure that the Company shall:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: deliver to the Investor the following relating to the Company and its subsidiaries, in English and in a form acceptable to the Investor:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: the unaudited consolidated annual financial statements and management report, within ninety (90) days after the end of each fiscal year;
the unaudited consolidated quarterly financial statements and management report, within twenty one (21) days after the end of each fiscal quarter;
the unaudited consolidated monthly financial statements and management report, within twenty one (21) days after the end of each fiscal month;

a detailed quarterly budget (including estimated major items of revenue and expenses/capital expenditure and projections for the following 12 month period) for the following fiscal quarter, within 15 days prior to the end of each fiscal quarter; and
copies of all documents or other information sent to any Shareholder in its capacity as a Shareholder.
Inclusion.p: All financial statements shall be prepared on a consistent basis in accordance with accounting reporting standards as may be reasonably approved by the Investor in writing, and all management reports shall include a comparison of financial results with the corresponding quarterly and annual budgets;
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: provide the Investor with the right to inspect copies of any reports filed by the Company with any relevant securities exchange, regulatory authority or governmental agency (including but not limited to the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore); and

with at least three (3) Business Days' prior written notice, grant the Investor the right to, at Investor’s expense, inspect the books and records of the Company and to discuss the business, operations and conditions of the Company with the Directors, officers, employees, accountants, legal counsel and investment bankers of the Company, provided that the Company may exclude any materials or disapprove any inspection to the extent reasonably determined by the Company to protect the Company's proprietary information or trade secrets.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Upon request by a Substantial Holder, the Company shall, and the Shareholders shall exercise their rights as shareholders in relation to the Company, so as to ensure that the Company shall:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: deliver to the Substantial Holder the following relating to the Company and its subsidiaries, in English and in a form acceptable to the Substantial Holder:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: the unaudited consolidated annual financial statements for the previous fiscal year;
the unaudited consolidated quarterly financial statements for the previous fiscal quarters; and
the current business plan.
Inclusion.p: All financial statements shall be prepared on a consistent basis in accordance with accounting reporting standards as may be reasonably approved by the Investor in writing, and all management reports shall include a comparison of financial results with the corresponding quarterly and annual budgets;
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: provide the Substantial Holder with the right to inspect copies of any reports filed by the Company with any relevant securities exchange, regulatory authority or governmental agency (including but not limited to the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore); and

with at least three (3) Business Days' prior written notice, grant the Substantial Holder the right to, at the Substantial Holder’s expense, inspect the books and records of the Company and to discuss the business, operations and conditions of the Company with the Directors, officers, employees and accountants of the Company, provided that the Company may exclude any materials or disapprove any inspection to the extent reasonably determined by the Company to protect the Company's proprietary information or trade secrets.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Pre-Emptive Rights: Issue of New Shares
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Subject to Clause (Reserved Matters) and save as set out in Clause , each Substantial Holder shall have a pre-emptive right to purchase up to its Shareholding Proportion of any shares or securities offered by the Company (which may be exercised by giving a notice of acceptance to the Company within fourteen (14) days from the date of such offer being notified to the Substantial Holder, failing which such right shall be deemed waived), on the same price, terms and conditions as the Company proposes to offer such shares or securities to other potential investor(s), with (in the case of Substantial Holders who have elected to purchase all the shares or securities so offered up to their respective Shareholding Proportion) a right of oversubscription (which may be exercised by giving a notice of further subscription to the Company within fourteen (14) days following the aforementioned fourteen (14) day period) if any Substantial Holder elects not to purchase its full Shareholding Proportion of the shares or securities so offered, in (as nearly as may be) their respective Shareholding Proportion inter se or in such proportion as they may agree amongst themselves.
Clause shall not apply to any issuances of shares or securities of the Company:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: pursuant to the Plan;
upon conversion of the Series A RCPS in accordance with its terms and the Amended Articles;
upon conversion of the Series B CPS in accordance with its terms and the Amended Articles;
in connection with a bona fide acquisition of another business entity by the Company;
in connection with a Qualified IPO;
in connection with any share split, share dividend, recapitalisation or similar Transaction;

upon the conversion of any convertible loan(s) of the Company (including the Series B Convertible Loan Agreements) outstanding as of the Completion Date in connection with the subscription of the Series B Investment Shares; and
any securities issued in connection with debt or equipment financing facilities, or in connection with any strategic transactions between Company and third parties.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: It shall be a condition precedent to the issuance of new shares by the Company to a third party that such third party shall be required to execute the Deed of Ratification and Accession under which it agrees to be bound by and be entitled to the benefit of this Agreement as if it were an original party hereto.

It is hereby agreed that the issuance of Series B CPS pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and the terms of the Series B Convertible Loan Agreements shall not be subject to the pre- emptive rights as set out in this Clause (Pre-Emptive Rights: Issue of New Shares).

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Transfer of Shares
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Except as hereinafter provided, if a Shareholder (hereinafter referred to as the "Transferring Shareholder") wishes to Transfer any of its Shares, that Transferring Shareholder shall first notify each Substantial Holder, and offer in writing those shares to be transferred by the Transferring Shareholder to each Substantial Holder in (as nearly as may be) their respective Shareholding Proportion at a price and on such terms and conditions determined by the Transferring Shareholder (each offer to a Shareholder being an "Offer" and all such offers being the "Offers").

Subject to Clause , an Offer may be accepted by the relevant Substantial Holder(s) as to all or part of the Shares comprised in such Offer within fourteen (14) days from the date of the Offer and any Shares comprised in such Offer which are not accepted shall be deemed to have been declined.

Where an Offer is declined or deemed to have been declined, the other Substantial Holder(s) who have so accepted their respective Offers in respect of all the Shares comprised therein shall for a further period of fourteen (14) days following the fourteen (14) day period mentioned in Clause have the option but not the obligation:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: to accept all the Shares declined or deemed to have been declined by the other Substantial Holder(s) (the "Remaining Offer Shares") in (as nearly as may be) their respective Shareholding Proportion inter se or in such proportion as they may agree amongst themselves; and/or
subject to the agreement of all Substantial Holders and to Clause , to nominate a third party or parties to purchase some or all of such Remaining Offer Shares,
Inclusion.p: so that all and not some only of the Shares comprised in all the Offers shall be fully taken up. For the avoidance of doubt, if all of the Remaining Offer Shares are not so accepted within 14 days following the fourteen (14) day period mentioned in Clause , the Offers under this Clause shall be deemed to have been declined in whole by the other Substantial Holder(s) and Clause shall apply.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Upon the Offers under Clause being declined, or being deemed to have been declined, all and not some only of the Remaining Offer Shares may be offered by the Transferring Shareholder for sale to non-Substantial Holders (the "Third Party Purchaser") during a period of not more than thirty (30) days after the expiry of the fourteen (14) days following the fourteen (14) day period mentioned in Clause on the same terms and conditions (including price) comprised in the Offers.

Completion of the sale and purchase of any Shares under this Clause (Transfer of Shares) shall take place on the date falling no later than thirty (30) days from the date of acceptance of the relevant Offers. On such completion:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the Transferring Shareholder shall deliver to the purchaser(s):
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: a duly executed transfer form in favour of the purchaser(s) or as it or they may direct;
the share certificates in respect of the Shares to be sold; and

a working sheet signed by a Director or the secretary of the Company computing the net asset value per share of the Company for the purposes of computation of any applicable stamp duty payable (if any); and
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the purchaser(s) shall deliver to the Transferring Shareholder a cashier's order or banker's draft drawn on a bank licensed in Singapore or such other mode of payment
Inclusion.p: agreed between the Transferring Shareholder and the purchaser(s) for the full amount of the consideration payable for the Shares to be purchased.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: It shall be a condition precedent to the right of any Transferring Shareholder to transfer Shares that:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the transferee, if not already bound by the provisions of this Agreement, executes the Deed of Ratification and Accession under which it agrees to be bound by and be entitled to the benefit of this Agreement as if it were an original party hereto in place of the Transferring Shareholder;

the Transferring Shareholder shall remain liable and be responsible for the due discharge, performance and observance of all its liabilities and obligations whether actual or contingent arising out of or on or in respect of or in connection with this Agreement and in respect of the Shares at any time up to the date of the Transfer, and shall remain entitled to all rights and benefits arising out of or in connection with the Shares being Transferred at any time up to and including the date of Transfer; and

where the Transferring Shareholder proposes to transfer Shares on or before the fifth anniversary of Completion, and transferee is a Competitor, such transfer is approved by the Board and the Investor.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: In the event that, on or before the fifth (5) anniversary of Completion and without the prior approval of the Board and the Investor:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The Investor or a Visionnaire Investor (or any of their respective Permitted Transferees) transfers any Shares to a Competitor; or

an indirect interest in any Shares held by the Investor or a Visionnaire Investor (or any of their respective Permitted Transferees) is transferred to a Competitor (provided that in the event the Investor or a Visionnaire Investor is directly or indirectly owned by an investment fund, this restriction, taken at the investment fund level, will apply to any change of manager or any change in ownership of the existing manager of such investment fund and not to a change in unit holder or limited partners in the investment fund) for the sole purpose of circumventing the restriction set forth in sub- clause (a) above and not as part of a wider transaction,
Inclusion.p: then (i) in the case of sub-clause (a) above the Board may refuse to register such transfer of Shares; and/or (ii) in the case of sub-clause (a) above (in respect of the transferee as a new Shareholder) and in the case of sub-clause (b) above (in respect of the Investor or a Visionnaire Investor (and any of their respective Permitted Transferees), as applicable), such party will immediately lose all rights under this Agreement, including without limitation under Clause (Information Rights) and Clause (Tag Along Rights), and the vote of the Investor or the Visionnaire Investor (and any of their respective Permitted Transferees), as applicable, will not be counted as part of any resolution requiring the consent of the Majority Shareholders.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: In the event that, on or before the fifth (5) anniversary of Completion and without the prior approval of the Board and the Investor, any Shareholder, excluding the Investor and the Visionnaire Investors (and any of their respective Permitted Transferees):
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: transfers directly or indirectly any interest they may have in such Shareholder or Shares to any Competitor; or

Control (directly or indirectly) of the Shareholder is transferred to, or assumed, by a Competitor (provided that in the event the Shareholder is directly or indirectly owned by an investment fund, this restriction, taken at the investment fund level, will apply to any change of manager or any change in ownership of the existing manager of such
Inclusion.p: investment fund and not to a change in unit holder or limited partners in the investment fund),

then (i) in the case of sub-clause (a) above the Board may refuse to register such transfer of Shares; and/or (ii) in the case of sub-clause (a) above (in respect of the transferee as a new Shareholder) and in the case of sub-clause (b) above (in respect of the Shareholder), such party will immediately lose all rights under this Agreement, including without limitation under Clause (Information Rights) and Clause (Tag Along Rights), and the vote of the Shareholder will not be counted as part of any resolution requiring the consent of the Majority Shareholders.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Where reasonably requested by the Board, and where not previously notified to the Board, the Investor and the Visionnaire Investors (and any of their respective Permitted Transferees), will provide to the Board details of any Competitor that has obtained an indirect interest in any Shares in the circumstances contemplated by clause 13.7(b) above.

Where reasonably requested by the Board, a Shareholder, excluding the Investor and the Visionnaire Investors (and any of their respective Permitted Transferees), will provide to the Board details of the ultimate beneficial owner of such Shareholder and confirmation of whether or not such Shareholder is in whole or in part, directly or indirectly, owned or controlled by a Competitor.

Each Shareholder, excluding the Investor and the Visionnaire Investors (and any of their respective Permitted Transferees), who is not a natural person, agrees to notify the Company as soon as reasonably practicable of any changes to the direct or indirect shareholders or beneficial owners of such Shareholder, provided that in the event a Shareholder is directly or indirectly owned by an investment fund, this obligation, taken at the investment fund level, will apply to any change of manager or any change in ownership of the existing manager of such investment fund and not to a change in unit holder or limited partners in the investment fund.

The pre-emption rights of the Substantial Holders under this Clause (Transfer of Shares) on any Transfer of Shares by a Transferring Shareholder shall not apply in the case of (a) an Equity Sale approved pursuant to Clause ; (b) a sale of up to 11,997,600 Ordinary Shares by the Founders to the Investor (and in such case the tag-along rights under Clause (Tag- Along Rights) shall not apply); or (c) any Transfers of Shares by the Investor, the New Series B Investors or any Founder to any of its Permitted Transferees (and in such case the tag-along rights under Clause (Tag-Along Rights) shall not apply), and the foregoing pre-emption rights shall cease upon the closing of a Qualified IPO or a Trade Sale.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Tag-Along Rights
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: After compliance with the procedures set out in Clause (Transfer of Shares), if a Transferring Shareholder desires to Transfer, in a single transaction or a series of related transactions, any of the Shares held by it in a bona fide sale to a Third Party Purchaser, then such Transferring Shareholder shall promptly give written notice (the "Notice of Transfer") simultaneously to the Preference Shareholders and the Company. The Notice of Transfer shall describe in reasonable detail the terms and conditions of the proposed Transfer, including without limitation, the number of Shares to be Transferred, the nature of such Transfer, the consideration to be paid per class of Shares, and the name and address of the Third Party Purchaser.

Each Preference Shareholder shall have the right, exercisable upon written notice (the "Notice of Participation") to the Company within thirty (30) days after the receipt of the Notice of Transfer, to inform the Company in writing whether it elects to participate in the Transfer by the Transferring Shareholder on the same terms and conditions as set forth in the Notice of
Inclusion.p: Transfer (such Preference Shareholder who elects to participate in the Transfer by the Transferring Shareholder, the "Tagging Preference Shareholder"). The Notice of Participation shall indicate the number of Shares the Tagging Preference Shareholder elects to Transfer pursuant to this Clause , up to that number of Shares equal to the product obtained by multiplying (a) the aggregate number of Shares set forth in the Notice of Transfer by (b) the Tagging Preference Shareholder's Shareholding Proportion at the time of the Transfer. Each Tagging Preference Shareholder shall promptly deliver to the Company (who shall be deemed to be constituted the agent of the Transferring Shareholder and the Tagging Preference Shareholders for the transfer in accordance with the Amended Articles) for transfer to the Third Party Purchaser one or more share transfer forms, properly executed for transfer, which represent the number of Shares which the Tagging Preference Shareholder elects to transfer, together with the relevant share certificates and a working sheet signed by a Director or the secretary of the Company computing the net asset value per share of the Company, for the purposes of stamping the said Transfer. To the extent one or more of the other Preference Shareholders exercises such right of participation in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth above, the number of Shares that the Transferring Shareholder may Transfer in the transaction shall be correspondingly reduced.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: To the extent any other Preference Shareholder fails to elect to participate in the Transfer by the Transferring Shareholder, such Preference Shareholder shall be deemed to have consented to the Transfer by the Transferring Shareholder on the terms and conditions and to the Third Party Purchaser set forth in the Notice of Transfer. The Company shall (as agent for the Tagging Preference Shareholders) Transfer the number of Shares which the Tagging Preference Shareholders have elected to Transfer to the Third Party Purchaser on the terms set out in the Notice of Transfer. Any proposed Transfer on terms and conditions more favourable than those described in the Notice of Transfer or to a transferee not identified in such notice, as well as any subsequent proposed Transfer of any of the Shares held by the Transferring Shareholder, shall again be subject to the tag-along rights of the other Preference Shareholders and the transfer restrictions set out in this Agreement and shall require compliance by the Transferring Shareholder with the procedures described in this Clause (Tag-Along Rights). The exercise or non-exercise of the rights of a Preference Shareholder hereunder to participate in one or more sales by a Transferring Shareholder shall not adversely affect such Preference Shareholder's rights to participate in subsequent sales of Shares by any Shareholder pursuant to this Clause (Tag-Along Rights).

Upon consummation of the Transfer of the Shares pursuant to the terms and conditions specified in the Notice of Transfer, the Transferring Shareholder or the Company, as the case maybe, shall remit to each Tagging Preference Shareholder that portion of the proceeds to which such Tagging Preference Shareholder is entitled by reason of its participation in such Transfer. To the extent that the Third Party Purchaser prohibits such assignment or otherwise refuses to purchase Shares from a Tagging Preference Shareholder exercising its tag-along rights hereunder, the Transferring Shareholder shall not Transfer to the Third Party Purchaser any of its Shares unless and until, simultaneously with such Transfer, the Transferring Shareholder or the Third Party Purchaser shall purchase the Shares from such Tagging Preference Shareholder on the same terms and conditions specified in the Notice of Transfer.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, tag-along rights shall not apply to any Transfer by a Shareholder pursuant to a bona fide loan transaction with a financial institution that creates a mere security interest, and the provisions of Clause shall apply mutatis mutandis.

Any purported Transfer by a Shareholder in violation of this Agreement shall be null and void and of no force and effect and the purported transferees shall have no rights or privileges in or with respect to the Company or the Shares purported to have been so transferred. The Company shall refuse to recognise any such Transfer and shall not reflect in its records any change in ownership of such Shares purported to have been so Transferred.
The tag-along rights of the Preference Shareholders under this Clause (Tag-Along Rights) shall cease upon the closing of a Qualified IPO or a Trade Sale.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Drag-Along Rights
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: In the event an Equity Sale is approved pursuant to Clause , each Shareholder shall:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: if the Equity Sale is in respect of 100% of the Shares, transfer all of its Shares; or
if the Equity Sale is in respect of less than 100% of the Shares (the "Equity Sale Shares"), transfer its Shareholding Proportion of the Equity Sale Shares,
