Inclusion.p: and for this purpose, shall promptly deliver to the Company (who shall be deemed to be constituted the agent of the Shareholders for the Equity Sale in accordance with the Amended Articles) for transfer to the third party purchaser(s) one or more share transfer forms, properly executed for transfer, which represent the number of Shares such Shareholder is to transfer, together with the relevant share certificate(s) and a working sheet signed by a Director or secretary of the Company, computing the net asset value per share of the Company, for the purposes of stamping the said transfer.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Upon completion of the Equity Sale upon such terms and conditions as approved, the Company shall remit to the respective Shareholder its portion of the proceeds to which such Shareholder is entitled by reason of its participation in the Equity Sale.

In the event that any Shareholder fails to complete the sale of its Shares on the completion of the Equity Sale in accordance with Clause , any Director shall be deemed to have been appointed attorney of such Shareholder with full power to execute, complete and deliver, in the name and on behalf such Shareholder, transfers of such Shareholder's Shares to the third party purchaser(s) against payment of the purchase price for the Shares to the Company.
On payment of the purchase price to the Company, the Company shall cancel the share certificate(s) representing the Shares issued in favour of the Shareholders and:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: issue and deliver new share certificate(s) for the Shares to the third party purchaser(s); and
if relevant, issue and deliver to each Shareholder, new share certificate(s) in respect of their remaining Shares.
Inclusion.p: The Company shall forthwith pay the purchase price into a separate bank account in the Company's name and shall hold such price for the account of the Shareholders. For the purposes of calculating the purchase price due to Preference Shareholders, for the avoidance of doubt any sale pursuant to the drag along rights under this Clause (Drag-Along Rights) shall with respect to the Amended Articles be deemed a Liquidation Event (as such term is defined under the Amended Articles).

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Permitted Transferees and Transfer Restrictions
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Subject always to the rights of the Preference Shareholders under Clauses 13 (Transfers of Shares) and 14 (Tag-Along Rights), but save for Transfers to his Permitted Transferees, each of the Founders undertakes to the Investor that, before July 15, 2017, he shall not sell, Transfer, mortgage, charge, pledge, grant an option over, or otherwise dispose of or create Encumbrances over any number of his Shares exceeding 10% of the aggregate number of Shares held by him as at Completion without the prior written approval of the Investor.
The Investor and the New Series B Investors shall be entitled at any time to Transfer any Shares registered in their respective names to any of their respective Permitted Transferees.
For the avoidance of doubt, the provisions of Clause shall apply to Transfers to a Permitted Transferee.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Exit Strategy
Inclusion.p: Each of the Investor, the Company and the Founders shall use their best efforts to procure that, by no later than July 15, 2018:
(a) the Company achieves an underwritten public offering of its shares in a Qualified IPO; or
(b) a Trade Sale,
upon terms acceptable to the Investor.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Registration Rights
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: If at any time after the earlier of (i) three years after the Completion Date or (ii) six calendar months after the effective date of the registration statement for the Qualified IPO, the Company receives a request (the "Registration Request") from a holder of at least twenty percent (20%) of the shares initially purchased by the Investor that the Company file a Form F-1 registration statement (or such short form registration statement or any successor form thereto, or where the Board has agreed that the registration can be undertaken in any jurisdiction other than the United States of America, any comparable form for registration in a jurisdiction other than the United States of America that the Company is qualified to use to register the securities requested to be registered) for a public offering of Ordinary Shares, then the Company shall as soon as practicable, and in any event within sixty (60) days after such request is given by the Investor, use all reasonable efforts to file the registration statement covering all Ordinary Shares that the holder requested to be registered and cause the registration statement to become effective as soon as practicable.

Notwithstanding the foregoing obligations, if the Company furnishes to the Investor a certificate signed by the chief executive officer of the Company stating that in the good faith judgment of the Board it would be materially detrimental to the Company and the Shareholders for such registration statement to either become effective or remain effective for as long as it would otherwise be required to remain effective, because such action would:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: materially interfere with a significant acquisition, corporate reorganization, or other similar transaction involving the Company;
require premature disclosure of material information that the Company has a bona fide business purpose for preserving as confidential; or
render the Company unable to comply with requirements under applicable securities laws and regulation,
Inclusion.p: then the Company shall have the right to defer taking action with respect to such filing for a period of not more than one hundred twenty days (120) after the date of the Registration Request; provided, however, that the Company may not invoke this right more than once in any twelve (12) month period and may not register any securities for its own account or that of any other shareholder during such one hundred twenty (120) days period other than an Excluded Registration.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Company shall not be obligated to effect, or to take any action to effect, any registration pursuant to Clause :
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: during the period that is sixty days (60) before the Company’s good faith estimate of the date of filing of and ending on the date that is one hundred eighty (180) days after the effective date of a Company-initiated registration, provided that the Company is actively employs in good faith commercially reasonable efforts to cause such registration statement to become effective; or
after the Company has effected four registrations pursuant to Clause 18.1.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: If the Company proposes to register any of its Ordinary Shares in connection with the public offering of such securities solely for cash (other than in an Excluded Registration), or the Investor exercises its rights under Clause , then the Company shall, at least twenty (20) Business Days prior to filing any registration statement, give the Investor and the Qualifying Series B Investors notice of such registration which notice shall specify, to the extent known by the Company at such time and permissible under applicable laws: (i) the number of Ordinary Shares to be registered; (ii) the date that the Company intends to file for registration of such shares; (iii) the name of the managing underwriter(s); (iv) the means of distribution; and (v) a good faith estimate of the maximum offer price. Upon receipt of a request of the Investor and/or a Qualifying Series B Investor given within ten (10) days after such notice is given by the Company, the Company shall, subject to the provisions of Clause , cause all of the Ordinary Shares that the Investor and the Qualifying Series B Investors have requested to be included in the registration to be registered. The Investor and/or a Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) shall have the right to withdraw its request for inclusion at any time before the effective date of the registration. The expenses of such withdrawn registration shall be borne by the Company in accordance with Clause 18.8.

The Company shall have the right to terminate or withdraw any registration initiated by it under Clause before the effective date of such registration, whether or not the Investor or any Qualifying Series B Investor has elected to include any of its Shares in such registration. The expenses of such withdrawn registration shall be borne by the Company.

If the total number of Shares requested by the Investor and/or a Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) to be included in an offering under Clause exceeds the number of Shares to be sold that the underwriters in their reasonable discretion determine is compatible with the success of the offering, then the Company shall be required to include in the offering only that number of such Shares which the underwriters and the Company in their sole discretion determine will not jeopardize the success of the offering. If the underwriters advise that less than all of the Shares requested to be registered can be included in such offering, then the Shares that are included in such offering shall be allocated:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: first, among the Founders who are selling shareholders and the Investor pro rata the Investor’s and the Founders’ aggregate Shareholding in the Company (on a fully diluted basis) but in no event less than 25% of the total number of shares included in such offering, or in such other proportions as shall mutually be agreed to by the Company and the Investor; and
second, among the Qualifying Series B Investors who are selling Shareholders.
Inclusion.p: Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event shall (i) the number of Shares included in the offering be reduced unless all other Shares (other than Shares to be sold by the Company) are first entirely excluded from the offering, or (ii) the number of Shares included in the offering be reduced below twenty five (25) per cent of the total number of Shares included in such offering, unless such offering is the IPO, in which case the selling Shareholders may be excluded further if the underwriters make the determination described above and no other shareholders’ securities are included in such offering.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: There shall be no limit to the number of registrations that the Company shall be required to effect pursuant to Clause 18.4.

The Company will pay all reasonable Registration Expenses associated with the exercise of the Investor’s and the Qualifying Series B Investors’ registration rights pursuant to this Clause (Registration Rights); provided however that the Investor shall be liable for the Registration Expenses where a registration pursuant to Clause is withdrawn by the Investor unless (i) such withdrawal is notified to the Company by the holder prior to the termination of any deferral or postponement period pursuant to Clause or (ii) if at the time of such withdrawal, the holder shall have learned of a material adverse change in the condition, business, or prospects of the Company and has withdrawn the request with reasonable promptness after learning of such information.

If any Ordinary Shares are included in a registration statement by the Company, to the extent permitted by law, the Company shall indemnify and hold harmless the Investor and/or the Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable), their Affiliates, officers and directors, and any person who controls the Investor and/or the Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) (within the meaning of the Securities Act or the Exchange Act) (each an "Investor Indemnified Person") against any losses, claims, damages or liabilities (including any legal or other expenses reasonably incurred in connection with investigating or defending any such losses, claims, damages or liabilities) arising out of or caused by any of the following statements, omissions or violations (collectively a "Violation"):
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: any untrue statement or alleged untrue statement of a material fact contained or incorporated by reference in any registration statement, preliminary prospectus, final prospectus or free-writing prospectus or any amendments or supplements thereto;

any omission or alleged omission of a material fact required to be stated in, or necessary to make the statements therein not misleading, any preliminary prospectus, final prospectus or free-writing prospectus or any amendments or supplements thereto; or

any violation or alleged violation of the Securities Act, the Exchange Act, any federal or state securities law or any rule or regulation promulgated under the Securities Act, the Exchange Act or any United States of America federal or state securities law or any other applicable law in connection with the offering covered by such registration statement,
Inclusion.p: in each case except insofar as the Violation is caused by or contained in any information furnished in writing to the Company by the Investor and/or a Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) expressly for use in connection with the registration.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: If any Ordinary Shares are included in a registration statement by the Investor and/or a Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable), the Investor and/or the Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) shall:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: furnish to the Company in writing such information and affidavits as the company reasonably requests for use in connection with any such registration statement or prospectus; and

to the extent permitted by law, indemnify and hold harmless the Company, the Directors, each of its officers who have signed the registration statement and any person who controls the Company (within the meaning of the Securities Act or the Exchange Act) (each a "Company Indemnified Person"), against any losses, claims, damages or liabilities (including any legal or other expenses reasonably incurred in connection with investigating or defending any such losses, claims, damages or liabilities) arising out of or caused by any Violation (to the extent arising out of
Inclusion.p: paragraphs (a) or (b) of the definition thereof), but only to the extent that such Violation arises out of the information furnished by the Investor and/or the Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) pursuant to paragraph (a) above; provided, however, that the obligation to indemnify shall be limited to the net proceeds received by the Investor and/or the Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) from the sale of Ordinary Shares pursuant to the relevant registration statement, except in the case of fraud or willful misconduct by such Shareholder.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Any Indemnified Person shall:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: give prompt written notice to the Indemnifying Party of any claim with respect to which it seeks indemnification (provided that the failure to give prompt notice shall not impair any right to indemnification under Clauses 18.9 or 18.10 to the extent such failure has not prejudiced the Indemnifying Party); and

unless in the Indemnified Person’s reasonable judgment a conflict of interest between it and the Indemnifying Party may exist with respect to such claim, permit the Indemnifying Party to assume the defense of such claim with counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party. If such defense is assumed, the Indemnifying Party shall not be subject to any liability for any settlement made by the Indemnified Person without its consent (but such consent shall not be unreasonably withheld). An Indemnifying Party who is not entitled to, or elects not to, assume the defense of a claim shall not be obligated to pay the fees and expense of more than one counsel for all parties indemnified by it with respect to such claim, unless in the reasonable judgment of the Indemnified Person a conflict of interest may exist between it and any other indemnified parties with respect to such claim.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The obligations of the Company, the Investor and/or a Qualifying Series B Investor (as applicable) under Clauses 18.9 and 18.10 respectively shall survive for six (6) years after the completion of any offering of Ordinary Shares in a registration statement, regardless of the expiration of any statutes of limitation or extensions of such statutes.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Lock-Up Agreement
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: In the period leading up to and following a Qualified IPO, each Shareholder will comply with such restrictions on dealings in the Shares as may be required by the rules of the market of exchange on which the Shares are to be listed pursuant to a Qualified IPO.

Subject to each of the Directors and the Substantial Holders being subject to the same restrictions, at the request of any underwriter appointed by the Company in respect of a Qualified IPO, each Shareholder will not sell or Transfer its shares for a period of up to 180 days after the Qualified IPO and will enter into a market standoff agreement on customary terms (as required by the underwriter).

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Termination
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: This Agreement shall continue in force without limit in point of time until terminated (other than the Surviving Clauses) in accordance with the provisions of this Clause (Termination) or by agreement of the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors in writing, following which no Party shall have any claim against the other Parties, save for any claim arising from antecedent breach of the terms hereof.
Other than as set out in Clause below, this Agreement shall terminate forthwith upon the completion of a Qualified IPO.
This Agreement shall terminate forthwith if the Company is put into liquidation, whether voluntary or compulsory.

Upon any of the Shareholders ceasing to be a shareholder or a party to this Agreement for any reason, the provisions of this Agreement will cease to be applicable to such Shareholder as if it were not a party to this Agreement, save for Surviving Clauses and save for such rights, benefits and obligations as have accrued to it at the date of its ceasing to be a Shareholder or a party to this Agreement and save further that the right of any Shareholder to claim damages or any other remedies by reason of any breach of this Agreement by any other Shareholder which has accrued prior to any Shareholder so ceasing shall not be affected.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, subject to Completion taking place, the rights of the Investor and the Qualifying Series B Investors to request registration or inclusion of Shares in any registration pursuant to Clause (Registration Rights) shall terminate upon the earliest to occur of:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: the closing of an Equity Sale;

such time as Rule 144 or another similar exemption under the Securities Act is available for the sale of all of such Shareholder’s shares without limitation during a three-month period without registration; and
the third anniversary of the Qualified IPO.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Confidentiality
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Each Party agrees and undertakes to the other Parties that it shall (and shall procure that its agents and where applicable its officers and employees shall):
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: not, without the prior written consent of the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors in relation to Confidential Information or the Party whose Third Party Confidential Information is subject to the proposed use or disclosure, use or disclose to any person Confidential Information (in the case of the Shareholders) or Third Party Confidential Information (save for those in relation to itself) it has or acquires; and
make every effort to prevent the use or disclosure of Confidential Information (in the case of the Shareholders) or Third Party Confidential Information (save for those in relation to itself).
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The confidentiality obligation under Clause shall not apply to:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: any information which becomes generally known to the public, other than by reason of any wilful or negligent act or omission of a Party;

any information which is required to be disclosed pursuant to any applicable law or any requirement of any competent governmental or statutory authority or pursuant to rules or regulations of any relevant regulatory, administrative or supervisory body (including without limitation, any relevant stock exchange or securities council);
any information which is required to be disclosed pursuant to any legal process issued by any court or tribunal whether in Singapore or elsewhere;

any information disclosed by any Party to its bankers, financial advisers, consultants and legal or other advisers for the purpose of this Agreement on a strict need-to-know basis and who are under similar duties of confidentiality; and

any disclosure in any prospectus in connection with a Qualified IPO which is deemed necessary or desirable by the lead manager of such Qualified IPO provided that the Investor and the New Series B Investors shall be provided with a draft of any such disclosure prior to its publication or disclosure.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Shareholders shall procure that the Company shall use all reasonable endeavours to procure that its subsidiaries (if any) shall and the directors, officers, employees, agents and representatives of its subsidiaries (if any) shall observe a similar obligation of confidence in favour of the Shareholders.

Notwithstanding Clause , the Founders and Company may disclose Confidential Information to any potential investor or potential purchaser of all the Shares and/or in connection with a Trade Sale at the relevant time provided always that they shall procure the recipient of the Confidential Information to sign a confidentiality undertaking on terms which are reasonable for the protection of the interests of the Company. The other Shareholders shall take all steps to procure that the Company and its subsidiaries and their respective directors, officers, employees, agents and representatives provide the necessary assistance to the potential purchaser and its advisers in the conduct of any due diligence exercise proposed to be undertaken by the potential purchaser in connection with the sale and purchase of the Shares and/or the Trade Sale.

The obligations contained in this Clause (Confidentiality) shall endure, notwithstanding the termination of this Agreement, without limit in point of time except and until any Confidential Information or Third Party Confidential Information enters the public domain as set out above.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Announcements
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: No Party shall make or authorise the making of any announcement or other public disclosure concerning the existence or subject matter of this Agreement unless the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors shall have given their respective consent to such announcement or public disclosure (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed).
Clause shall not apply to:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: any information which is required to be disclosed pursuant to any applicable law or any requirement of any competent governmental or statutory authority or rules or regulations of any relevant regulatory, administrative or supervisory body (including without limitation, any relevant stock exchange or securities council);
any information which is required to be disclosed pursuant to any legal process issued by any court or tribunal whether in Singapore or elsewhere; and

any disclosure in any prospectus in connection with a Qualified IPO which is deemed necessary or desirable by the lead manager of such Qualified IPO provided that the Investor shall be provided with a draft of any such disclosure prior to its publication or disclosure.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Where any announcement or public disclosure is made in reliance on the exceptions set out in Clause , the Party making the announcement or public disclosure shall consult with the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors in advance as to the form, content and timing of such announcement or public disclosure.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Costs
Inclusion.p: Each Party shall bear its own legal and other costs and expenses of and incidental to the negotiation, preparation, execution and performance by it of this Agreement and all ancillary documents and the subscription hereby agreed to be made.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: General
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Parties agree that any applicable rule requiring the construction of this Agreement or any provision hereof against the Party drafting this Agreement shall not apply.
Where this Agreement provides that any particular Transaction or matter requires the consent, approval or agreement of any Party:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: such consent, approval or agreement may be given subject to such terms and conditions as such Party may impose and any breach of such terms and conditions by any person subject thereto shall ipso facto be deemed to be a breach of the terms of this Agreement; and

the consent, approval or agreement of the Directors nominated by such Party to that Transaction or matter (either in writing or given orally at a duly convened meeting of the Board (provided the same is accurately minuted)) shall be deemed to be the consent, approval or agreement of such Party for the purposes of this Agreement.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: If the consent, approval or agreement of any Party is required under more than one provision of this Agreement for any one Transaction or matter, then any consent, approval or agreement given in relation to that Transaction or matter by such Party shall be deemed to cover all consents, approvals or agreement required for that Transaction or matter unless otherwise specified by such Party.

In the event of any conflict between the provisions of this Agreement and memorandum and articles of association of the Company, the provisions of this Agreement shall prevail and the Shareholders shall, where possible, forthwith cause such necessary alterations to be made to the memorandum and articles of the Company as are required so as to remove such conflict.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Illegality
Inclusion.p: If any provision of this Agreement is or becomes illegal, invalid or unenforceable in any respect under the law of any jurisdiction, it will be deemed to be severed from this Agreement and the Parties will use all reasonable endeavours to replace such provision with one having an effect as close as possible to the deficient provision. The illegality, invalidity or unenforceability of any provision of this Agreement under the law of any jurisdiction shall not affect its legality, validity or enforceability under the law of any other jurisdiction nor the legality, validity or enforceability of any other provision.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Notices
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Each and every communication under this Agreement shall be made by facsimile, electronic mail or otherwise in writing. Each communication or document to be delivered to any Party shall be sent to that Party at the facsimile number, electronic mail address or mailing address and marked for the attention of the person (if any), from time to time designated by that Party for the purpose of this Agreement. Where a Party has failed to designate any address, for the purposes of any notices pursuant to this Clause (Notices) the relevant address for such Party shall be deemed to be the address on record for such party in the Company’s filings with the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore.
A demand, notice or other communication made or given by one Party to the other Parties in accordance with this Clause (Notices) shall be effected and deemed to be duly served:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: if it is delivered, when left at the address required by this Clause (Notices);
if it is sent by prepaid post (air-mail, if international), five (5) days after it is posted; or
if it sent by facsimile or electronic mail, on the day of despatch.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: In proving such service it shall be sufficient to prove that delivery by hand was made or that the envelope containing such notice or document was properly addressed and posted as a prepaid ordinary mail or that the facsimile confirmation note indicates the transmission was successful.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Further Assurance
Inclusion.p: Each Party shall do and execute or procure to be done and executed all such further acts, deeds, things and documents as may be necessary to give effect to the terms of this Agreement, and (so far as it is able) to provide such assistance as the other Parties may reasonably request (including without limitation, exercising its power as shareholders) to give effect to the spirit and intent of this Agreement.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Entire Agreement
Inclusion.p: This Agreement, and the documents referred to in it, constitutes the entire agreement and understanding between the Parties relating to the subject matter of this Agreement and no Party has entered into this Agreement in reliance upon any representation, warranty or undertaking of the other Parties which is not set out or referred to in this Agreement. Nothing in this Clause (Entire Agreement) shall however operate to limit or exclude liability for fraud.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Assignment
Inclusion.p: Save as specifically provided in this Agreement, no Party shall (nor shall it purport to) assign, transfer, charge or otherwise deal with all or any of its rights under this Agreement nor grant, declare or dispose of any right or interest in it without the prior written consent of the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Variations
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Subject to Clause , no variation of this Agreement (or any document referred to in this Agreement) shall be valid unless it is in writing and signed by or on behalf of each Party. The expression “variation” shall include any amendment, supplement, deletion or replacement however effected.

A variation of the terms of this Agreement (including without limitation, in connection with a future fundraising or issuance of preference shares in the capital of the Company) approved by the Board will be binding on all Parties if agreed by the Majority Shareholders, the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors.

If a Shareholder, other than the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors, does not accept or reject a variation within ten (10) Business Days (unless the Board agrees to a longer time period) of any request for consent to a variation being made, or abstains from
Inclusion.p: accepting or rejecting such variation, such Shareholder shall be deemed to have consented to such variation.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Following the receipt of consent to a variation pursuant to Clause and 30.3, the Founders may effect on behalf of all Parties any variations so permitted.

Unless expressly agreed, no variation shall affect any rights, obligations or liabilities under or pursuant to this Agreement which have already accrued up to the date of variation, and the rights and obligations of the Parties under or pursuant to this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect except and only to the extent they are so varied.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Remedies And Waivers
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: No failure on the part of any Party to exercise, and no delay on its part in exercising, any right or remedy under this Agreement will operate as a waiver thereof, nor will any single or partial exercise of any right or remedy preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other right or remedy. The rights provided in this Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive of any rights or remedies provided by law.
Any Party may release or compromise the liability hereunder of any other Party or grant to any such Party time or other indulgence without affecting the liability of any other Party hereunder.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Several Obligations
Inclusion.p: All covenants, undertakings and other obligations given or entered into by the Parties are given or entered into severally unless the context otherwise requires.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: No Partnership
Inclusion.p: The Parties to this Agreement are not in a partnership with each other and there is no relationship of principal and agent, or any fiduciary relationship or association between them. No Party shall have any authority to create or assume in the name or on behalf of the other Parties any obligation, expressed or implied, or to act or purport to act as the agent or the legally empowered representative of the other Parties for any purpose whatsoever.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Time Of Essence
Inclusion.p: Any date, time or period mentioned in any provision of this Agreement may be extended by mutual agreement between the Founders, the Investor and the New Series B Investors but as regards any time, date or period originally fixed and not extended or any time, date or period so extended as aforesaid, time shall be of the essence.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Force Majeure
Inclusion.p: Save as is otherwise specifically provided in this Agreement, the Parties shall not be liable for failures or delays in performing their obligations hereunder arising from any cause beyond their control, including without limitation, acts of God, acts of civil or military authority, fires, strikes, lockouts or labour disputes, epidemics, governmental restrictions, wars, riots, earthquakes, storms, typhoons, floods and breakdowns in electronic and computer information and communications systems and in the event of any such delay, the time for all Parties' performance shall be extended for a period equal to the time lost by reason of the delay which shall be remedied with all due despatch in the circumstances.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Counterparts
Inclusion.p: This Agreement may be signed in any number of counterparts, all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Any Party may enter into this Agreement by signing any such counterpart and each counterpart shall be as valid and effectual as if executed as an original.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Contracts (Rights Of Third Parties) Act
Inclusion.p: A person who is not party to this Agreement has no rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act (Chapter 53B of Singapore) to enforce any term of this Agreement, but this does not affect any right or remedy of a third party which exists or is available apart from the said Act.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Governing Law
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of Singapore.
The Parties agree to submit to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Singapore.

Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: COMPANY
Inclusion.p: The particulars relating to the Company Set out in Schedule 2 (Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table) and Schedule 3 (Particulars of the Company) are true and accurate in all respects and are not misleading, it being acknowledged by the Parties that any projections are meant merely to be projections and not any guarantees of future performance.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: ACCOUNTS
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Compliance with Law and Accounting Standards
Inclusion.p: The statutory accounts of the Company have been prepared in accordance with all applicable laws and generally accepted accounting standards, policies, principles and practices at the date hereof in the jurisdiction which the Company may be subject to the laws of.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Auditors
Inclusion.p: Where required, the accounts of the Company have been audited by an auditor or firm of accountants qualified to act as auditors in Singapore and any auditors’ report(s) required to be annexed to the accounts is unqualified.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Fair View
Inclusion.p: The statutory accounts of the Company give a fair view of the state of affairs of the Company as at their respective dates and the profits and losses, changes in equity and cash flows of the Company for the relevant financial period, it being acknowledged by the Parties that any projections are meant merely to be projections and not any guarantees of future performance.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Provisions
Inclusion.p: The accounts of the Company make:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: full provision for all actual liabilities in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
proper and adequate provision (or note in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles) for all contingent liabilities;
proper and adequate provision or reserve for all bad and doubtful debts to the extent that are identifiable; and
provision for depreciation and amortisation for any obsolescence of assets in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Taxation
Inclusion.p: Full provision or reserve has been made in the accounts for any taxation liable to be assessed on the Company or for which it is or may become accountable in respect of:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: profits, gains or income (as computed for taxation purposes) arising or accruing or deemed to arise or accrue on or before the date of the respective accounts;
any Transactions effected or deemed to be effected on or before the date of the respective accounts of the Company or provided for in such accounts;
distributions made or deemed to be made on or before the date of the respective accounts of the Company or provided for in such accounts; and
deferred taxation.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Profits
Inclusion.p: The profits and losses of the Company as shown by its accounts and the trend of profits thereby shown have not (except as therein disclosed) been affected by inconsistencies in generally accepted accounting principles, by the inclusion of unusual or non-recurring items of income or expenditure, by Transactions entered into otherwise than on normal commercial terms or by any other factors rendering such profits for all or any of such periods exceptionally high or low (other than as disclosed in the relevant accounts).
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Consistent Basis
Inclusion.p: The accounts of the Company have been prepared on a basis consistent with past years' accounts without any changes in generally accepted accounting policies used.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Filings
Inclusion.p: The accounts of the Company have been filed in accordance with the requirements of the Companies Act.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Transactions Affecting the Accounts
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The Company does not have any outstanding loan capital, except as disclosed in the Data Room, nor has it factored any of its debts, or engaged in financing of a type which would not be required to be shown or reflected in its accounts or borrowed any money which it has not repaid (save as disclosed in the relevant accounts and the Pro- Forma Capitalisation Table).

There are no liabilities (including contingent liabilities) which are outstanding on the part of the Company, other than those liabilities disclosed in the latest accounts of the Company, the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table or which have arisen in the ordinary course of business since the date of such accounts.

No Transaction of any importance to which the Company has been party has taken place which, if it had taken place on or before the date of the respective accounts of the Company, would have been required to be disclosed or reflected in such accounts.

Revenue costs of an occasional or seasonal nature (including any holiday pay, closure and redundancy costs of fixed-term projects or contracts, bonuses, customer rebates, excess use charges under leasing agreements and maintenance, repairs and renewals) are accrued in statutory accounts so as to match them as closely as possible to the related income and provided in the respective accounts of the Company to the extent of the accrual as at the date of such accounts.

No value was attributed in the accounts of the Company to any asset which was not beneficially owned by the Company at the date of such accounts, or which in the case of fixed assets, were not in full and exclusive use for the purposes of the Company’s business.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: CHANGES SINCE LATEST AVAILABLE ACCOUNTS Since the May 2014 accounts:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: the business of the Company has been lawfully carried on in the ordinary course of business so as to maintain the same as a going concern;

the Company has not disposed of any material assets or assumed or incurred any material liabilities (including contingent liabilities) otherwise than in the ordinary course of carrying on its business;

the business of the Company has not been adversely affected by the loss of any key customers or suppliers or by any abnormal factor not affecting similar businesses to a like extent or by any other cause and the Company and each of the Founders, after making due and careful enquiries, is not aware of any facts which are likely to give rise to any such effects;
no dividend or other distribution has been, or agreed to be, declared, made or paid to its members except as provided for in the accounts of the Company;
the Company has not borrowed any money or issued any guarantee or created any Encumbrance over any asset other than as disclosed in its accounts or in the ordinary course of business;
no share or loan capital has been allotted, issued, repaid or redeemed and no agreement or arrangement has been made to do any of the foregoing save as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table;
the Company has not entered into any unusual, long term or onerous commitments or contracts;
after making due and careful enquiries, the Company has not learnt of any circumstance making bad or doubtful any of its book debts;
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, there has been no material adverse change in its business, operations, assets or financial condition;
Inclusion.p: (j) the Company has not knowingly waived or released any proprietary rights howsoever arising;

(k) the Company has not acquired or disposed of or granted any right or option or created any other Encumbrance, save for those created as set out in and/or pursuant to this Agreement and those in the ordinary course of business;

(l) no change has been made to the generally acceptable accounting principles adopted in relation to the Company and the accounting practices adopted for the Company are consistent with those adopted in its previous accounts;

(m) the Company has changed its accounting reference date from 31 December after the 12 months to 31 December 2012 to 30 June with the subsequant accounting periods being 6 months to 30 June 2013 and year ended 30 June 2014 and yearly thereafter; and
(n) no claims resulting in damages has been made against the Company.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: TAXATION
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Payment of Taxes
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: All taxes assessed or imposed by any government or governmental or statutory body which have been assessed upon the Company and which are due and payable on or before Completion have been paid and were paid on or before the relevant due date for payment.

To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, there is no further liability or contingent liability for taxation otherwise than as a result of trading activities in the ordinary course of the Company's business.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Penalties and Interest
Inclusion.p: Neither the Company nor any of its directors or officers has paid, or become liable to pay, any fine, penalty or interest charged by virtue of any other statutory provision relating to taxation.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Tax Investigation
Inclusion.p: The Company has not been the subject of an investigation, discovery or access order by or involving any taxation authority and there are no circumstances existing which make it likely that an investigation, discovery or order will be made.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: EMPLOYEES
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Save for the Plan and other than as disclosed in the Data Room, the Company does not have in existence, nor is proposing or bound to introduce, any incentive scheme, share incentive scheme, share option scheme, profit sharing scheme or other bonus commission or incentive scheme for all or any part of its directors or employees.
The size of the Option Pool under the Plan is 20,000,000 Ordinary Shares.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: There are no existing agreements, contracts, arrangements, understandings, engagements or proposed transactons to which the Company is a party and in which the Founders and/or any director, officer, employee or shareholder of the Company and/or any of their affiliates is directly or indirectly interested.

No Founder, director, officer, employee or shareholder of the Company and/or any of their affiliates is indebted to the Company, nor is the Company indebted (or committed to make loans or extend or guarantee credit) to any of them other than (i) for payment of accrued and current salary or other benefits (including any benefits pursuant to the terms of the Plan) in connection with their employment with the Company and (ii) as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: CONTRACTS
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: General
Inclusion.p: To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, none of the contracts or purported contracts of the Company is void, voidable or unenforceable by it. To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, the Company is not in breach of any of its contractual obligations and no other party to any contract to which the Company is a party is in breach of that contract or is unlikely to be able or willing to fulfil its contractual obligations.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Material Contracts
Inclusion.p: No notice of termination of any material contract has been received or served by the Company and there are no grounds for determination, rescission, avoidance, repudiation or a material change in the terms of any such contract.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Long Term and Other Onerous Contracts
Inclusion.p: The Company is not a party to or subject to any material agreement or arrangement which:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: is of an unusual or exceptional nature;
is entered into otherwise than in the ordinary and usual course of business of the Company;
may be terminated as a result of any change in shareholding in the Company;
restricts the freedom of the Company to carry on the whole or any part of its business in any part of the world in such manner as it thinks fit;
is of an onerous or long-term nature; and
is or may become terminable or which contain provisions which may operate adversely against the Company as a result of the entry into or completion of this Agreement.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Compliance
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The terms of all leases, tenancies, licences, concessions, agencies, franchises and agreements of whatsoever nature to which the Company is a party have been duly complied with by it.

No such lease, tenancy, licence, concession, agency, franchise or agreement will become subject to avoidance, revocation or be otherwise affected upon or in consequence of the making or implementation of this Agreement.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: INSURANCE
Inclusion.p: Each insurable asset of the Company is at the date of this Agreement insured in accordance with the Company’s comprehensive business policy, against fire and other risks normally insured against by persons operating the types of businesses operated by the Company. The Company has at all times been and is at the date of this Agreement adequately insured against accident, damage, injury, third party loss, loss of profits and all other risks to which persons operating the types of businesses operated by the Company is exposed.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: ASSETS AND PROPERTIES
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: The Company has good and marketable title to its properties and assets, and has good title to all its leasehold interests, in each case subject to no Encumbrances.
Product Liabilities
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: Save for any condition or warranty implied by law, the Company has not given any guarantee, condition or warranty or made any representation in respect of goods or services supplied or contracted to be supplied by it or accepted any obligation which could give rise to any liability after any such goods or services have been supplied by it.

The Company has no reason to believe that any products or line of goods currently in stock or in the course of production or any material proportion thereof is not or will not prove to be of merchantable quality and fit for its purpose.

The Company has not received notice of any claim which remains outstanding alleging any defect in or lack of fitness for purpose of any goods supplied by the Company, nor to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company are there any circumstances which could give rise to any such claim.

The Company has not received notice of any claim which remains outstanding alleging the failure to perform, either properly or at all, any services performed or to be performed by the Company nor to the best of the information, knowledge and
Inclusion.p: belief of the Company are there any circumstances which could give rise to any such claims.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Ownership
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: Each of the Intellectual Property Rights used or required by the Company in connection with its business (including without limitation, all and any products manufactured, assembled and/or sold or leased or rented by it) is:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: in full force and effect and valid and enforceable and nothing has been done or omitted to be done by or on behalf of the Company by which it may cease to be valid and enforceable;
in the case of Intellectual Property Rights developed and owned by the Company, legally and beneficially owned by the Company alone free from any licence;
vested in and validly granted to the Company free from any Encumbrance, restriction on use or disclosure obligation; and
not, and will not be, the subject of a claim or opposition from a person (including without limitation, an employee of the Company) as to title, validity, enforceability, entitlement or otherwise.
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The Intellectual Property Rights used by the Company comprise all the Intellectual Property Rights used or required by the Company in connection with its business as it has been operated before the date of this Agreement. The Company does not require any other patent, trade or service mark, registered design, copyright, design right, licence or other right of any other person in order to manufacture or sell or lease its products or to use the processes employed in its business as presently carried on.

The Company is the sole beneficial owner of the Intellectual Property Rights used by it and (where registration is possible) it has been and is registered as proprietor in the relevant territories of use, and none of them is being used, claimed, opposed or attached by any other person.

To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company the activities, processes, methods, services or Intellectual Property Rights used, dealt in or supplied on or before the date of this Agreement by the Company:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: are not at the date of this Agreement, nor were they at the time used, dealt in or supplied, subject to the licence, consent or permission of, or payment to, another person;

do not at the date of this Agreement, nor did they at the time used, dealt in or supplied, infringe, misuse or embody the subject matter of any rights in the Intellectual Property Rights of another person; and
have not given, and will not give, rise to a claim against the Company.
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The Company has not granted and is not obliged to grant a licence, assignment, consent, undertaking, security interest or other right in respect of any of the Intellectual Property Rights used by the Company.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Claims and Infringement
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: No right or licence has been granted to any person by the Company to use in any manner or to do anything which, to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, would or might otherwise infringe any of the Intellectual Property Rights referred to above.

To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, none of the activities of the Company infringes any patent or other intellectual property of any kind whatsoever of any other person or gives rise to an obligation to pay any sum in the nature of a royalty.

To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, the business (including without limitation, all and any products manufactured, assembled and/or sold or leased or rented by it) of the Company (and of any licensee under a licence granted by the Company) as now carried on does not and is not likely to infringe any Intellectual Property Right of any other person (or would not do so if the same were valid) or give rise to a liability pursuant to intellectual property laws.
No party to an agreement relating to the use:
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: by the Company of Intellectual Property Rights owned by another person; or
of any Intellectual Property Rights owned by the Company by another person,
Inclusion.p: is, to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, or has at any time been, in breach of the agreement and no circumstances exist which would give rise to any breach of any such agreement or to any such agreement being terminated, suspended, varied or revoked without the Company's consent (other than termination without cause upon notice in accordance with the terms of the agreement). To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company all such agreements are in full force and effect and there is not, and never has been, an infringement or unauthorised use by a party to such agreement of any Intellectual Property Right which is the subject matter of such agreement.
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: There is, and since the date of incorporation of the Company has been, no civil, criminal, arbitration or other proceeding or dispute involving the Company in any jurisdiction concerning any of the Intellectual Property Rights. To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, no such proceeding or dispute is pending or threatened and no fact or circumstance exist which might give rise to a proceeding of that type.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Confidentiality
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The Company has not (otherwise than in the ordinary and normal course of business) disclosed or permitted to be disclosed or undertaken or arranged to disclose to any person other than the Investor, the New Series B Investors and other investors any of its know-how, trade secrets, confidential information, price lists or lists of customers or suppliers.

The Company is not subject to any secrecy arrangement or agreement and is not otherwise subject to any duty which may restrict the use or disclosure of information other than pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and any arrangement or agreement that is a customary term of any agreement entered into in the ordinary course of business.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Validity of Agreements
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: Nothing has been done or omitted to be done and no circumstance exist by which a person is or will be able to seek cancellation, termination, rectification or other modication of a registration of, or any licence, agreement or arrangement relating to, any Intellectual Property Rights.

Nothing has been done or omitted to be done by the Company which in any way constitutes a breach of the terms of any licence, agreement or arrangement relating to any Intellectual Property Rights granted by or to it.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Renewal and Maintenance Fees
Inclusion.p: All renewal and maintenance fees and taxes due and payable prior to Completion in respect of each pending and registered Intellectual Property Rights have been paid in full. Each other action required to maintain and protect the pending and registered Intellectual Property Rights has been taken.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: COMPUTERS AND COMPUTER SYSTEMS
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Right to Use
Inclusion.p: The Company owns, possesses and/or has a legal right to use all the rights necessary to use the IT Systems in the manner in which they are presently being used.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Control
Inclusion.p: The IT Systems are not dependent on any network or software not under the direct control of the Company.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: No breach
Inclusion.p: The Company is not, and to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, no other party to the material agreements or arrangements relating to the IT Systems, including support and maintenance agreements, is in breach of them.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: IT Systems
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: All IT Systems (including without limitation, computer servers) owned by the Company or used by or on behalf of the Company (including software, peripherals, communications links and storage media):
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: are in full operating order and are fulfilling the purposes for which they were acquired or are established in an efficient manner without material downtime or errors;
have adequate capacity for the Company’s present needs;
have adequate security, back-ups, duplication, hardware and software support and maintenance (including emergency cover) and trained personnel to ensure:
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: that breaches of security, errors and breakdowns are kept to a minimum; and
that no disruption will be caused to its business or any part thereof in the event of a breach of security, error or breakdown; and
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: are under its sole control, are located in premises within Singapore or a virtual private cloud owned or leased by the Company, are not shared with or
Inclusion.p: used by or on behalf of or accessible by any other person and (save for software licensed to it) are owned or leased by the Company.
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: All software used on or stored or resident in the said IT Systems:
Inclusion.numbered_6_para: perform efficiently in accordance with their respective specification and does not contain any defect or feature which may adversely affect their respective performance or the performance of any other software;

to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, are lawfully held and used and does not infringe the copyright or other Intellectual Property Rights of any person and all copies held have been lawfully made;
Inclusion.numbered_7_para: in the case of software written or commissioned by the Company, are owned exclusively by it;

in the case of standard package software purchased outright, are licensed to it on an express or implied licence which does not require it to make any further payments, are not terminable without its consent and which imposes no restrictions (save as to copying) on the use or transfer of the software; and

in the case of all other software, is licensed to it on the terms of a written licence which is not terminable (save for failure to pay the licence fee) without its consent and imposes no restrictions (save as to copying) on the use or transfer of the software; and
Inclusion.numbered_6_para: comprised in any third party Intellectual Property Rights used by the Company or intended to be used in its business is licensed to the Company under a written licence, which contains no onerous or unusual terms, authorizes the use of the software by the Company, authorises use of the software in the manner and on the scale on which it is currently used or intended to be used; and does not expire.
Inclusion.numbered_5_para: No software owned by or licensed to the Company is used by or licensed or sub- licensed by it to any other person.
All records and data stored by electronic means are capable of ready access through the present computer systems of the Company.

No person is in a position, by virtue of his rights in, knowledge of or access to any of the IT Systems used by the Company or any part of them (including software) to demand any payment in excess of any current licence fee or in excess of reasonable remuneration for services rendered, or to impose any onerous condition, in order to preserve the proper and efficient functioning of the computer systems in the future.

The appropriate employees are adequately trained to enable them to use and operate the IT Systems owned or used by the Company (including software, peripherals and storage media) to the full extent of the capabilities of those systems to the extent required by the Company without assistance from any other person. The IT Systems include sufficient user information as to enable reasonably skilled IT personnel in the field to use and operate the IT Systems without the need for further assistance.
In relation to the IT Systems (including without limitation, computer servers) owned by the Company or used by or on behalf of the Company (including software,
Inclusion.p: peripherals, communications links and storage media) to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company:
Inclusion.numbered_6_para: such IT Systems are capable of processing data correctly and consistently with reference to any and all dates, including without limitation, any date in any century or leap year;

the performance and functionality of such IT System will not be adversely affected by any date or any change of date used by or stored within such IT Systems, including without limitation, any date or change of date after the Completion Date; and

all output from such IT System, including without limitation, any output for any interface to other hardware, software or systems will in relation to any date contained within such output explicitly and unambiguously identify the date in full, including without limitation, the century within which the date falls.
Inclusion.numbered_7_para: Save to the extent provided in the IT Contracts, the Company is the legal and beneficial owner of the IT Systems free from Encumbrances. The Company has obtained all necessary rights from third parties to enable them to make exclusive and unrestricted use of the IT Systems.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: IT Contracts
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The IT Contracts are valid and binding and no act or omission has occurred which would, to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, (if necessary with the giving of notice or lapse of time) constitute a breach of any such contract.
There are and have been no claims, disputes or proceedings arising under any IT Contracts.
None of the IT Contracts are liable to be terminated or would otherwise be materially affected by the subscription of the Series B CPS.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: General
Inclusion.p: The Company has a disaster recovery plan which would enable the business of the Company to continue if there were significant damage to or destruction of some or all of the IT Systems.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: CORPORATE MATTERS
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Due Incorporation
Inclusion.p: The Company has been duly incorporated and is validly existing under the laws of its country of incorporation and is not in receivership or liquidation. The Company has requisite corporate power and authority to own and operate its properties and assets, to carry on its business as presently conducted, to execute and deliver this Agreement, to issue the Series B CPS and to perform its obligations pursuant to this Agreement and the Amended Articles.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Share Capital
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The Company has not exercised any lien over any of its issued shares.

The Company has not reduced, repaid or purchased any of its share capital, and save as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table there are no options or other agreements outstanding which call for the issue of or accord to any person the right to
Inclusion.p: call for the issue of any shares in the capital of the Company or the right to require the creation of any Encumbrance over any shares in its share capital.
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: Except for this Agreement and save as set out in the Pro-Forma Capitalisation Table, there is no option, right to acquire, mortgage, charge, pledge, lien or other form of security or Encumbrance on, over or affecting the shares or capital in, or any of the assets or businesses of, the Company and there is no agreement or commitment to give or create any of the foregoing.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Compliance
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: The Company has complied with its memorandum and articles of association (or the equivalent constitutive documents) in all respects and none of the activities, agreements, commitments or rights of the Company is ultra vires or unauthorised.

All governmental approvals, licences and authorisations which were necessary or desirable in connection with the incorporation of the Company, the allotment or transfer of shares in the Company to the present and former holders thereof and the activation of the Company (including the appointment of directors) were duly obtained.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: SUBSIDIARIES AND ASSOCIATED COMPANIES
Inclusion.p: The Company is not the legal or beneficial owner or holder of any share or has any interest of any description in any other corporation and does not have any subsidiary nor associated company.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: STATUTORY AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS, CONSENTS AND LICENCES
Inclusion.numbered_4_para: The Company has carried on its business in accordance with applicable laws, regulations and by-laws in its country of incorporation or elsewhere and (i) to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company there is no investigation or enquiry by, or order, decree or judgment of, any court or any governmental agency or regulatory body outstanding or anticipated against the Company or which may have an adverse effect upon its assets or business and (ii) no notice in writing has been received by the Company in respect of the same.

All statutory and other requirements applicable to the carrying on of the business of the Company as now carried on, and all conditions applicable to any licences and consents involved in the carrying on of such business, have been complied with and the Company and each of the Founders is not aware of any breach thereof or of any intended or contemplated refusal or revocation of any such licence or consent.
The Company has obtained, and has complied with the terms and conditions of each Permit.

Each Permit is in force, unimpeachable and unconditional or subject only to a condition that has been satisfied. No expenditure or work is or will be necessary to comply with, maintain or obtain a Permit. To the best of the Company's and each Founder's knowledge, information and belief, no Permit will be revoked, suspended, cancelled, varied or not renewed.
Each action required for the renewal or extension of each Permit has been taken.
No Permit will be revoked, suspended, cancelled, varied or not renewed as a result of the execution or performance of this Agreement or any document to be executed at or before Completion.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: LITIGATION
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Litigation
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: Neither the Company nor to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company a person for whose acts or defaults the Company may be vicariously liable is involved, or has since the date of incorporation of the Company been involved, in a civil, criminal, arbitration, administrative or other proceeding (other than as plaintiff in the collection of debts arising in the ordinary course of its business) and no notice in writing has been received by the Company in respect of the same.

To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, no fact or circumstance exists which might give rise to a civil, criminal, arbitration, administrative or other proceeding involving the Company or a person for whose acts or defaults the Company may be vicariously liable (other than involvement as plaintiff in the collection of debts arising in the ordinary course of its business).

Neither the Company nor any person for whose acts or defaults the Company may be vicariously liable has committed any criminal, illegal or other unlawful act or any breach of contract or statutory duty or any tortious or other act or default which could lead to a claim or proceedings against the Company or give rise to or increase the liability or obligation of the Company or which could entitle any other person to terminate any contract to which the Company is a party.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Judgments
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, there is not in force any court injunction, order or directive restraining or restricting the Company from carrying on its business or any part thereof or entering into this Agreement.

To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, there is no outstanding judgment, order or decree of any court, tribunal or regulatory or government body or any undertaking to any court, judicial authority or regulatory or government body or any outstanding arbitration award against the Company or a person for whose acts or defaults the Company may be vicariously liable.

To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, there are no civil, criminal, administrative or disciplinary or arbitration proceedings in progress, pending or threatened against the Company or a person for whose acts or defaults the Company may be vicariously liable and there are no facts likely to give rise to any such proceedings.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Investigations
Inclusion.p: There is not and has not been any governmental or other investigations, inquiries or disciplinary proceedings by or before any regulatory, administrative, supervisory or government body concerning the Company, whether on-going, pending or threatened and to the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, no fact or circumstance exist which might give rise to any such investigation, inquiry or proceedings.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Unlawful Payments
Inclusion.p: Neither the Company, nor any person for whose acts or defaults the Company may be vicariously liable has induced a person to enter into an agreement or arrangement with the Company by means of an unlawful or immoral payment, bribe, contribution, gift or other inducement or has given or offered or made an unlawful or immoral payment, bribe, contribution, gift or other inducement to a government official or employee.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Convictions
Inclusion.p: The Company has not been convicted of any offence. To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company no officer, employee, agent or former officer, agent or employee of the Company has been convicted of any offences in relation to the Company, and, To the best of the information, knowledge and belief of the Company, no executive officer of the Company has been convicted of any offence (save for any traffic offence) which reflects upon his suitability to hold his position or upon the reputation of the Company.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: INSOLVENCY
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Winding up and Administration
Inclusion.p: No order has been made or petition presented or resolution passed for the winding-up or administration or for the appointment of a provisional liquidator of the Company, nor are there any grounds on which any person would be entitled to have the Company wound-up or placed in administration, nor has any person threatened to present such a petition or convened or threatened to convene a meeting of the Company to consider a resolution to wind up the Company or any other resolutions, nor has any step been taken in relation to the Company under the law relating to insolvency or the relief of debtors in any part of the world.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Receivership
Inclusion.p: No person has appointed or threatened to appoint or become entitled to appoint a receiver or receiver and manager or other similar officer of the Company's business or assets or any part of them.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Arrangements
Inclusion.p: No composition in satisfaction of the debts of the Company, or scheme of arrangement of its affairs, or compromise or arrangement between it and its creditors and/or members or any class of its creditors and/or members, has been proposed, sanctioned or approved.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Payment of Debts
Inclusion.p: The Company has not ceased trading nor stopped payment to its creditors and there are no grounds on which the Company could be found to be unable to pay its debts within the meaning of Section 254 of the Companies Act.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Distress
Inclusion.p: No distress, execution or other process has been levied on any asset owned or used by the Company, nor has any person threatened any such distress, execution or other process.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Unsatisfied Judgments
Inclusion.p: There is no unsatisfied judgment or court order outstanding against the Company.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Events of Default
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: Other than trade debt and other indebtedness in the ordinary course of business, no event has occurred causing or which upon intervention or notice by any third party may cause any floating charge created by the Company to crystallise or any charge created by the Company to become enforceable, nor has any such crystallisation occurred nor is such enforcement in process.

In relation to any property or assets held by the Company under any hire purchase, conditional sale, chattel leasing or retention of title agreement or otherwise belonging to a third party, no event has occurred which entitles, or which upon intervention or
Inclusion.p: notice by a third party may entitle, the third party to repossess the property or assets concerned or terminate the agreement or any licence in respect of the same.
Inclusion.numbered_2_para: Undervalue/preference
Inclusion.p: The Company has not at any time during the two (2) years immediately prior to the date of this Agreement:
Inclusion.numbered_3_para: entered into a transaction with any person at an undervalue (as referred to in section 98 of the Bankruptcy Act (Chapter 20 of Singapore)); or
been given a preference by any person (as referred to in section 99 of the Bankruptcy Act (Chapter 20 of Singapore)).

Inclusion.p: AMENDED ARTICLES THE COMPANIES ACT, CAP 50
REPUBLIC OF SINGAPORE

REDMART LIMITED
(Incorporated in the Republic of Singapore)
TABLE “A” EXCLUDED
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The regulations in Table “A” in the Fourth Schedule to the Companies Act, Cap 50, shall not apply to the Company, except in so far as the same are repeated or contained in these Articles.

APPLICABILITY OF PROVISIONS OF PAID-UP SHARES

Inclusion.p: INTERPRETATION
INTERPRETATION
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: In these Articles, unless the subject or context otherwise requires, the words standing in the first column of the table next hereinafter contained shall bear the meaning set opposite to them respectively in the second column thereof:
Inclusion.p: The Company: REDMART LIMITED. The Act: The Companies Act, Cap 50.
These Articles: These amended and restated articles of association of the Company as originally framed or as altered from time to time by special resolutions.
Auditors: The auditors for the time being of the Company.
Board: The board of Directors for the time being of the Company.
Business Day: A day (other than a Saturday, Sunday or gazette public holiday) on which commercial banks are open for business in Singapore.

Deed of Ratification and Accession: The deed to be executed by a purchaser or transferee of shares in the capital of the Company under which he agrees to be bound by, and shall be entitled to the benefit of the SHA as if an original party in place of the transferring member.
The Directors: The directors for the time being of the Company.
REDMART SERIES B SSA
Founders: Roger Emmett Egan III and Vikram Prakash Rupani, the initial subscribers to shares in the share capital of the Company.
Investor: Garena Interactive Holding Limited, a member of the Company.
Investor Director: The Director appointed by the Investor in accordance with Article 84. New Series B Investor: each of the Visionnaire Investors and Eduardo Luiz Saverin.
New Series B Investors: together each New Series B Investor.
The office: The registered office for the time being of the Company.
Plan: The employee stock option plan of the Company in effect from time to time.
Preference Shareholders: The Series A RCPS Shareholders and the Series B CPS Shareholders.
Preference Shares: The Series A RCPS and the Series B CPS.

Qualified IPO: The closing of a firm commitment underwritten public offering of ordinary shares and the listing of such ordinary shares on a reputable international stock exchange (including without limitation stock exchanges in the United States, Hong Kong and Singapore), at a public offering price per ordinary share of at least three (3) times the Investor’s subscription price per Series B CPS (as adjusted for share splits, consolidations, etc.) and with gross proceeds in excess of US$50,000,000;
Reserved Matters: The reserved matters requiring the affirmative vote of the Investor or the Investor Director and/or the Substantial Holder(s) (as applicable) set out in Articles 52 and 53.
The Seal: The Common Seal of the Company.
The Secretary: Any person appointed to perform the duties of a secretary of the Company.
Series A RCPS: The Series A redeemable convertible preference shares in the capital of the Company, having the rights, Preferences and privileges set out in Article 4A.
Series A RCPS Shareholders: The holders of the Series A RCPS.
Series B CPS: The Series B convertible preference shares in the capital of the Company having the rights, preferences and privileges set out in Article 4B.
Series B CPS Shareholders: The holders of the Series B CPS.
SHA: The amended and restated subscription and shareholders’ agreement dated 2 July 2014 among the Shareholders, the Founders and the Company.

Shareholding Proportion: In relation to any member at any given time, the proportion in which the ordinary shares for which that member holds (and/or would hold if such member’s Preference Shares were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) bears to the total number of ordinary shares issued in the capital of the Company (on a fully converted basis).
The shares: the ordinary shares, Series A RCPS and Series B CPS in the capital of the Company.
