Substantial Holder: (A) A member who holds ordinary shares (and/or would hold if such member’s Preference Shares were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) constituting at least five (5) per cent of the then total number of ordinary shares issued in the

capital of the Company (on a fully converted basis), and (B) a Visionnaire Investor for as long as (i) the Visionnaire Investors jointly hold in aggregate ordinary shares (and/or would hold if the Visionnaire Investors’ Series B CPS were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) constituting at least five (5) per cent of the then total number of ordinary shares (on a fully converted basis), and (ii) the Visionnaire Investor holds on its own in aggregate ordinary shares (and/or would hold if such Visionnaire Investor’s Series B CPS were fully converted at the then applicable conversion rate) constituting at least three (3) per cent of the then total number of ordinary shares (on a fully converted basis).
Singapore Dollar(s) or S$: The lawful currency of Singapore.
Transfer: Any voluntary or involuntary sale, assignment, conveyance, pledge, encumbrance, hypothecation, gift, distribution or other disposition or transfer.
United States Dollar(s) or US$: The lawful currency of the United States of America. Visionnaire: means each of Visionnaire Ventures Fund 1 L.P.
Visionnaire Investor: means each of Visionnaire and SB Pan-Asia Fund. Visionnaire Investors: together each Visionnaire Investor.
Words importing the singular number shall also include the plural number, and vice versa. Words importing the masculine gender shall also include the feminine gender.
Words importing persons shall also include corporations.

Expressions referring to writing shall, unless the contrary intention appears, be construed as including references to printing, lithography, photography and other modes of representing or reproducing words in a visible form.

Words or expressions contained in these Articles shall be interpreted in accordance with the provisions of the Interpretation Act, Cap 1, and of the Act as in force at the date at which these Articles become binding on the Company.
SHARE CAPITAL AND VARIATION OF RIGHTS
ISSUE OF SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Without prejudice to any special rights previously conferred on the holders of any existing shares or class of shares but subject to the Act, and the Reserved Matters, shares in the Company may be issued by the Directors and any such share may be issued with such preferred, deferred, or other special rights or such restrictions, whether in regard to dividend, voting, return of capital, or otherwise, as the Directors subject to any ordinary resolution of the Company, determine.
Inclusion.p: PREFERENCE SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Act and the Reserved Matters, any Preference Shares may, with the sanction of an ordinary resolution, be issued on the terms that they are, or at the option of the Company are liable, to be redeemed.

Inclusion.p: RIGHTS ATTACHING TO SERIES A RCPS
4A. (1) In Articles 4A, 4B and 4C the following expressions shall, unless the context otherwise requires, have the following meanings:

“Distributable Profits” means, in relation to a Series A Dividend Payment Date and a Series B Dividend Payment Date or any other date on which payment is to be made to the Preference Shareholders pursuant to the liquidation of, or return of capital by, the Company, the amount (comprising current profits and/or accumulated revenue reserves) certified by the Auditors to be the profit available to the Company for distribution as a dividend in compliance with Section 403 of the Act in respect of the period to which the then most recent annual audited profit and loss accounts relate;

“Liquidation Event” means (a) any liquidation, winding up or dissolution of the Company, whether voluntary or involuntary, and/or save as waived in writing by the Investor, (b) any merger, reorganization, consolidation, scheme of arrangement, acquisition or sale of voting control or other similar transaction of the Company in which its members do not retain a majority of the voting power in the surviving entity, (c) the sale, license or lease of all or substantially all of the Company’s assets in one (1) transaction or a series of related transactions, or (d) the sale or exclusive license of all or substantially all of the Company’s intellectual property. For the avoidance of doubt any licensing of intellectual property owned by the Company to a third party on terms which permit the continued use by the Company of the intellectual property being licensed will not amount to a Liquidation Event;
“Register of Preference Shareholders” means a register of Preference Shareholders maintained by the Company;
“Series A Automatic Conversion Date” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4A(2)(g)(i);

“Series A Conversion Date” means a Business Day during the Series A Conversion Period on which a Series A Conversion Notice is lodged by a Series A RCPS Shareholder at the registered office of the Company pursuant to these Articles;

“Series A Conversion Notice” means the notice (in the form for the time being approved by the Company) available from the Company to be given by a Series A RCPS Shareholder to the Company for the conversion of the Series A RCPS;

“Series A Conversion Period” means the period during which the Series A RCPS may be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid commencing on and including the Series A Issue Date up to the Series A Redemption Date;
“Series A Conversion Price” means the Series A Issue Amount subject to any adjustment set forth in Article 4A(2)(h);

“Series A Conversion Ratio” means, in relation to the conversion of Series A RCPS, the ratio of one (1) Series A RCPS to one (1) ordinary share, or such other ratio as may be adjusted pursuant to Article 4A(2)(h);

“Series A Conversion Right” means the right of each Series A RCPS Shareholder, subject to the provisions of Article 4A, the Act and any other applicable law or regulation, to convert during the Series A Conversion Period such number of Series A RCPS held by him into such number of ordinary shares at the Series A Conversion Ratio;

“Series A Dividend Payment Date” means, in relation to any Series A Preference Dividend, such date as the Directors may determine from time to time in the relevant declaration by the Directors of such Series A Preference Dividend;
“Series A Issue Amount” means, in relation to a Series A RCPS, the subscription price paid for each Series A RCPS;
“Series A Issue Date” means the date on which the Series A RCPS are allotted;
“Series A New Conversion Price” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4A(2)(h)(i);
“Series A Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4A(2)(h)(i);

“Series A Preference Amount “ means, in relation to a Series A RCPS, on any date of determination, the aggregate of (a) the Series A Issue Amount of such Series A RCPS and (b) any declared but unpaid Series A Preference Dividends on such Series A RCPS, such amounts being proportionately adjusted for any split, subdivision, consolidation, bonus issue or other dividend/distribution of ordinary shares or combination of shares or rights issue or other change in capital structure/recapitalisation of the Company and/or any corporate actions having a similar nature or effect;
“Series A Redemption Date” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4A(2)(c)(i);
“Series A Redemption Notice” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4A(2)(c)(i);
“Series A Redemption Value” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4A(2)(c)(ii);

“Series A Preference Dividend” means a non-cumulative dividend calculated at the rate of eight (8) per cent per annum of the Series A Issue Amount and payable on a Series A RCPS on a Series A Dividend Payment Date (including the Series A Redemption Date);
“Series B Automatic Conversion Date” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article4B(1)(g)(i);

“Series B Conversion Date” means a Business Day during the Series B Conversion Period on which a Series B Conversion Notice is lodged by a Series B CPS Shareholder at the registered office of the Company pursuant to these Articles;

“Series B Conversion Notice” means the notice (in the form for the time being approved by the Company) available from the Company to be given by a Series B CPS Shareholder to the Company for the conversion of the Series B CPS;
“Series B Conversion Period” means the period during which the Series B CPS may be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid commencing on and including the Series B Issue Date;
“Series B Conversion Price” means the Series B Issue Amount subject to any adjustment set forth in Article4B(1)(h);

“Series B Conversion Ratio” means, in relation to the conversion of Series B CPS, the ratio of one (1) Series B CPS to one (1) ordinary share, or such other ratio as may be adjusted pursuant to Article 4B(1)(h);

“Series B Conversion Right” means the right of each Series B CPS Shareholder, subject to the provisions of Article 4AB, the Act and any other applicable law or regulation, to convert during the Series B Conversion Period such number of Series B CPS held by him into such number of ordinary shares at the Series B Conversion Ratio;

“Series B Dividend Payment Date” means, in relation to any Series B Preference Dividend, such date as the Directors may determine from time to time in the relevant declaration by the Directors of such Series B Preference Dividend;
“Series B Issue Amount” means, in relation to a Series B CPS, the subscription price paid for each Series B CPS;
“Series B Issue Date” means the date on which the Series B CPS are allotted;
“Series B New Conversion Price” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4B(1)(h)(i);
“Series B Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in Article 4B(1)(h)(i);

“Series B Preference Amount” means, in relation to a Series B CPS, on any date of determination, the aggregate of (a) the Issue Amount of such Series B CPS and (b) any declared but unpaid Series B Preference Dividends on such Series B CPS, such amounts being proportionately adjusted for any split, subdivision, consolidation, bonus issue or other dividend/distribution of ordinary shares or combination of shares or rights issue or other change in capital structure/recapitalisation of the Company and/or any corporate actions having a similar nature or effect;

“Series B Preference Dividend” means a non-cumulative dividend calculated at the rate of eight (8) per cent per annum of the Series B Issue Amount and payable on a Series B CPS on a Series B Dividend Payment Date; and

“Target Valuation” means, with respect to a Qualified IPO, a valuation three (3) times the Series B Issue Amount of the Investor’s Series B CPS with gross offering proceeds in excess of US$50,000,000.
All references to the masculine gender shall include references to the feminine and neuter genders and vice versa.

(2) The Company may allot and issue the Series A RCPS, at such issue price and on such terms and conditions as the Directors may determine, which shall carry the following rights, benefits and privileges and be subject to the following restrictions:
(a) DIVIDEND
(i) The Series A RCPS Shareholders:

(A) shall be entitled to be paid out of the Distributable Profits a non-cumulative Series A Preference Dividend at such time and in such manner as the Company’s Board may in its discretion from time to time declare in respect of the Series A RCPS held by the Series A RCPS Shareholders; and
(B) shall not be entitled to any dividend in the absence of such declaration,
provided that if and when any dividend is declared or paid in respect of the ordinary shares or Series B CPS, the Directors shall declare a

Series A Preference Dividend in respect of all Series A RCPS and pay such Series A Preference Dividend at the same time as the Series B Preference Dividend is paid and before the dividend in respect of the ordinary shares is paid.
(ii) The Series A Preference Dividend (if any) shall:
(A) be payable in arrears on each Series A Dividend Payment Date;

(B) accrue and be calculated on the basis of a 365-day year for the actual number of days elapsed during the period commencing on (and including) the Series A Issue Date or the last Series A Dividend Payment Date (as applicable) and ending on (but excluding) the relevant Series A Dividend Payment Date;
(C) be paid out of the Distributable Profits and, subject to (iii) below, in priority to any dividend or distribution in favour of holders of any other classes of shares in the Company;
(D) constitute a debt (to the extent that Distributable Profits are available for its payment) due from and immediately payable by the Company on the relevant Series A Dividend Payment Date;
(E) cease to accrue on and with effect from the relevant Series A Redemption Date; and

(F) be paid by Singapore Dollar cheque drawn on a bank in Singapore and despatched to the Series A RCPS Shareholders at their respective registered addresses for the time being, and if tax is deducted or withheld, together with the relevant tax vouchers.

(iii) No Series A Preference Dividend in respect of the Series A RCPS can be paid unless a Series B Preference Dividend is also being paid in respect of the Series B CPS at the same time (and vice versa).
(b) LIQUIDATION EVENT
Upon any Liquidation Event, the assets of the Company available for distribution among the members shall be applied as follows:

(i) firstly, in paying to the Preference Shareholders, pro-rata an amount equal to the Series A Preference Amounts for their Series A RCPS and the Series B Preference Amounts for their Series B CPS plus accrued and unpaid Series A Preference Dividends and Series B Preference Dividends; and

(ii) secondly, the balance of such assets and profits shall belong to and be distributed on a pro-rata basis among the holders of any class of shares in the capital of the Company other than the Preference Shares and any other shares not entitled to participate in such assets in accordance with the respective rights attaching thereto.
For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in the foregoing shall affect the right of any Preference Shareholder to forgo its liquidation preference and elect to
voluntarily convert at its sole discretion all of its Series A RCPS into ordinary shares in accordance with this Article 4A prior to the occurrence of a Liquidation Event.
(c) REDEMPTION

(i) Any Series A RCPS Shareholder may, at any time after the fifth (5th) anniversary of the Series A Issue Date of a Series A RCPS held by it, require the Company to redeem such Series A RCPS (save where such Series A RCPS has been previously redeemed or converted) by giving to the Company notice (the “Series A Redemption Notice”) of such redemption, which notice shall be irrevocable. Every Series A Redemption Notice shall specify the date fixed for redemption which shall be a Business Day (in respect of the Series A RCPS to be redeemed, the “Series A Redemption Date”).
(ii) The redemption of a Series A RCPS under this Article 4A(2)(c) shall be at the higher of:

(A) the fair market value of such Series A RCPS as determined by an independent third party professional jointly appointed by the Series A RCPS Shareholder and the Company at their expense which shall be shared equally (and in so determining, such independent third party professional shall be deemed to be acting as experts and not as arbitrators); and
(B) the Series A Preference Amount, (the “Series A Redemption Value”).

(iii) Upon receipt of a Series A Redemption Notice from such Series A RCPS Shareholder, the Company shall redeem the relevant Series A RCPS of that Series A RCPS Shareholder on the Series A Redemption Date. Upon redemption, such Series A RCPS shall be deemed to have been cancelled and retired and shall not thereafter be reissued.

(iv) On or before the Series A Redemption Date, each Series A RCPS Shareholder whose Series A RCPS are to be redeemed shall be bound to deliver to the Company the share certificates in respect of those Series A RCPS to be redeemed which are held by it/him, in order that the same may be cancelled.

(v) On the Series A Redemption Date and upon delivery of the relevant share certificates (or an appropriate form of indemnity), the Company shall pay to each such Series A RCPS Shareholder (or in the case of joint holders, to the holder whose name stands first in the Register of Preference Shareholders) the Series A Redemption Value (such payment to be made by Singapore Dollar cheque drawn on a bank in Singapore and despatched to each such Series A RCPS Shareholder at his registered addresses for the time being, and if tax is deducted or withheld, together with the relevant tax vouchers).

(vi) Subject to Article 4A(2)(a)(E), the Series A Preference Dividend in respect of the Series A RCPS to be redeemed by the Company pursuant to this Article 4A(2)(c) shall cease to accrue on and with effect from the Series A Redemption Date.

(vii) Notwithstanding any provision in this Article 4A(2)(c), the Company shall upon receipt of the Series A Redemption Notice be entitled to elect to redeem the Series A RCPS over a three (3)-year period at the rate of one-third (1/3) of the Series A Redemption Value commencing from the first anniversary date of the Company’s receipt of the Series A Redemption Notice from the redeeming Series A RCPS Shareholder in accordance with this Article 4A(2)(c) and in the event that the Company so elects, the provisions in Articles 4A(2)(c)(iii) to (vi) with respect to redemption of the relevant Series A RCPS on the Series A Redemption Date shall mutatis mutandis apply to the redemption of one-third (1/3) of the relevant Series A RCPS on each of the first three (3) anniversaries after the date of receipt of the Series A Redemption Notice by the Company.
(d) DEFAULT IN PAYMENT OR PARTIAL PAYMENT

If by reason of any provision of the Act, the Company is unable to make payment of any amount due in respect of the Series A RCPS (whether in respect of the Series A Preference Dividend, the Series A Redemption Value or otherwise) and/or redeem any of the relevant Series A RCPS following the receipt of a Series A Redemption Notice from a Series A RCPS Shareholder, then the Company shall from time to time (subject to the maximum amount and extent permitted by law, and on the earliest date on which such payments or redemption may lawfully be made) make payments on account of the amount so owing on a pro rata basis until such amount has been paid in full, and in the case of a redemption, any unredeemed Series A RCPS will be carried forward and redeemed as soon as the Company is legally able to do so.
(e) VOTING
Each Series A RCPS Shareholder:

(i) shall be entitled to receive copies of the reports and accounts (including the balance sheet and profit and loss account) and notices of general meetings, being the same as those which the holders of ordinary shares are entitled to receive;

(ii) shall be entitled to attend (in person or by proxy or attorney or in the case of a corporation, by a duly authorised representative) any general meeting of the Company and to be counted for the purposes of a quorum at such general meeting and to vote at any general meeting; and
(iii) shall be entitled to attend, speak and vote at any class meeting of the Series A RCPS Shareholders.

At the relevant general meeting or the relevant class meeting of the Series A RCPS Shareholders, on a show of hands every Series A RCPS Shareholder who is present in person or by proxy or attorney (or in the case of a corporation by a duly authorised representative) shall have one (1) vote and on a poll every Series A RCPS Shareholder who is present in person or by proxy or attorney (or in the case of a corporation by a duly authorised representative) shall have one (1) vote for each ordinary share into which each Series A RCPS held by such Series A RCPS Shareholder would be converted if the Series A Conversion Date for such Series A RCPS was the
date forty-eight (48) hours preceding the date of such general meeting or the class meeting of the Series A RCPS Shareholders, as the case may be.
A Series A RCPS Shareholder may appoint a proxy to attend and vote at the same general meeting or the class meeting of the Series A RCPS Shareholders. A proxy need not be a member.

The provisions of these Articles relating to votes of members shall (subject to and except to the extent inconsistent with this Article 4A) apply mutatis mutandis to votes of the Series A RCPS Shareholders at any general meeting or the class meeting of Series A RCPS Shareholders, as the case may be.
(f) VOLUNTARY CONVERSION

Each Series A RCPS Shareholder shall have the Series A Conversion Right in relation to his Series A RCPS and shall be entitled to exercise the Series A Conversion Right in respect of all or any of his Series A RCPS to convert such Series A RCPS into ordinary shares credited as fully paid at the Series A Conversion Ratio upon and subject to the following terms:

(i) the Series A Conversion Right shall be exercisable on any Business Day falling within the Series A Conversion Period by completing the Series A Conversion Notice and delivering the same to the Company together with share certificates in respect of such Series A RCPS or such other documents or evidence (if any) as the Directors may reasonably require to prove the title and claim of the person exercising such right (or, if such certificates have been lost or destroyed, such evidence of title and such indemnity as the Directors may require). A Series A Conversion Notice once given may not be withdrawn without the consent in writing of the Company;

(ii) upon conversion, such Series A RCPS shall be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid and, from the Series A Conversion Date, the rights attached to such Series A RCPS are altered and such Series A RCPS shall cease to have any preference or priority set out in this Article 4A and shall rank pari passu in all respects with the ordinary shares then in issue (save for any dividends, rights or other distributions the record date of which is before the Series A Conversion Date);

(iii) conversion of such Series A RCPS as are due to be converted as aforesaid on the Series A Conversion Date shall be effected in such manner as the Directors shall, subject to these Articles and as the Act or other applicable laws or regulations may allow, from time to time determine, provided always that the Series A RCPS shall upon conversion, be cancelled and retired and shall not thereafter be reissued; and

(iv) the Company shall, within five (5) Business Days of the Series A Conversion Date and in exchange for the certificates in respect of the relevant Series A RCPS, deliver the share certificates in respect of the ordinary shares into which such Series A RCPS are converted, and any balancing certificate for any Series A RCPS which remain unconverted to the holder of the relevant Series A RCPS.
Any certificate to be despatched by the Company pursuant to this Article 4A(2)(f)(iv) shall be sent by registered post at the risk of the converting Series A RCPS Shareholder.
All certificates relating to the Series A RCPS which have been delivered for conversion shall upon issue of the ordinary shares be cancelled forthwith.
(g) AUTOMATIC CONVERSION

(i) Each Series A RCPS shall automatically be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid at the Series A Conversion Ratio upon the closing of a Qualified IPO, or in the case of a Qualified IPO on a stock exchange (including the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited) which requires the conversion of the Series A RCPS into ordinary shares to be completed prior to closing, on the last date on which such conversion of Series A RCPS can be done (the“Series A Automatic Conversion Date”), without any further action by the Series A RCPS Shareholders and whether or not the certificates representing such Series A RCPS are surrendered to the Company.

(ii) On the Series A Automatic Conversion Date, the Series A RCPS shall be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid and, from the Series A Automatic Conversion Date, the rights attached to the Series A RCPS are altered and the Series A RCPS shall cease to have any preference or priority set out in this Article 4A and shall rank pari passu in all respects with the ordinary shares then in issue (save for any dividends, rights or other distributions the record date of which is before the Series A Automatic Conversion Date).

(iii) Conversion of the Series A RCPS as are due to be converted as aforesaid on the Series A Automatic Conversion Date shall be effected in such manner as the Directors shall, subject to these Articles and as the Act or other applicable laws or regulations may allow, from time to time determine, provided always that the Series A RCPS shall upon conversion, be cancelled and retired and shall not thereafter be reissued.

(iv) The Company shall promptly (and in any event in such time as is sufficient to enable the converting Series A RCPS Shareholder to participate in the Qualified IPO) in exchange for the certificates in respect of the Series A RCPS (or, if such certificates have been lost or destroyed, such evidence of title and such indemnity as the Directors may require), deliver the share certificates in respect of the ordinary shares into which the Series A RCPS are converted to the converting Series A RCPS Shareholders.
Any certificate to be despatched by the Company pursuant to this Article 4A(2)(g)(iv) shall be sent by registered post at the risk of the converting Series A RCPS Shareholders.
All certificates relating to the Series A RCPS shall upon issue of the ordinary shares be cancelled forthwith.
(h) CONVERSION RATIO / CONVERSION PRICE ADJUSTMENTS
(i) Anti-dilution adjustments on a weighted average broad-based basis

Except as provided in Article 4A(2)(h)(iv), and except in the case of an event described in Article 4A(2)(h)(ii), if the Company shall issue or sell, or is, in accordance with this Article 4A(2)(h), deemed to have issued or sold, any ordinary shares (or securities (including but not limited to Series A RCPS, derivatives, bonds, warrants and/or options) convertible into or for ordinary shares) for a consideration per share (on an as fully-converted basis) less than the Series A Conversion Price in effect immediately prior to such issuance or sale (the “Series A Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price”), then, upon such issuance or sale (or deemed issuance or sale), the Series A Conversion Price for the Series A RCPS shall be reduced to a price (the “Series A New Conversion Price”) determined as follows:
Series A New Conversion Price = A + B x D
A + C
where:

A = the number of the ordinary shares (including all Preference Shares, derivatives, bonds, warrants and other outstanding securities on an as fully-converted basis and exercise of all outstanding options) outstanding immediately prior to such new share issue;

B = the number of ordinary shares which the aggregate consideration received by the Company for the number of ordinary shares (on an as fully-converted basis) so newly issued would purchase at such Series A Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price in effect;
C = the number of ordinary shares (on an as fully-converted basis) so newly issued; and
D = the Series A Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price.
Correspondingly, the Series A Conversion Ratio for the Series A RCPS shall be adjusted to be the quotient of one (1) divided by the Series A New Conversion Price.
(ii) Adjustments for share splits, share dividends, recapitalizations, etc.

Appropriate and similar adjustments shall be made to the Series A Conversion Ratio from time to time by the Directors in the event of any split, subdivision, consolidation, bonus issue or other dividend/distributions of ordinary shares or combination of shares or rights issue or other change in capital structure/recapitalisation of the Company and/or any corporate actions having a similar nature or effect such that the shareholding percentage of the Series A RCPS in so far as the same bears to the total number of shares in the Company issued and outstanding shall remain unchanged following any such event.
(iii) Target Valuation adjustments

In the event that there is a change in the definition of a Qualified IPO through a downward adjustment of the Target Valuation and the public offering price of the Qualified IPO ends up being less than the Series A Preference Amount, then the Series A Conversion Ratio shall also be adjusted such that the Series A RCPS Shareholders’ percentage shareholding ownership on an as fully-converted basis would increase to the point where the public offering price of the Qualified IPO ends up being equal to the Series A Preference Amount.
(iv) Certain issues of ordinary shares excepted
Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, the Company shall not be required to make any adjustment of the Series A Conversion Price in the case of issuance of:
(A) ordinary shares upon conversion of the Series A RCPS;
(B) ordinary shares upon conversion of the Series B CPS;

(C) ordinary shares or options therefore to Directors, officers, employees or consultants of the Company in connection with their service as Directors, their employment by the company or their retention as consultants by the Company, in each case authorised by the Directors pursuant to the Plan; or

(D) ordinary shares issued by the Company in exchange for the assets or shares of another person or entity in connection with the acquisition of such person or entity by the Company, whether by merger, purchase of all or substantially all of the assets of such corporation, or otherwise, which acquisition has been approved by the Directors and members in accordance with these Articles; or

(E) ordinary shares issued by the Company in connection with an acquisition, joint venture, or any other strategic transaction which has been approved by the Directors and members in accordance with these Articles.
(v) Adjustments, calculations

Upon the occurrence of each adjustment of the Series A Conversion Price pursuant to this Article 4A(2)(h), the Company, at its expense shall promptly compute such adjustment in accordance with the, terms hereof and prepare and furnish to each Series A RCPS Shareholder a certificate setting forth in detail:
(A) such adjustment;
(B) the Series A Conversion Price and Series A Conversion Ratio respectively, before and after such adjustment; and
(C) the number of ordinary shares which at the time would be received upon the conversion of such Series A RCPS Shareholder’s Series A RCPS.
All such calculations shall be rounded down to the nearest cent or to the nearest full share as the case may be.
(i) MEETINGS

Subject to applicable laws, two (2) Series A RCPS Shareholders, one (1) of whom shall be the Investor, shall constitute the quorum at a meeting of the Series A RCPS Shareholders. The provisions of these Articles relating to general meetings of the Company, notice of and proceedings at general meetings and votes of members shall (subject to and except to the extent inconsistent with this Article 4A) apply mutatis mutandis to any separate class meeting of the Series A RCPS Shareholders.
(j) FURTHER PREFERENCE SHARES

Without prejudice to the generality of Article 4A(5) below, the issue by the Company of shares which rank in any respect pari passu with, or in priority to the Series A RCPS, shall be deemed to constitute a variation of the rights attached to the Series A RCPS.
(k) TRANSFERS, REGISTRATION AND REPLACEMENT

The Series A RCPS will be in registered form and the Company shall maintain a Register of Preference Shareholders. The provisions of these Articles relating to the registration, transfer, transmission, certificates and replacement thereof applicable to ordinary shares shall apply mutatis mutandis to the Series A RCPS.
(l) SUBSTITUTION SECURITIES

In the event of a winding-up or dissolution of the Company pursuant to reconstruction, amalgamation, merger or consolidation, the resultant corporate entity responsible for the liabilities of the Company with respect of the Series A RCPS shall issue such securities in substitution and replacement of the Series A RCPS and on such terms as shall be approved by Series A RCPS Shareholders in accordance with Article 4A(5) unless the terms of such securities in substitution are no less favourable than the terms of the Series A RCPS. As a condition to any such winding-up or dissolution, the Company shall procure that the resultant corporate entity shall (in favour of the Series A RCPS Shareholders) undertake to comply with the provisions of this Article 4A.
(m) TAXATION

All payments in respect of the Series A Preference Dividend and Series A Preference Amount shall be made with withholding or deduction for or on account of any present or future taxes, duties, assessments or governmental charges of whatever nature imposed or levied by or on behalf of Singapore or any authority therein or thereof as required by law.
(n) PAYMENTS

All payments or distributions with respect to the Series A RCPS held jointly by two (2) or more persons shall be paid or made to whichever of such persons is named first in the Register of Preference Shareholders and the making of any payment or distribution in accordance with this Article 4A(2)(n) shall discharge the liability of the Company in respect thereof.
(o) CERTIFICATION AS TO SERIES A PREFERENCE AMOUNT

For the purposes of this Article 4A, a certificate by the Auditors of the Series A Preference Amount in relation to a Series A RCPS on any particular date shall be (in the absence of manifest error) conclusive and binding on the Company, the holder of such Series A RCPS and all persons having an interest in such Series A RCPS. In giving any such certificate, the Auditors shall be deemed to be acting as experts and not as arbitrators and accordingly the provisions of the Arbitration Act (Chapter 10 of Singapore) shall not apply.
(3) If the Series A Preference Dividend is not paid (or is not paid in full) on its due date, the Company will procure that the Auditors shall, on or before the day falling sixty

(60) days after the relevant Series A Dividend Payment Date, certify to Series A RCPS Shareholders the Distributable Profits or the lack of any Distributable Profits with respect to that Series A Dividend Payment Date and shall make such certificate available for inspection on request by any Series A RCPS Shareholder. In the event that such certification is not obtained, then without prejudice to the rights of the Series A RCPS Shareholders, the Series A RCPS Shareholders may by ordinary resolution passed at a meeting of those present and voting, appoint a reputable accounting firm to so certify at the expense of the Company, and the Company shall provide such assistance as such firm may require in connection therewith.
(4) The Company shall comply with the provisions of the Act relating to the redemption of the Series A RCPS.

(5) Subject to the Reserved Matters, any consent, approval or sanction of the Series A RCPS Shareholders required under this Article 4A and/or any variation, abrogation, devaluation, dilution or other limitation of the rights of the Series A RCPS Shareholders as set out in this Article 4A shall require a special resolution of the Series A RCPS Shareholders in a separate class meeting of the Series A RCPS Shareholders.

(6) Any notice or other document may be given by the Company to any Series A RCPS Shareholder either personally or by sending it through the post in a prepaid letter or by cable, telex, facsimile transmission, telegram or other tangible and legible form of electronic or similar form of communication addressed to such Series A RCPS Shareholder at his address as appearing in the Register of Preference Shareholders. All notices with respect to any Series A RCPS to which persons are jointly entitled shall be given to whichever of such person is named first in the Register of Preference Shareholders, and notice so given shall be sufficient notice to all the holders of such Series A RCPS. Any notice or other document, if sent by post, shall be deemed to have been served or delivered at the time when the letter containing the same is posted, and in proving such service it shall be sufficient to prove that the letter containing the notice or document was properly addressed and served by prepaid post. Any notice or other document, if served by cable, telex, facsimile transmission, telegram or other tangible and legible form of electronic or similar form of communication shall be deemed to have been served upon receipt thereof. Production of a copy of a notice sent by telex, facsimile transmission or other tangible and legible form of electronic or similar form of communication bearing an acknowledgement of successful transmission in accordance with normal procedures under the system in use shall be sufficient proof of receipt thereof.

(7) In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Article 4A and the other provisions of these Articles, then (in favour of the Series A RCPS Shareholders) the provisions of this Article 4A shall prevail.
RIGHTS ATTACHING TO SERIES B CPS

4B. (1) The Company may allot and issue the Series B CPS, at such issue price and on such terms and conditions as the Directors may determine, which shall carry the following rights, benefits and privileges and be subject to the following restrictions:
(a) DIVIDEND
(i) The Series B CPS Shareholders:

(A) shall be entitled to be paid out of the Distributable Profits a non-cumulative Series B Preference Dividend at such time and in such manner as the Company’s Board may in its discretion from time to time declare in respect of the Series B CPS held by the Series B CPS Shareholders; and
(B) shall not be entitled to any dividend in the absence of such declaration,

provided that if and when any dividend is declared or paid in respect of the ordinary shares or Series A RCPS, the Directors shall declare a Series B Preference Dividend in respect of all Series B CPS and pay such Series B Preference Dividend at the same time as the Series A Preference Dividend is paid and before the dividend in respect of the ordinary shares is paid.
(ii) The Series B Preference Dividend (if any) shall:
(A) be payable in arrears on each Series B Dividend Payment Date;

(B) accrue and be calculated on the basis of a 365-day year for the actual number of days elapsed during the period commencing on (and including) the Series B Issue Date or the last Series B Dividend Payment Date (as applicable) and ending on (but excluding) the relevant Series B Dividend Payment Date;
(C) be paid out of the Distributable Profits and, subject to (iii) below, in priority to any dividend or distribution in favour of holders of any other classes of shares in the Company;
(D) constitute a debt (to the extent that Distributable Profits are available for its payment) due from and immediately payable by the Company on the relevant Series B Dividend Payment Date; and

(E) be paid by Singapore Dollar cheque drawn on a bank in Singapore and despatched to the Series B CPS Shareholders at their respective registered addresses for the time being, and if tax is deducted or withheld, together with the relevant tax vouchers.

(iii) No Series B Preference Dividend in respect of the Series B CPS can be paid unless a Series A Preference Dividend is also being paid in respect of the Series A RCPS at the same time (and vice versa).
(b) LIQUIDATION EVENT
Upon any Liquidation Event, the assets of the Company available for distribution among the members shall be applied as follows:

(i) firstly, in paying to the Preference Shareholders, pro-rata an amount equal to the Series A Preference Amounts for their Series A RCPS and the Series B Preference Amounts for their Series B CPS plus accrued and unpaid Series A Preference Dividends and Series B Preference Dividends; and

(ii) secondly, the balance of such assets and profits shall belong to and be distributed on a pro-rata basis among the holders of any class of shares in the capital of the Company other than the Preference Shares and any other shares not entitled to participate in such assets in accordance with the respective rights attaching thereto.

For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in the foregoing shall affect the right of any Preference Shareholder to forgo its liquidation preference and elect to voluntarily convert at its sole discretion all of its Series B CPS into ordinary shares in accordance with this Article 4B prior to the occurrence of a Liquidation Event.
(c) REDEMPTION
Series B CPS are not redeemable.
(d) DEFAULT IN PAYMENT OR PARTIAL PAYMENT

If by reason of any provision of the Act, the Company is unable to make payment of any amount due in respect of the Series B CPS (whether in respect of the Series B Preference Dividend, or otherwise), then the Company shall from time to time (subject to the maximum amount and extent permitted by law, and on the earliest date on which such payments may lawfully be made) make payments on account of the amount so owing on a pro rata basis until such amount has been paid in full.
(e) VOTING
Each Series B CPS Shareholder:

(i) shall be entitled to receive copies of the reports and accounts (including the balance sheet and profit and loss account) and notices of general meetings, being the same as those which the holders of ordinary shares are entitled to receive;

(ii) shall be entitled to attend (in person or by proxy or attorney or in the case of a corporation, by a duly authorised representative) any general meeting of the Company and to be counted for the purposes of a quorum at such general meeting and to vote at any general meeting; and
(iii) shall be entitled to attend, speak and vote at any class meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders.

At the relevant general meeting or the relevant class meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders, on a show of hands every Series B CPS Shareholder who is present in person or by proxy or attorney (or in the case of a corporation by a duly authorised representative) shall have one (1) vote and on a poll every

Series B CPS Shareholder who is present in person or by proxy or attorney (or in the case of a corporation by a duly authorised representative) shall have one (1) vote for each ordinary share into which each Series B CPS held by such Series B CPS Shareholder would be converted if the Series B Conversion Date for such Series B CPS was the date forty-eight (48) hours preceding the date of such general meeting or the class meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders, as the case may be.
A Series B CPS Shareholder may appoint a proxy to attend and vote at the same general meeting or the class meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders. A proxy need not be a member.

The provisions of these Articles relating to votes of members shall (subject to and except to the extent inconsistent with this Article 4B) apply mutatis mutandis to votes of the Series B CPS Shareholder at any general meeting or the class meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders, as the case may be.
(f) VOLUNTARY CONVERSION

Each Series B CPS Shareholder shall have the Series B Conversion Right in relation to his Series B CPS and shall be entitled to exercise the Series B Conversion Right in respect of all or any of his Series B CPS to convert such Series B CPS into ordinary shares credited as fully paid at the Series B Conversion Ratio upon and subject to the following terms:

(i) the Series B Conversion Right shall be exercisable on any Business Day falling within the Series B Conversion Period by completing the Series B Conversion Notice and delivering the same to the Company together with share certificates in respect of such Series B CPS or such other documents or evidence (if any) as the Directors may reasonably require to prove the title and claim of the person exercising such right (or, if such certificates have been lost or destroyed, such evidence of title and such indemnity as the Directors may require). A Series B Conversion Notice once given may not be withdrawn without the consent in writing of the Company;

(ii) upon conversion, such Series B CPS shall be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid and, from the Series B Conversion Date, the rights attached to such Series B CPS are altered and such Series B CPS shall cease to have any preference or priority set out in this Article 4B and shall rank pari passu in all respects with the ordinary shares then in issue (save for any dividends, rights or other distributions the record date of which is before the Series B Conversion Date);

(iii) conversion of such Series B CPS as are due to be converted as aforesaid on the Series B Conversion Date shall be effected in such manner as the Directors shall, subject to these Articles and as the Act or other applicable laws or regulations may allow, from time to time determine, provided always that the Series B CPS shall upon conversion, be cancelled and retired and shall not thereafter be reissued; and

(iv) the Company shall, within five (5) Business Days of the Series B Conversion Date and in exchange for the certificates in respect of the relevant Series B CPS, deliver the share certificates in respect of the ordinary shares into which such Series B CPS are converted, and any
balancing certificate for any Series B CPS which remain unconverted to the holder of the relevant Series B CPS.
Any certificate to be despatched by the Company pursuant to this Article 4B(1)(f)(iv) shall be sent by registered post at the risk of the converting Series B CPS Shareholder.
All certificates relating to the Series B CPS which have been delivered for conversion shall upon issue of the ordinary shares be cancelled forthwith.
(g) AUTOMATIC CONVERSION

(i) Each Series B CPS shall automatically be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid at the Series B Conversion Ratio upon the closing of a Qualified IPO, or in the case of a Qualified IPO on a stock exchange (including the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited), which requires the conversion of the Series B CPS into ordinary shares to be completed prior to closing, on the last date on which such conversion of Series B CPS can be done (the “ Series B Automatic Conversion Date”), without any further action by the Series B CPS Shareholders and whether or not the certificates representing such Series B CPS are surrendered to the Company.

(ii) On the Series B Automatic Conversion Date, the Series B CPS shall be converted into ordinary shares credited as fully paid and, from the Series B Automatic Conversion Date, the rights attached to the Series B CPS are altered and the Series B CPS shall cease to have any preference or priority set out in this Article 4B and shall rank pari passu in all respects with the ordinary shares then in issue (save for any dividends, rights or other distributions the record date of which is before the Series B Automatic Conversion Date).

(iii) Conversion of the Series B CPS as are due to be converted as aforesaid on the Series B Automatic Conversion Date shall be effected in such manner as the Directors shall, subject to these Articles and as the Act or other applicable laws or regulations may allow, from time to time determine, provided always that the Series B CPS shall upon conversion, be cancelled and retired and shall not thereafter be reissued.

(iv) The Company shall promptly (and in any event in such time as is sufficient to enable the converting Series B CPS Shareholder to participate in the Qualified IPO) in exchange for the certificates in respect of the Series B CPS (or, if such certificates have been lost or destroyed, such evidence of title and such indemnity as the Directors may require), deliver the share certificates in respect of the ordinary shares into which the Series B CPS are converted to the converting Series B CPS Shareholders.
Any certificate to be despatched by the Company pursuant to this Article 4B(1)(g)(iv) shall be sent by registered post at the risk of the converting Series B CPS Shareholders.
All certificates relating to the Series B CPS shall, upon issue of the ordinary shares be cancelled forthwith.
(h) CONVERSION RATIO / CONVERSION PRICE ADJUSTMENTS
(i) Anti-dilution adjustments on a weighted average broad-based basis

Except as provided in Article 4B(1)(h)(iv), and except in the case of an event described in Article 4B(1)(h)(ii), if the Company shall issue or sell, or is, in accordance with this Article 4B(1)(h), deemed to have issued or sold, any ordinary shares (or securities (including but not limited to Series B CPS, derivatives, bonds, warrants and/or options) convertible into or for ordinary shares) for a consideration per share (on an as fully-converted basis) less than the Series B Conversion Price in effect immediately prior to such issuance or sale (the “Series B Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price”), then, upon such issuance or sale (or deemed issuance or sale), the Series B Conversion Price for the Series B CPS shall be reduced to a price (the “Series B New Conversion Price”) determined as follows:
Series B New Conversion Price = A + B x D
A + C
where:

A = the number of the ordinary shares (including all Preference Shares, derivatives, bonds, warrants and other outstanding securities on an as fully-converted basis and exercise of all outstanding options) outstanding immediately prior to such new share issue;

B = the number of ordinary shares which the aggregate consideration received by the Company for the number of ordinary shares (on an as fully-converted basis) so newly issued would purchase at such Series B Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price in effect;
C = the number of ordinary shares (on an as fully-converted basis) so newly issued; and
D = the Series B Pre-Adjustment Conversion Price.
Correspondingly, the Series B Conversion Ratio for the Series B CPS shall be adjusted to be the quotient of one (1) divided by the Series B New Conversion Price.
(ii) Adjustments for share splits, share dividends, recapitalizations, etc.

Appropriate and similar adjustments shall be made to the Series B Conversion Ratio from time to time by the Directors in the event of any split, subdivision, consolidation, bonus issue or other dividend/distributions of ordinary shares or combination of shares or rights issue or other change in capital structure/recapitalisation of the Company and/or any corporate actions having a similar nature or effect such that the shareholding percentage of the Series B CPS in so far as the same bears to the total number of shares in the Company issued and outstanding shall remain unchanged following any such event.
(iii) Target Valuation adjustments
In the event that there is a change in the definition of a Qualified IPO through a downward adjustment of the Target Valuation and the

public offering price of the Qualified IPO ends up being less than the Series B Preference Amount, then the Series B Conversion Ratio shall also be adjusted such that the Series B CPS Shareholders’ percentage shareholding ownership on an as fully-converted basis would increase to the point where the public offering price of the Qualified IPO ends up being equal to the Series B Preference Amount.
(iv) Certain issues of ordinary shares excepted
Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, the Company shall not be required to make any adjustment of the Series B Conversion Price in the case of issuance of:
(A) ordinary shares upon conversion of the Series A RCPS;
(B) ordinary shares upon conversion of the Series B CPS;

(C) ordinary shares or options therefore to Directors, officers, employees or consultants of the Company in connection with their service as Directors, their employment by the company or their retention as consultants by the Company, in each case authorised by the Directors pursuant to the Plan; or

(D) ordinary shares issued by the Company in exchange for the assets or shares of another person or entity in connection with the acquisition of such person or entity by the Company, whether by merger, purchase of all or substantially all of the assets of such corporation, or otherwise, which acquisition has been approved by the Directors and members in accordance with these Articles; or

(E) ordinary shares issued by the Company in connection with an acquisition, joint venture, or any other strategic transaction which has been approved by the Directors and members in accordance with these Articles.
(v) Adjustments, calculations

Upon the occurrence of each adjustment of the Series B Conversion Price pursuant to this Article 4B(1)(h), the Company at its expense shall promptly compute such adjustment in accordance with the terms hereof and prepare and furnish to each Series B CPS Shareholder a certificate setting forth in detail:
(A) such adjustment;
(B) the Series B Conversion Price and Series B Conversion Ratio respectively, before and after such adjustment; and
(C) the number of ordinary shares which at the time would be received upon the conversion of such Series B CPS Shareholder’s Series B CPS.
All such calculations shall be rounded down to the nearest cent or to the nearest full share as the case may be.
(i) MEETINGS

Subject to applicable laws, two (2) Series B CPS Shareholders, one (1) of whom shall be the Investor, shall constitute the quorum at a meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders. The provisions of these Articles relating to general meetings of the Company, notice of and proceedings at general meetings and votes of members shall (subject to and except to the extent inconsistent with this Article 4B) apply mutatis mutandis to any separate class meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders.
(j) FURTHER PREFERENCE SHARES

Without prejudice to the generality of Article 4B(3) below, the issue by the Company of shares which rank in any respect pari passu with, or in priority to the Series B CPS, shall be deemed to constitute a variation of the rights attached to the Series B CPS.
(k) TRANSFERS, REGISTRATION AND REPLACEMENT

The Series B CPS will be in registered form and the Company shall maintain a Register of Preference Shareholders. The provisions of these Articles relating to the registration, transfer, transmission, certificates and replacement thereof applicable to ordinary shares shall apply mutatis mutandis to the Series B CPS.
(l) SUBSTITUTION SECURITIES

In the event of a winding-up or dissolution of the Company pursuant to reconstruction, amalgamation, merger or consolidation, the resultant corporate entity responsible for the liabilities of the Company with respect of the Series B CPS shall issue such securities in substitution and replacement of the Series B CPS and on such terms as shall be approved by Series B CPS Shareholders in accordance with Article 4B(3) unless the terms of such securities in substitution are no less favourable than the terms of the Series B CPS. As a condition to any such winding-up or dissolution, the Company shall procure that the resultant corporate entity shall (in favour of the Series B CPS Shareholders) undertake to comply with the provisions of this Article 4B.
(m) TAXATION

All payments in respect of the Series B Preference Dividend and Series B Preference Amount shall be made with withholding or deduction for or on account of any present or future taxes, duties, assessments or governmental charges of whatever nature imposed or levied by or on behalf of Singapore or any authority therein or thereof as required by law.
(n) PAYMENTS

All payments or distributions with respect to the Series B CPS held jointly by two (2) or more persons shall be paid or made to whichever of such persons is named first in the Register of Preference Shareholders and the making of any payment or distribution in accordance with this Article 4B(1)(n) shall discharge the liability of the Company in respect thereof.
(o) CERTIFICATION AS TO SERIES B PREFERENCE AMOUNT

For the purposes of this Article 4B, a certificate by the Auditors of the Series B Preference Amount in relation to a Series B CPS on any particular date shall be (in the absence of manifest error) conclusive and binding on the Company, the holder of such Series B CPS and all persons having an interest in such Series B CPS. In giving any such certificate, the Auditors shall be deemed to be acting as experts and not as arbitrators and accordingly the provisions of the Arbitration Act (Chapter 10 of Singapore) shall not apply.
(2) If the Series B Preference Dividend is not paid (or is not paid in full) on its due date, the Company will procure that the Auditors shall, on or before the day falling sixty

(60) days after the relevant Series B Dividend Payment Date, certify to the Series B CPS Shareholders the Distributable Profits or the lack of any Distributable Profits with respect to that Series B Dividend Payment Date and shall make such certificate available for inspection on request by any Series B CPS Shareholder. In the event that such certification is not obtained, then without prejudice to the rights of the Series B CPS Shareholders, the Series B CPS Shareholders may by ordinary resolution passed at a meeting of those present and voting, appoint a reputable accounting firm to so certify at the expense of the Company, and the Company shall provide such assistance as such firm may require in connection therewith.

(3) Subject to the Reserved Matters, any consent, approval or sanction of the Series B CPS Shareholders required under this Article 4B and/or any variation, abrogation, devaluation, dilution or other limitation of the rights of the Series B CPS Shareholders as set out in this Article 4B shall require a special resolution of the Series B CPS Shareholders in a separate class meeting of the Series B CPS Shareholders.

(4) Any notice or other document may be given by the Company to any Series B CPS Shareholder either personally or by sending it through the post in a prepaid letter or by cable, telex, facsimile transmission, telegram or other tangible and legible form of electronic or similar form of communication addressed to such Series B CPS Shareholder at his address as appearing in the Register of Preference Shareholders. All notices with respect to any Series B CPS to which persons are jointly entitled shall be given to whichever of such person is named first in the Register of Preference Shareholders, and notice so given shall be sufficient notice to all the holders of such Series B CPS. Any notice or other document, if sent by post, shall be deemed to have been served or delivered at the time when the letter containing the same is posted, and in proving such service, it shall be sufficient to prove that the letter containing the notice or document was properly addressed and served by prepaid post. Any notice or other document, if served by cable, telex, facsimile transmission, telegram or other tangible and legible form of electronic or similar form of communication shall be deemed to have been served upon receipt thereof. Production of a copy of a notice sent by telex, facsimile transmission or other tangible and legible form of electronic or similar form of communication bearing an acknowledgement of successful transmission in accordance with normal procedures under the system in use shall be sufficient proof of receipt thereof.

(5) In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Article 4B and the other provisions of these Articles, then (in favour of the Series B CPS Shareholders) the provisions of this Article 4B shall prevail.
RIGHTS ATTACHING TO ORDINARY SHARES
4C. (1) The Company may allot and issue ordinary shares, at such issue price and on such terms and conditions as the Directors may determine, which shall carry the following rights and benefits:
(a) DIVIDEND
(i) The holder of ordinary shares:

(A) shall be entitled to be paid out of the Distributable Profits a dividend at such time and in such manner as the Company’s B may in its discretion from time to time declare in respect of the ordinary shares: and
(B) shall not be entitled to any dividend in the absence of such declaration,

provided that if and when any dividend is declared or paid in respect of the ordinary shares, the Directors shall declare a Series A Preference Dividend in respect of all Series A RCPS and a Series B Preference Dividend in respect of all Series B CPS and pay such Series A Preference Dividend and Series B Preference Dividend at the same time as the dividend on the ordinary shares.
(b) LIQUIDATION EVENT
Upon any Liquidation Event, the assets of the Company available for distribution among the members shall be applied as follows:

(i) firstly, in paying to the Preference Shareholders, pro-rata an amount equal to the Series A Preference Amounts for their Series A RCPS and the Series B Preference Amounts for their Series B CPS plus accrued and unpaid Series A Preference Dividends and Series B Preference Dividends; and

(ii) secondly, the balance of such assets and profits shall belong to and be distributed on a pro-rata basis among the holders of any class of shares in the capital of the Company other than the Preference Shares and any other shares not entitled to participate in such assets in accordance with the respective rights attaching thereto.
(c) VOTING
The holder of ordinary shares shall have the right to receive notice of and to attend and speak and to vote at any general meeting of the Company.
(d) MEETINGS

Subject to applicable laws, two (2) members holding ordinary shares, shall constitute the quorum at a meeting of shareholders holding ordinary shares. The provisions of these Articles relating to general meetings of the Company, notice of and proceedings at general meetings and votes of members shall (subject to and except to the extent inconsistent with this Article 4C) apply mutatis mutandis to any separate class meeting of the ordinary share shareholders.
(e) TAXATION

All payments in respect of a dividend in respect of the ordinary shares shall be made with withholding or deduction for or on account of any present or future taxes, duties, assessments or governmental charges of whatever nature imposed or levied by or on behalf of Singapore or any authority therein or thereof as required by law.
(f) PAYMENTS

All payments or distributions with respect to ordinary shares held jointly by two (2) or more persons shall be paid or made to whichever of such persons is named first in the Register of Preference Shareholders and the making of any payment or distribution in accordance with this Article 4C(1)(f) shall discharge the liability of the Company in respect thereof.
VARIATIONS OF RIGHTS ATTACHED TO SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If at any time the share capital is divided into different classes of shares, the rights attached to any class (unless otherwise provided by the terms of issue of the shares of that class) may, whether or not the Company is being wound up, be varied with the consent in writing of the holders of three-fourths (3/4) of the issued shares of that class, or with the sanction of a special resolution passed at a separate general meeting of the holders of the shares of the class. To every such separate general meeting the provisions of these Articles relating to general meetings shall mutatis mutandis apply, but so that the necessary quorum shall be two
Inclusion.p: (2) persons at least holding or representing by proxy one-third (1/3) of the issued shares of the class and that any holder of shares of the class present in person or by proxy may demand a poll. To every such special resolution the provisions of Section 184 of the Act shall with such adaptations as are necessary apply.
DEEMED VARIATION OF RIGHTS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The rights conferred upon the holders of the shares of any class issued with preferred or other rights shall, unless otherwise expressly provided by the terms of issue of the shares of that class, be deemed to be varied by the creation or issue of further shares ranking equally therewith.
Inclusion.p: PAYMENT OF COMMISSION FOR SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Company may exercise the powers of paying commissions conferred by the Act, provided that the rate per cent or the amount of commission paid or agreed to be paid shall be disclosed in the manner required by the Act and the commission shall not exceed the rate of ten (10) per cent of the price at which the shares in respect whereof the same is paid are issued or an amount equal to ten (10) per cent of that price (as the case may be). Such commission may be satisfied by the payment of cash or the allotment of fully or partly paid shares or partly in one way and partly in the other. The Company may also on any issue of shares pay such brokerage as may be lawful.
Inclusion.p: SHARES HELD IN TRUST AND JOINT HOLDERS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Except as required by law, no person shall be recognised by the Company as holding any share upon any trust, and the Company shall not be bound by or be compelled in any way to recognise (even when having notice thereof) any equitable, contingent, future, or partial interest in any share or unit of a share or (except only as by these Articles or by law otherwise provided) any other rights in respect of any share except an absolute right to the entirety thereof in the registered holder. If two (2) or more persons are registered as joint holders of
Inclusion.p: any share any one of such persons may give effectual receipts for any dividend payable in respect of such share and the joint holders of a share shall, subject to the provisions of the Act, be severally as well as jointly liable for the payment of all installments and calls and interest due in respect of such shares.
ISSUE OF SHARE CERTIFICATE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Every person whose name is entered as a member in the register of members shall be entitled without payment to receive a certificate under the Seal of the Company in accordance with the Act but in respect of a share or shares held jointly by several persons the Company shall not be bound to issue more than one (1) certificate, and delivery of a certificate for a share to one of several joint holders shall be sufficient delivery to all such holders.
Inclusion.p: Subject to the provisions of the Act and the requirements of the Directors thereunder, if any certificate be lost or destroyed or stolen, then upon proof thereof to the satisfaction of the Directors and on such indemnity as the Directors deem adequate being given, and on the payment of an administrative fee as the Directors may determine, a new certificate shall be given to the person entitled to such lost or destroyed or stolen certificate.
LIEN
LIEN ON PARTLY PAID SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Company shall have a first and paramount lien on every share (not being a fully paid share) for all money (whether presently payable or not) called or payable at a fixed time in respect of that share, and the Company shall also have a first and paramount lien on all shares (other than fully paid shares) registered in the name of a single person for all money presently payable by him or his estate to the Company; but the Directors may at any time declare any share to be wholly or in part exempt from the provisions of this Article. The Company’s lien, if any, on a share shall extend to all dividends payable thereon.
Inclusion.p: SALE OF SHARES ON WHICH LIEN EXISTS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Company may sell in such manner as the Directors think fit, any shares on which the Company has a lien, but no sale shall be made unless a sum in respect of which the lien exists is presently payable, nor until the expiration of fourteen (14) days after a notice in writing, stating and demanding payment of such part of the amount in respect of which the lien exists as is presently payable, has been given to the registered holder for the time being of the share, or the person entitled thereto by reason of his death or bankruptcy.
Inclusion.p: PURCHASE OF SHARES ON WHICH LIEN EXISTS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: To give effect to any such sale, the Directors may authorise some person to transfer the shares sold to the purchaser thereof. The purchaser shall be registered as the holder of the shares comprised in any such transfer, and he shall not be bound to see to the application of the purchase money, nor shall his title to the shares be affected by any irregularity or invalidity in the proceedings in reference to the sale.
Inclusion.p: PROCEEDS OF SALE OF SHARES ON WHICH LIEN EXISTS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The proceeds of the sale shall be received by the Company and applied in payment of such part of the amount in respect of which the lien exists as is presently payable, and the residue,
Inclusion.p: if any, shall (subject to a like lien for sums not presently payable as existed upon the shares before the sale) be paid to the person entitled to the shares at the date of the sale.
NO ENTITLEMENT OF RIGHT UNLESS SHARES ARE PAID AS DUE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: No member shall be entitled to receive any dividend or to exercise any privileges as a member until he shall have paid all calls for the time being due and payable on every share held by him, whether alone or jointly with any other person, together with interest and expenses (if any).

Inclusion.p: CALL ON SHARES
CALL ON SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may from time to time make calls upon the members in respect of any money unpaid on their shares and not by the conditions of allotment thereof made payable at fixed times, provided that no call shall be payable at less than one (1) month from the date fixed for the payment of the last preceding call, and each member shall (subject to receiving at least fourteen (14) days’ notice specifying the time or times and place of payment) pay to the Company at the time or times and place so specified the amount called on his shares. A call may be revoked or postponed as the Directors may determine.
Inclusion.p: WHEN IS A CALL MADE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A call shall be deemed to have been made at the time when the resolution of the Directors authorising the call was passed and may be required to be paid by instalments.
Inclusion.p: JOINT LIABILITY FOR PAYMENT OF CALLS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The joint holders of a share shall be jointly and severally liable to pay all calls in respect thereof.
Inclusion.p: INTEREST ON UNPAID CALLS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If a sum called in respect of a share is not paid before or on the day appointed for payment thereof, the person from whom the sum is due shall pay interest on the sum from the day appointed for payment thereof to the time of actual payment at such rate not exceeding eight (8) per cent per annum as the Directors may determine, but the Directors shall be at liberty to waive payment of that interest wholly or in part.
Inclusion.p: DEEMED CALL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Any sum which by the terms of issue of a share becomes payable on allotment or at any fixed date, shall for the purposes of these Articles be deemed to be a call duly made and payable on the date on which by the terms of issue the same becomes payable, and in case of non- payment all the relevant provisions of these Articles as to payment of interest and expenses, forfeiture, or otherwise shall apply as if the sum had become payable by virtue of a call duly made and notified.
Inclusion.p: DIFFERENTIATION BASED ON CALLS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may, on the issue of shares, differentiate between the holders as to the amount of calls to be paid and the times of payment.
Inclusion.p: ADVANCE PAYMENT OF CALL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may, if they think fit, receive from any member willing to advance the same, all or any part of the money uncalled and unpaid upon any shares held by him, and upon all or any part of the money, so advance may (until the same would, but for the advance, become payable) pay interest at such rate not exceeding (unless the Company in general meeting shall otherwise direct) eight (8) per cent per annum as may be agreed upon between the Directors and the member paying the sum in advance.

Inclusion.p: TRANSFER OF SHARES
TRANSFER OF SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to these Articles, any member may Transfer all or any of his shares by instrument in writing in any usual or common form or in any other form which the Directors may approve. The instrument shall be executed by or on behalf of the transferor and the transferor shall remain the holder of the shares transferred until the transfer is registered and the name of the transferee is entered in the register of members in respect thereof.
Inclusion.p: INSTRUMENT OF TRANSFER
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The instrument of transfer must be left for registration at the registered office of the Company together with such fee not exceeding S$1.00 as the Directors from time to time may require, accompanied by the certificate of the shares to which it relates and such other evidence as the Directors may reasonably require to show the right of the transferor to make the transfer, and thereupon the Company shall, subject to the powers vested in the Directors by these Articles, register the transferee as a member and retain the instrument of transfer.
Inclusion.p: REFUSAL TO REGISTER TRANSFER
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may, in their absolute discretion decline to register any transfer of shares but shall in such event, within one (1) month after the date on which the transfer was lodged with the Company send to the transferor and the transferee notice of the refusal and stating the facts, which are considered to justify the refusal to register the transfer. The Directors shall decline to register a transfer of a share if upon registration of the transfer the number of members of the Company would exceed the maximum prescribed herein.
The registration of transfers may be suspended at such times and for such periods as the Directors may from time to time determine not exceeding in the whole thirty (30) days in any year.

Any purported Transfer by a member in violation of these Articles shall be null and void and of no force and effect and the purported transferees shall have no rights or privileges in or with respect to the Company or the shares purported to have been so transferred. The Company shall refuse to recognise any such Transfer and shall not reflect in its records any change in ownership of such shares purported to have been so Transferred.

Inclusion.p: TRANSMISSION OF SHARES
TRANSMISSION OF SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: In case of the death of a member, the survivor or survivors where the deceased was a joint holder, and the legal personal representatives of the deceased where he was a sole holder,
Inclusion.p: shall be the only persons recognised by the Company as having any title to his interest in the shares; but nothing herein contained shall release the estate of a deceased joint holder from any liability in respect of any share which had been jointly held by him with other persons.
REGISTRATION OF TRANSMISSION OF SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Any person becoming entitled to a share in consequence of the death or bankruptcy of a member may, upon such evidence being produced as may from time to time properly be required by the Directors and subject as hereinafter provided, elect either to be registered himself as holder of the share or to have some person nominated by him registered as the transferee thereof, but the Directors shall in either case have the same right to decline or suspend registration as they would have had in the case of a transfer of the share by that member before his death or bankruptcy.
Inclusion.p: PROCEDURE FOR REGISTERING TRANSMISSION OF SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If the person so becoming entitled elects to be registered himself, he shall deliver or send to the Company a notice in writing signed by him stating that he so elects. If he elects to have another person registered he shall testify his election by executing to that person a transfer of the share. All the limitations, restrictions, and provisions of these Articles relating to the right to transfer and the registration of transfers of shares shall be applicable to any such notice or transfer as aforesaid as if the death or bankruptcy of the member had not occurred and the notice or transfer were a transfer signed by that member.
Inclusion.p: RIGHTS OF LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE TO BE SECURED AS REGISTERED HOLDER
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Where the registered holder of any share dies or becomes bankrupt, his personal representative or the assignee of his estate, as the case may be, shall, upon the production of such evidence as may from time to time be properly required by the Directors in that behalf, be entitled to the same dividends and other advantages, and to the same rights (whether in relation to meetings of the Company, or to voting, or otherwise), as the registered holder would have been entitled to if he had not died or become bankrupt; and where two (2) or more persons are jointly entitled to any share in consequence of the death of the registered holder they shall, for the purposes of these Articles, be deemed to be joint holders of the share.

Inclusion.p: FORFEITURE OF SHARES
PAYMENT OF CALL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If a member fails to pay any call or instalment of a call on the day appointed for payment thereof, the Directors may, at any time thereafter during such time as any part of the call or instalment remains unpaid, serve a notice on him requiring payment of so much of the call or instalment as is unpaid, together with any interest which may have accrued.
Inclusion.p: NOTICE REQUIRING PAYMENT OF CALL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The notice shall name a further day (not earlier than the expiration of fourteen (14) days from the date of service of the notice) on or before which the payment required by the notice is to be made and shall state that in the event of non-payment at or before the time appointed, the shares in respect of which the call was made, will be liable to be forfeited.
Inclusion.p: FORFEITURE OF SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If the requirements of any such notice as aforesaid are not complied with, any share in respect of which the notice has been given may at any time thereafter, before the payment required by the notice has been made, be forfeited by a resolution of the Directors to that effect. Such forfeiture shall include all dividends declared in respect of the forfeited shares and not actually paid before the forfeiture.
Inclusion.p: SALE OF FORFEITED SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A forfeited share may be sold or otherwise disposed of on such terms and in such manner as the Directors think fit, and at any time before a sale or disposition the forfeiture may be cancelled on such terms as the Directors think fit.
Inclusion.p: LIABILITY IN RESPECT OF FORFEITED SHARES
