Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A person whose shares have been forfeited shall cease to be a member in respect of the forfeited shares but shall, notwithstanding, remain liable to pay to the Company all money which, at the date of forfeiture, was payable by him to the Company in respect of the shares (together with interest at the rate of eight (8) per cent per annum from the date of forfeiture on the money for the time being unpaid if the Directors think fit to enforce payment of such interest), but his liability shall cease if and when the Company receives payment in full of all such money in respect of the shares.
Inclusion.p: STATUTORY DECLARATION ON FORFEITED SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A Statutory Declaration in writing that the declarant is a Director or Secretary of the Company, and that a share in the Company has been duly forfeited on a date stated in the declaration, shall be conclusive evidence of the facts therein stated as against all persons claiming to be entitled to the share.
Inclusion.p: RE-ISSUE OF FORFEITED SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Company may receive the consideration, if any, given for a forfeited share on any sale or disposition thereof and may execute a transfer of the share in favour of the person to whom the share is sold or disposed of and he shall thereupon be registered as the holder of the share, and shall not be bound to see to the application of the purchase money, if any, nor shall his title to the share be affected by any irregularity or invalidity in the proceedings in reference to the forfeiture, sale, or disposal of the share.
Inclusion.p: APPLICABILITY OF PROVISIONS ON FORFEITURE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The provisions of these Articles as to forfeiture shall apply in the case of non-payment of any sum which, by the terms of issue of a share, becomes payable at a fixed time, as if the same had been payable by virtue of a call duly made and notified.
Inclusion.p: CONVERSION OF SHARES INTO STOCK AND VICE VERSA
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, the Company may, by ordinary resolution passed at a general meeting, convert any paid-up shares into stock and reconvert any stock into paid-up shares of any denomination.

Inclusion.p: CONVERSION OF SHARES INTO STOCK
TRANSFER OF STOCKS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The holders of stock may transfer the same or any part thereof in the same manner and subject to the same regulations as and subject to which the share from which the stock arose might previously to conversion have been transferred or as near thereto as circumstances admit.
Inclusion.p: RIGHTS AND PRIVILEGES OF STOCK HOLDERS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The holders of stock shall, according to the amount of the stock held by them have the same rights, privileges and advantages as regards dividends, voting at meetings of the Company and other matters as if they held the shares from which the stock arose, but no such privilege or advantage (except participation in the dividends and profits of the Company and in the assets on winding up) shall be conferred by any such aliquot part of stock which would not if existing in shares have conferred that privilege or advantage.

Inclusion.p: APPLICABILITY OF PROVISIONS OF PAID-UP SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: All such provisions of these Articles as are applicable to paid-up shares shall apply to stock, and the words “share” and “shareholder” therein shall include “stock” and “stockholder”.

Inclusion.p: ALTERATION OF CAPITAL
ALTERATION OF CAPITAL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, the Company may from time to time by ordinary resolution:
Inclusion.p: (a) increase the share capital by such sum to be divided into shares of such amount as the resolution shall prescribe;
(b) consolidate and divide all or any of its share capital into shares of a larger amount than its existing shares;

(c) subdivide its shares or any of them into shares of, smaller amount than is fixed by the memorandum; so, however, that in the subdivision the proportion between the amount paid and the amount (if any) unpaid on each reduced share shall be the same as it was in the case of the share from which the reduced share is derived;

(d) cancel shares which at the date of the passing of the resolution in that behalf have not been taken or agreed to be taken by any person or which have been forfeited and diminish the amount of its share capital by the amount of the shares so cancelled.
DIRECTORS TO CONTROL NEW SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the provisions of the Act and these Articles (including the Reserved Matters), the shares shall be under the control of the Directors who may issue, allot, place under option or otherwise dispose of the same to such persons on such terms and conditions and at such times as the Directors think fit and with full power to give to any person the right to call for the allotment of any shares at a consideration as the Directors may see fit.
Inclusion.p: PRE-EMPTIVE RIGHTS: ISSUE OF NEW SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, save as set out in Article 45, each Substantial Holder shall have a pre-emptive right to purchase up to its Shareholding Proportion of any shares or securities offered by the Company (which may be exercised by giving a notice of acceptance to the Company within fourteen (14) days from the date of such offer being notified to such Substantial Holder, failing which such right shall be deemed waived), on the same price, terms and conditions as the Company proposes to offer such shares or securities to other potential investor(s), with (in the case of Substantial Holders who have elected to purchase all the shares or securities so offered up to their respective Shareholding Proportion) a right of oversubscription (which may be exercised by giving a notice of further subscription to the Company within fourteen (14) days following the aforementioned fourteen (14) -day period) if any Substantial Holder elects not to purchase its full Shareholding Proportion of the shares or securities so offered, in (as nearly as may be) their respective Shareholding Proportion inter se or in such proportion as they may agree amongst themselves.
Article 45 shall not apply to any issuances of shares or securities of the Company:
Inclusion.p: (a) pursuant to the Plan;
(b) upon conversion of the Preference Shares in accordance with these Articles;
(c) in connection with a bona fide acquisition of another business entity by the Company;
(d) in connection with a Qualified IPO;
(e) in connection with any share split, share dividend, recapitalisation or similar transaction;
(f) upon the conversion of any convertible loan(s) of the Company outstanding as of [●insert Completion Date] in connection with issuance of Series B CPS; and
(g) any securities issued in connection with debt or equipment financing facilities, or in connection with any strategic transactions between the Company and third parties.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: It shall be a condition precedent to the issuance of new shares by the Company to a third party that such third party shall be required to execute the Deed of Ratification and Accession under which it agrees to be bound by and be entitled to the benefit of the SHA as if it were an original party thereto.
Inclusion.p: NEW SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Except so far as otherwise provided by or pursuant to these Articles or by the conditions of issue, any new share capital shall be considered as part of the original share capital of the Company, and shall be subject to the same provisions with reference to the payment of calls, liens, transfer, transmission, forfeiture, and otherwise as the original share capital.
Inclusion.p: REDUCTION OF SHARE CAPITAL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Company may, by special resolution, reduce its share capital in any manner and with, and subject to, any incident authorised, and consent required by law and the Reserved Matters.
Inclusion.p: SHARE BUYBACK
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to and in accordance with the provisions of the Act and the Reserved Matters, the Company may purchase or otherwise acquire ordinary shares issued by it on such terms as the Company may think fit and in the manner prescribed by the Act. All shares repurchased by the Company shall be cancelled.

Inclusion.p: GENERAL MEETINGS
GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Unless otherwise required by these Articles, the Reserved Matters or the Act, all matters arising at any general meeting shall be decided by ordinary resolution of the members present at the meeting.
Inclusion.p: RESERVED MATTERS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Where questions arise or resolutions are proposed at any general meeting of the Company or any meeting of the Board or committee of the Board (as the case may be) in respect of the following matters, the affirmative vote of the Investor or his representative(s), attorney(s) or proxy(ies) at such general meeting, or of the Investor Director at such meeting of the Board or committee of the Board (as the case may be) of the Company shall be required to decide on such questions or pass any such resolutions (as the case may be):
Inclusion.p: (a) any amendment or change of the rights, preferences or privileges of, or the restrictions provided for the benefit of, any of the Preference Shares;

(b) the authorisation or creation (by reclassification or otherwise) of any new class or series of shares having rights, preferences or privileges senior to or on a parity with any of the Preference Shares;

(c) any increase, reduction or other alteration to the issued share capital of the Company, and/or any sale or issue of any equity or debt security or instrument or warrant, option or other right to purchase any equity or debt security (save for any shares issued pursuant to the Plan or upon conversion of the Series A RCPS and/or Series B CPS);
(d) any amendment or waiver of any provision of the memorandum of association of the Company and these Articles;

(e) authorisation of any obligation on the Company to declare or pay any dividend or distribution and any change in the policy of dividend distribution or any action that otherwise results in the redemption or repurchase of any equity security;
(f) any sale or disposal of the whole or a substantial part of the business, goodwill or the assets of the Company, or any subsidiary;

(g) any resolution to approve the liquidation, dissolution or winding up of or the initiation of bankruptcy proceedings against or any application for the appointment of a receiver, judicial manager or like officer for the Company;
(h) any merger, acquisition, consolidation, or reorganisation of the Company;
(i) any recapitalisation, reclassification, split-off, or spin-off of the Company;
(j) any sale, mortgage, pledge, lien, charge, lease, transfer or otherwise disposal of any of the material assets of the Company;

(k) any approval of or amendments to the annual budget, business plan and operating plan (including any capital expenditure budget, operating budget and financing plan), other than as approved by the Board;
(l) any material engagement in any business materially different from that described in the then current business plan or cessation of any business undertaking of any subsidiaries of the Company;

(m) incurring any borrowings, indebtedness or assuming any financial obligation or issuing, assuming, guaranteeing, indemnifying or creating any liability for borrowed money in excess of S$1,000,000 in aggregate at any time outstanding unless such liability is incurred pursuant to the then current business plan of the Company;
(n) the lending of any moneys other than placing of deposits with banks and financial institutions, other than in the ordinary course of business;

(o) making of any acquisition, investment or any expenditure or other purchase of tangible or intangible assets in excess of S$1,000,000 in aggregate over any twelve (12) months unless such acquisition, investment, expenditure or purchase is consistent with the then current business plan of the Company;

(p) entry into any material agreement or contract with any party or group of related parties under which the Company’s aggregate commitments, pledge or obligations to such party or group of related parties are unlimited or potentially exceed S$1,000,000 over any twelve (12) months or in the aggregate;

(q) engagement or entry into any transaction or agreement with a value in excess of S$1,000,000 (either in terms of aggregate transaction value or annual consideration payable) with any of the Company’s affiliates, members, Directors or other related parties, other than employment agreements (save as provided in Article 52(s)), stock and option agreements and similar arrangements;
(r) any change in the size and composition of the Board or any committee thereof;
(s) any appointment, termination or determination of the chief executive officer, president, chief operating officer or chief financial officer of the Company;
(t) any material change to the accounting methods or policies adopted by the Company or any appointment or change of the auditors of the Company;
(u) the selection of the listing stock exchange or the underwriters for the Qualified IPO or any resolution to approve the valuation and terms and conditions of the Qualified IPO;
(v) any disposal of or dilution of the Company’s interest, directly or indirectly, in any of its subsidiaries;
(w) the institution, commencement, defence, compromise or settlement by the Company of any litigation or arbitration or administrative proceedings in excess
of S$1,000,000 on a per matter basis (except for the collection of debts in the ordinary course of the business of the Company);
(x) the approval of the audited balance sheet and profit and loss account of the Company and any report or statement accompanying such balance sheet and profit and loss account; and

(y) the establishment of any new employee stock option scheme or phantom employee stock option scheme of the Company (save for the Plan) or any amendment to the terms of the Plan (including the size of the option pool of the Plan).
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Where questions arise or resolutions are proposed at any general meeting of the Company or any meeting of the Board or committee of the Board (as the case may be) in respect of the following matters, the affirmative vote of the Series B CPS Shareholders holding a simple majority of the Series B CPS at a class meeting of Series B CPS Shareholders or a general meeting of the Company shall be required to decide on such questions or pass any such resolutions (as the case may be):
Inclusion.p: (a) the authorisation or creation (by reclassification or otherwise) of any new class or series of shares having rights, preferences or privileges senior to or on a parity with any of the Series B CPS;

(b) incurring any borrowings, indebtedness or assuming any financial obligation or issuing, assuming, guaranteeing, indemnifying or creating any liability for borrowed money in excess of S$10,000,000.00 in aggregate at any time outstanding unless such liability is incurred pursuant to the then current business plan of the Company;

(c) the authorisation of any obligation on the Company to declare or pay any dividend or distribution on ordinary shares and any change in the policy of dividend distribution or any action that otherwise results in the redemption or repurchase of any ordinary shares;
(d) any repurchase of ordinary shares, except upon termination of employment of an employee of the Company at cost pursuant to the terms of the Plan or other arrangements approved by the Board;
(e) any amendment or change of the rights, preferences or privileges of, or the restrictions provided for the benefit of, any of the Preference Shares;

(f) any authorisation or issuance of any equity or debt security (other than as permitted pursuant to Article 53(b)) or instrument or warrant, option or other right to purchase any equity or debt security (other than as permitted pursuant to Article 53(b)) or instrument in the Company having rights, preferences or privileges senior to or on a parity with any of the Preference Shares; and

(g) any amendment or waiver of any provision of the memorandum and articles of association of the Company which would restrict, amend or change the rights, preferences or privileges of the Series B CPS.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to Article 52(f) above, where a resolution is proposed at any general meeting of the Company in respect of a Trade Sale:
Inclusion.p: (a) a simple majority of the votes cast by members holding ordinary shares in the Company, present and voting at a general meeting of members holding ordinary shares in the Company, whether in person or by proxy, approving such Trade Sale; and
(b) a simple majority of the votes cast by Preference Shareholders, present and voting at a general meeting of Preference Shareholders, whether in person or by proxy, approving such Trade Sale,
shall be required to pass any such resolution.
CONVENING OF GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Company shall, in each year, hold an Annual General Meeting in addition to any other meetings in that year and not more than fifteen (15) months shall elapse between the date of one (1) Annual General Meeting of the Company and that of the next. All general meetings other than the annual general meetings shall be called extraordinary general meetings. Any Director may, whenever he thinks fit, convene an extraordinary general meeting, and extraordinary general meetings shall be convened on such requisition or in default may be convened by such requisitionists as provided by the Act.
Inclusion.p: WHEN PHYSICAL MEETING IS NOT PRACTICAL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: In the event that a physical general meeting is not practical or not able to be held, it shall be conducted by means of telephone and or video conferencing call or similar communications equipment whereby all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other and participation in the meeting in this manner shall be deemed to constitute in person at such meeting. Such a meeting shall be deemed to take place where the largest group of members present for the purposes of the meeting is assembled or, if there is no such group, where the Chairman of the meeting is present.
Inclusion.p: NOTICE CALLING GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: At least twenty-one (21) days’ notice in writing (exclusive both of the day on which the notice is served or deemed to be served and of the day for which the notice is given) shall be given for any General Meeting at which it is proposed to pass a Special Resolution or a resolution of which special notice is required under the Act and at least fourteen (14) days’ notice in writing (exclusive both of the day on which the notice is served or deemed to be served and of the day for which the notice is given) shall be given for every other General Meeting, in each case, to such persons as are entitled to receive such notices from the Company and specifying the place, the day and the hour of the meeting and in case of special business, the general nature of that business.
Inclusion.p: SPECIAL BUSINESS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: All business shall be special that is transacted at an extraordinary general meeting, and also all that is transacted at an annual general meeting, with the exception of declaring a dividend, consideration of the accounts, balance-sheets, and the report of the Directors and auditors, the election of Directors in the place of those retiring, and the appointment and fixing of the remuneration of the auditors.

Inclusion.p: PROCEEDINGS AT GENERAL MEETINGS
QUORUM AT GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: No business shall be transacted at any general meeting unless a quorum of members is present at the time when the meeting proceeds to business. The number of members necessary to form a quorum for the transaction of business at a general meeting shall be two (2) members present personally or by representative, attorney or proxy, one (1) of whom shall be the Investor, whether present by representative, attorney or proxy, and at least one (1) of whom shall be one (1) of the Founders. However, if the Company has only a sole member, then a consent of written resolution signed by the member will suffice.
Inclusion.p: INSUFFICIENT QUORUM AND ADJOURNMENT OF GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If within half an hour from the time appointed for holding the meeting a quorum is not present, the meeting shall be adjourned to seven (7) days thereafter at the same time and place and no notice needs to be given to the members in relation to such adjourned meeting. The quorum shall remain the same for any adjourned general meeting and if a meeting is adjourned for a second time due to lack of a quorum, the member or members present at such re-adjourned general meeting shall be the quorum.
Inclusion.p: CHAIRMAN OF GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The chairman, if any, of the Board shall preside as chairman at every general meeting of the Company, or if there is no such chairman, or if he is not present within fifteen (15) minutes after the time appointed for the meeting or is unwilling to act, the members present shall elect one (1) of their number to be chairman of the meeting.
Inclusion.p: ADJOURNED GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The chairman may, with the consent of any meeting at which a quorum is present, and shall if so directed by the meeting, adjourn the meeting from time to time and from place to place, but no business shall be transacted at any adjourned meeting other than the business left unfinished at the meeting from which the adjournment took place. When a meeting is adjourned for thirty (30) days or more, notice of the adjourned meeting shall be given as in the case of an original meeting. Save as aforesaid it shall not be necessary to give any notice of an adjournment or of the business to be transacted at an adjourned meeting.
Inclusion.p: VOTING ON RESOLUTIONS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: At any general meeting a resolution put to the vote of the meeting shall be decided on a show of hands unless a poll is (before or on the declaration of the result of the show of hands) demanded:
Inclusion.p: (1) by the chairman;
(2) by at least two (2) members present in person or by proxy;
(3) by any member or members present in person or by proxy and representing not less than one-tenth (1/10th) of the total voting rights of all the members having the right to vote at the meeting, or
(4) by any member or members holding shares in the Company conferring a right to vote at the meeting being shares on which an aggregate sum has been paid up equal to not
less than one-tenth (1/10th) of the total sum paid up on all the shares conferring that right.

Unless a poll is so demanded (and the demand be not withdrawn), a declaration by the chairman that a resolution has, on a show of hands, been carried or carried unanimously, or by a particular majority, or lost, and an entry to that effect in the book containing the minutes of the proceedings of the Company shall be conclusive evidence of the fact without proof of the number or proportion of the votes recorded in favour of or against the resolution. The demand for a poll may be withdrawn.
DEMAND FOR A POLL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If a poll is duly demanded it shall be taken in such manner and either at once or after an interval or adjournment or otherwise as the chairman directs, and the result of the poll shall be the resolution of the meeting at which the poll was demanded, but a poll demanded on the election of a chairman or on a question of adjournment shall be taken forthwith.
Inclusion.p: CASTING VOTE FOR CHAIRMAN
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The chairman of the Board shall not be entitled to a second or casting vote at any general meeting of the Company.
Inclusion.p: POLL NOT TO DISTURB CONTINUITY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The demand for a poll shall not prevent the continuance of a meeting for the transaction of any business, other than the question for which a poll has been demanded.
Inclusion.p: ENTITLEMENT TO VOTE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to any rights or restrictions for the time being attached to any class or classes of shares, at meetings of members or classes of members, each member entitled to vote may vote in person or by proxy or by attorney, and on a show of hands every person present who is member or a representative of a member shall have one (1) vote, and on a poll every member present in person or by proxy or by attorney or other duly appointed authorised representative shall have one (1) vote for each share he holds.
Inclusion.p: VOTE BY JOINT HOLDERS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: In the case of joint holders, the vote of the senior who tenders a vote, whether in person or by proxy, shall be accepted to the exclusion of the votes of the other joint holders; and for this purpose seniority shall be determined by the order in which the names stand in the register of members.
Inclusion.p: VOTE BY MEMBER OF UNSOUND MIND
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A member who is of unsound mind or whose person or estate is liable to be dealt with in any way under the law relating to mental disorder may vote, whether on a show of hands or on a poll, by his committee or by such other person as properly has the management of his estate, and any such committee or other person may vote by proxy or attorney.
Inclusion.p: NO VOTE UNLESS CALLS ARE PAID
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: No member shall be entitled to vote at any general meeting unless all calls or other sums presently payable by him in respect of shares in the Company have been paid.
Inclusion.p: DISQUALIFICATION OF VOTER
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: No objection shall be raised to the qualification of any voter except at the meeting or adjourned meeting at which the vote objected to is given or tendered, and every vote not disallowed at such meeting shall be valid for all purposes. Any such objection made in due time shall be referred to the chairman of the meeting, whose decision shall be final and conclusive.
Inclusion.p: PROXY TO BE IN WRITING
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The instrument appointing a proxy and the power of attorney or other authority, if any, under which it is signed or a notarially certified copy of that power or authority shall be deposited at the registered office of the Company, or at such other place within Singapore as is specified for that purpose in the notice convening the meeting, not less than forty-eight (48) hours before the time for holding the meeting or adjourned meeting at which the person named in the instrument proposes to vote, or, in the case of a poll, not less than twenty-four (24) hours before the time appointed for the taking of the poll, and in default the instrument of proxy shall not be treated as valid.
Inclusion.p: FORM OF PROXY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Where it is desired to afford members an opportunity of voting for or against a resolution the instrument appointing a proxy shall be in the following form or a form as near thereto as circumstances admit:
Inclusion.p: REDMART LIMITED
I/We, of being a member/members of the above-named Company, hereby appoint of or failing him, of as my/our proxy to vote for me/us on my/our behalf at the (annual or extraordinary, as the
case may be) general meeting of the Company, to be held on the
, and at any adjournment thereof.
Signed this day of .
This form is to be used *in favour of/against the resolution.
day of
DEPOSIT OF PROXY FORM
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The instrument appointing a proxy shall be in writing, in the common or usual form, under the hand of the appointer or of his attorney duly authorised in writing or, if the appointer is a corporation, either under Seal or under the hand of an officer or attorney duly authorised. A proxy may but need not be a member of the Company. The instrument appointing a proxy shall be deemed to confer authority to demand or join in demanding a poll.
Inclusion.p: IRREGULARITY PROXY NOTE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A vote given in accordance with the terms of an instrument of proxy or attorney shall be valid notwithstanding the previous death or unsoundness of mind of the principal or revocation of the instrument or of the authority under which the instrument was executed, or the transfer of
Inclusion.p: the share in respect of which the instrument is given, if no intimation in writing of such death, unsoundness of mind, revocation, or transfer as aforesaid has been received by the Company at the registered office before the commencement of the meeting or adjourned meeting at which the instrument is used.
DIRECTORS: APPOINTMENT, ROTATION, VACATION, ETC.
NUMBER OF DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Board shall comprise three (3) Directors, being the Founders and the Investor Director.
Inclusion.p: ALTERNATE DIRECTOR
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Any Director may, from time to time, appoint any person (not disapproved by a majority of the other Directors for the time being) to be an alternate director of the Company, and may at any time remove the alternate director so appointed by him from office. An alternate director so appointed shall not be entitled to receive any remuneration from the Company, but shall be entitled to receive notices of and attend all meetings of the Directors, and to vote as a Director at any such meeting at which the Director appointing him is not present, and generally in the absence of his appointor to perform all the functions of his appointor as a Director. An alternate director shall ipso facto cease to be an alternate director if his appointor ceases for any reason to be a Director.
Inclusion.p: All appointments and removals of alternate directors made by any Director in pursuance of the provisions of these Articles shall be in writing under the hand of the Director making the same and left at the office. The nomination of an alternate director shall be valid if made by cable or telegram provided that such nomination shall be confirmed within three (3) months from the date of such cable or telegram by a written nomination complying with the abovementioned requirements, and any act done by the alternate director nominated in such cable or telegram between the date thereof and the date of the receipt within the prescribed period by the Company of the written nomination shall be as valid and effectual as if such alternate director had been duly appointed in the first instance, whether such written nomination shall be received by the Company within the prescribed period or not.
RETIREMENT OF DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: At the first annual general meeting of the Company, all the Directors shall retire from office, and at the annual general meeting in every subsequent year one-third (1/3) of the Directors for the time being, or, if their number is not three (3) or a multiple of three (3), then the number nearest one-third (1/3), shall retire from office.
Inclusion.p: BASIS FOR RETIREMENT
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors to retire in every year shall be those who have been longest in office since their last election, but as between persons who became Directors on the same day those to retire shall (unless they otherwise agree among themselves) be determined by lot. A retiring Director shall be eligible for re-election.
Inclusion.p: RE-APPOINTMENT OF DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to these Articles (including the Reserved Matters), the Company at the meeting at which a Director so retires may fill the vacated office by electing a person thereto, and in default the retiring Director shall, if offering himself for re-election and not being disqualified under the Act from holding office as a Director, be deemed to have been re-elected, unless at
Inclusion.p: that meeting it is expressly resolved not to fill the vacated office, or unless a resolution for the re-election of that Director is put to the meeting and lost.
CHANGE IN NUMBER OF DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to these Articles (including the Reserved Matters), the Company may, from time to time by ordinary resolution passed at a general meeting, increase or reduce the number of Directors, and may also determine in what rotation the increased or reduced number is to go out of office.
Inclusion.p: APPOINTMENT OF NEW DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to these Articles (including the Reserved Matters), the Directors shall have power at any time, and from time to time to appoint any person to be a Director, either to fill a casual vacancy or as an addition to the existing Directors, but so that the total number of Directors shall not at any time exceed the number fixed in accordance with these Articles. Any Director so appointed shall hold office only until the next following annual general meeting, and shall then be eligible for re-election but shall not be taken into account in determining the Directors who are to retire by rotation at that meeting.
Inclusion.p: REMOVAL OF DIRECTOR
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to these Articles (including the Reserved Matters), the Company may, by ordinary resolution, remove any Director before the expiration of his period of office, and may, by an ordinary resolution, appoint another person in his stead; the person so appointed shall be subject to retirement at the same time as if he had become a Director on the day on which the Director in whose place he is appointed was last elected a Director.
Inclusion.p: INVESTOR DIRECTOR
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Investor shall be entitled to request the appointment of one (1) Director, such Director being a person who is not engaged or involved (whether as an employee, Director, officer or substantial shareholder) in any business which is in competition with the business carried on by the Company as at the date of such appointment. Each member shall exercise its rights as a member of the Company to procure the appointment or removal, as the case may be, of any Investor Director whose appointment or removal, as the case may be, is requested by the Investor. The right of appointment of the Investor Director conferred on the Investor under this Article 84 shall include the right of the Investor to remove from office at any time and from time to time such person appointed by it as a Director and the right of the Investor at any time and from time to time to determine the period during which such person shall hold the office of Director.
Inclusion.p: So long as the Investor retains the right to appoint the Investor Director, the Investor shall also have the right to nominate a member to each committee constituted by the Board for the administration of the Plan.

In addition, subject to Visionnaire being and remaining a Substantial Holder, Visionnaire has the right to designate one (1) representative to attend all meetings of the Board and all Board committees of the Company in a nonvoting observer capacity (“Visionnaire Board Observer”). This Visionnaire Board Observer shall initially be Mr. Keith Nilsson of Visionnaire and any replacement shall be subject to the prior approval of the Board (acting reasonably). The Company shall provide the Visionnaire Board Observer with copies of all notices and materials provided to the Directors at the same time and in the same manner as provided to the Directors. If Visionnaire ceases at any time to constitute a Substantial Holder
it shall no longer be entitled to designate a Visionnaire Board Observer and the right to attend meetings and receive information under this clause shall not apply
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Every request for the appointment or removal of a Director by the Investor shall be in writing and signed by or on behalf of the Investor, and shall be delivered to the office. Whenever for any reason a person appointed by the Investor ceases to be a Director, the Investor shall be entitled to appoint forthwith another Director.
Inclusion.p: REMUNERATION OF DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The remuneration, if any, of the Directors shall from time to time be determined by the Company in general meeting. That remuneration shall be deemed to accrue from day to day. The Directors may also be paid all travelling, hotel, and other expenses properly incurred by them in attending and returning from meetings of the Directors or any committee of the Directors or general meetings of the Company or in connection with the business of the Company.

The Company shall reimburse all reasonable expenses of the Investor Director and/or his alternate, related to all Board activities, subject to prior written approval of such expenses. The Company further undertakes to provide customary directorship insurance coverage for, and maximum indemnification of, the Board (if required) for the purposes of any initial public offering of the Company’s securities.
Inclusion.p: QUALIFICATION SHARES
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: It shall not be necessary for Directors to hold any share qualification in the Company.
Inclusion.p: VACATIONS OF OFFICE BY DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The office of director shall become vacant if the Director:
Inclusion.p: (1) ceases to be a Director by virtue of the Act;
(2) becomes bankrupt or makes any arrangement or composition with his creditors generally;
(3) becomes prohibited from being a director by reason of any order made under the Act;
(4) becomes of unsound mind or a person whose person or estate is liable to be dealt with in any way under the law relating to mental disorder;
(5) resigns his office by notice in writing to the Company;
(6) for more than six (6) months is absent without permission of the Directors from meetings of the Directors held during that period;
(7) without the consent of the Company in general meeting, holds any other office of profit under the Company except that of managing director or manager; or
(8) is directly or indirectly interested in any contract or proposed contract with the Company and fails to declare the nature of his interest in manner required by the Act.
POWERS AND DUTIES OF DIRECTORS
MANAGEMENT OF BUSINESS BY DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The business of the Company shall be managed by the Directors who may pay all expenses incurred in promoting and registering the Company, and may exercise all such powers of the Company as are not, by the Act or by these Articles, required to be exercised by the Company in general meeting, subject, nevertheless, to any of these Articles, to the provisions of the Act, and to such resolutions, being not inconsistent with the aforesaid Articles or provisions, as may be prescribed by the Company in general meeting; but no resolution made by the Company in general meeting shall invalidate any prior act of the Directors which would have been valid if that resolution had not been made.
Inclusion.p: BORROWING POWER
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may exercise all the powers of the Company to borrow money and to mortgage or charge its undertaking, property, and uncalled capital, or any part thereof, and to issue debentures and other securities whether outright or as security for any debt, liability, or obligation of the Company or of any third party.
Inclusion.p: USE OF SEAL OUTSIDE SINGAPORE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may exercise all the powers of the Company in relation to any official Seal for use outside Singapore and in relation to branch registers.
Inclusion.p: APPOINTMENT OF POWER OF ATTORNEY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may, from time to time, by power of attorney appoint any corporation, firm, or person or body of persons, whether nominated directly or indirectly by the Directors, to be the attorney or attorneys of the Company for such purposes and with such powers, authorities, and discretions (not exceeding those vested in or exercisable by the Directors under these Articles) and for such period and subject to such conditions as they may think fit, and any such powers of attorney may contain such provisions for the protection and convenience of persons dealing with any such attorney as the Directors may think fit and may also authorise any such attorney to delegate all or any of the powers, authorities, and discretions vested in him.
Inclusion.p: SIGNING AUTHORITY FOR CHEQUES, ETC.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: All cheques, promissory notes, drafts, bills of exchange, and other negotiable instruments, and all receipts for money paid to the Company, shall be signed, drawn, accepted, endorsed, or otherwise executed, as the case may be, in such other manner as the Directors from time to time determine.
Inclusion.p: MINUTES OF MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors shall cause minutes to be made:
Inclusion.p: (1) of all appointments of officers;
(2) of names of Directors present at all meetings of the Company and of the Directors; and
(3) of all proceedings at all meetings of the Company and of the Directors.

Such minutes shall be signed by the Chairman of the meeting at which the proceedings were held or by the Chairman of the next succeeding meeting. At any one time when the Company has a sole member or sole Director, a minute signed by the sole member or sole Director stating that any act, matter or thing or any ordinary or special resolution has been performed or duly passed by a meeting of the Company or a Director’s meeting, as the case may be, the act, matter or thing or any ordinary or special resolution shall for all purposes, be deemed to have been performed or passed by a meeting of the Company or a Director’s meeting.
PROCEEDINGS OF DIRECTORS
DIRECTORS’ MEETING
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors shall meet at least once every fiscal quarter in Singapore or any other place as the Board may decide for purposes of discussing reports and other matters. All Directors (including alternate directors) shall be entitled to receive appropriate notices and minutes of all meetings of the Board. A Director may, at any time, and the Secretary shall, on the requisition of a Director, summon a meeting of the Directors.
Inclusion.p: MINUTES OF DIRECTORS’ MEETING
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Discussion at all meetings of the Board shall be duly recorded by such person as the Board may direct. Minutes of such meetings shall be drawn up and circulated to all Directors at least two (2) Business Days prior to the next meeting of the Board.
Inclusion.p: DIRECTORS’ MEETING BY VIDEO CONFERENCING
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Any Director or member of a committee of the Directors may participate in a meeting of the Directors or such committee by means of telephone and or video conferencing call or similar communications equipment whereby all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other and participation in the meeting in this manner shall be deemed to constitute in person at such meeting. Such a meeting shall be deemed to take place where the largest group of Directors present for the purposes of the meeting is assembled or, if there is no such group, where the chairman is present.
Inclusion.p: VOTING ON RESOLUTIONS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Each Director present personally or by his alternate shall be entitled to one (1) vote at all meetings of the Board.
Inclusion.p: CASTING VOTE OF CHAIRMAN
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to these Articles (including the Reserved Matters), questions arising at any meeting of Directors shall be decided by a simple majority of votes and a determination by a simple majority of Directors shall for all purposes be deemed a determination of the Directors. The chairman of the Board shall not be entitled to a second or casting vote at any meeting of the Board.
Inclusion.p: DISCLOSURE OF DIRECTORS’ INTEREST AND VOTING ON CERTAIN MATTERS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A Director who is, in any way, whether directly or indirectly, interested in a transaction or proposed transaction with the Company, shall declare the nature of his interest in accordance with the provisions of the Act. A Director shall not be prohibited from voting or being counted in a quorum at any meeting of the Board in respect of any contract or arrangement in which he is or may be interested provided he has disclosed the nature of his interest in
Inclusion.p: accordance with the memorandum of association of the Company, these Articles and all applicable law (including Section 156 of the Act).
A Director of the Company shall not be deemed interested or to have been at anytime interested in any transaction or proposed transactions by reason only in a case where:
(1) the transaction or proposed transaction relates to any loan to the Company, that he has guaranteed or joined in guaranteeing the repayment of the loan or any part of the loan;

(2) the transaction or proposed transaction has been or will be made with or for the benefit of or on behalf of a corporation which by virtue of Sec 6 of the Act is deemed to be related to the Company, that he is a director of that corporation.
QUORUM FOR DIRECTORS’ MEETING
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The quorum of all meetings of the Board shall be two (2) Directors, of whom one (1) shall be the Investor Director or his alternate.

Where no quorum is present at any duly convened Board meeting, the Board meeting shall be adjourned to seven (7) days thereafter at the same time and place. The quorum shall remain the same for any adjourned Board meeting and if a Board meeting is adjourned for a second time due to lack of quorum, the quorum for such re-adjourned Board meeting shall be any two
Inclusion.p: (2) Directors.
CONTINUING DIRECTORS TO INCREASE NUMBER OF DIRECTORS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, the continuing Directors may act notwithstanding any vacancy in their body, but if and so long as their number is reduced below the number fixed by or pursuant to these Articles as the necessary quorum of Directors, the continuing Director or Directors may act for the purpose of increasing the number of Directors to that number or of summoning a general meeting of the Company, but for no other purpose.
Inclusion.p: DELEGATION ON POWERS TO COMMITTEE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, the Directors may delegate any of their powers to committees consisting of such member or members of their body as they think fit; any committee so formed shall in the exercise of the powers so delegated conform to any regulations that may be imposed on it by the Directors.
Inclusion.p: ELECTION OF CHAIRMAN
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may elect a chairman of their meetings and determine the period for which he is to hold office; but if no such chairman is elected, or if at any meeting the chairman is not present within ten (10) minutes after the time appointed for holding the meeting, the Directors present may choose one (1) of their number to be chairman of the meeting.
Inclusion.p: DECISIONS BY COMMITTEE
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A committee may meet and adjourn as it thinks proper. Subject to these Articles (including the Reserved Matters), questions arising at any meeting shall be determined by a majority of votes of the committee members present, and in the case of an equality of votes, the chairman of the committee shall not be entitled to a second or casting vote.
Inclusion.p: IRREGULARITIES IN APPOINTMENT
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: All acts done by any meeting of the Directors or of a committee of Directors or by any person acting as a Director shall, notwithstanding that it is afterwards discovered that there was some defect in the appointment of any such Director or person acting as aforesaid, or that they or any of them were disqualified, be as valid as if every such person had been duly appointed and was qualified to be a director.
Inclusion.p: RESOLUTION IN WRITING
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, a resolution in writing signed by a majority of the Directors shall be as valid and effectual as if it had been passed at a meeting of the Board duly convened and held, as long as such resolution(s) in writing has been circulated to all the Directors (including the Investor Director), and may consist of several documents in the like form, each signed by one (1) or more persons.
Inclusion.p: For the purpose of this Article 109, “in writing” and “signed” shall include approval by fax and telex or via electronic mail.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: All such resolutions shall be described as “Directors’ Resolutions” and shall be forwarded or otherwise delivered to the Secretary without delay, and shall be recorded by the Secretary in the Company’s Minute Book. A Directors’ resolution shall be inoperative if it shall purport to authorise or to do any act which the Reserved Matters or a meeting of the Board has decided shall not be authorised or done, until confirmed with the affirmative vote of the Investor or the Investor Director or by meeting of the Board (as the case may be).

Any such resolution may consist of several documents in like form, each signed by one (1) or more Directors, and shall be effective as of the date of the resolution, or, if the resolution is signed in two (2) or more counterparts, as of the last date appearing on the counterparts. At any one time when the Company has only a sole Director, a resolution signed by that sole Director shall, for all purposes, be deemed to have been duly passed.

Inclusion.p: MANAGING DIRECTOR
APPOINTMENT OF MANAGING DIRECTOR
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may, from time to time, appoint one (1) or more of their body to the office of managing director for such period and on such terms as they think fit and, subject to the terms of any agreement entered into in any particular case, may revoke any such appointment. A Director so appointed shall not, while holding that office, be subject to retirement by rotation or be taken into account in determining the rotation of retirement of Directors, but his appointment shall be automatically determined if he ceases from any cause to be a Director.
Inclusion.p: REMUNERATION TO MANAGING DIRECTOR
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A managing director shall, subject to the terms of any agreement entered into in any particular case, receive such remuneration, whether by way of salary, commission, or participation in profits, or partly in one way and partly in another, as the Directors may determine.
Inclusion.p: DELEGATION OF POWERS TO MANAGING DIRECTOR
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may entrust to and confer upon a managing director any of the powers exercisable by them upon such terms and conditions and with such restrictions as they may
Inclusion.p: think fit, and either collaterally with or to the exclusion of their own powers, and may from time to time revoke, withdraw, alter, or vary all or any of these powers.
ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS
ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may, from time to time, appoint any person to be an associate director and may from time to time cancel any such appointment. The Directors may fix, determine and vary the powers, duties and remuneration of any person so appointed, but a person so appointed shall not be required to hold any shares to qualify him for appointment nor have any right to attend or vote at any meeting of Directors except by the invitation and with the consent of the Directors.

Inclusion.p: SECRETARY
SECRETARY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The secretary shall, in accordance with the Act, be appointed by the Directors for such term, at such remuneration, and upon such conditions as they may think fit; and any secretary so appointed may be removed by them.

Inclusion.p: SEAL
COMMON SEAL
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Director shall provide for the safe custody of the Seal, which shall only be used by the authority of the Directors or of a committee of the Directors authorised by the Directors in that behalf, and every instrument to which the Seal is affixed shall be signed by a Director and shall be countersigned by the secretary or by a second Director or by some other person appointed by the Directors for the purpose.

Inclusion.p: ACCOUNTS
ACCOUNTING RECORDS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors shall cause proper accounting and other records to be kept and shall distribute copies of balance-sheets and other documents as required by the Act and subject to Article 119 below, shall, from time to time, determine whether and to what extent and at what times and places and under what conditions or regulations the accounting and other records of the Company or any of them shall be open to the inspection of members not being Directors, and no member (not being a Director) shall have any right of inspecting any account or book or paper of the Company except as conferred by statute and these Articles or authorised by the Directors or by the Company in general meeting.

Inclusion.p: INFORMATION RIGHTS
INVESTOR INFORMATION RIGHTS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: For so long as the Investor continues to hold any shares, the Company shall and the members shall exercise their rights as members in relation to the Company so as to ensure that the Company shall:
Inclusion.p: (a) deliver to the Investor the following relating to the Company and its subsidiaries, in English and in a form acceptable to the Investor:
(i) the unaudited consolidated annual financial statements and management report, within ninety (90) days after the end of each fiscal year;
(ii) the unaudited consolidated quarterly financial statements and management report, within twenty-one (21) days after the end of each fiscal quarter;
(iii) the unaudited consolidated monthly financial statements and management report, within twenty-one (21) days after the end of each fiscal month;

(iv) a detailed quarterly budget (including estimated major items of revenue and expenses/capital expenditure and projections for the following twelve (12)-month period) for the following fiscal quarter, within fifteen (15) days prior to the end of each fiscal quarter; and
(v) copies of all documents or other information sent to any Shareholder in its capacity as a Shareholder.

All financial statements shall be prepared on a consistent basis in accordance with accounting reporting standards as may be reasonably approved by the Investor in writing, and all management reports shall include a comparison of financial results with the corresponding quarterly and annual budgets;

(b) provide the Investor with the right to inspect copies of any reports filed by the Company with any relevant securities exchange, regulatory authority or governmental agency (including but not limited to the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore); and

(c) with at least three (3) Business Days’ prior written notice, grant the Investor the right to, at Investor’s expense, inspect the books and records of the Company and to discuss the business, operations and conditions of the Company with the Directors, officers, employees, accountants, legal counsel and investment bankers of the Company, provided that the Company may exclude any materials or disapprove any inspection to the extent reasonably determined by the Company to protect the Company’s proprietary information or trade secrets.
SUBSTANTIAL HOLDER INFORMATION RIGHTS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Upon request by a Substantial Holder, the Company shall, and the members shall exercise their rights as members in relation to the Company, so as to ensure that the Company shall:
Inclusion.p: (a) deliver to the Substantial Holder the following relating to the Company and its subsidiaries, in English and in a form acceptable to the Substantial Holder:
(i) the unaudited consolidated annual financial statements for the previous fiscal year;
(ii) the unaudited consolidated quarterly financial statements for the previous fiscal quarters; and
(iii) the current business plan.
All financial statements shall be prepared on a consistent basis in accordance with accounting reporting standards as may be reasonably approved by the Investor in
writing, and all management reports shall include a comparison of financial results with the corresponding quarterly and annual budgets;

(b) provide the Substantial Holder with the right to inspect copies of any reports filed by the Company with any relevant securities exchange, regulatory authority or governmental agency (including but not limited to the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore); and

(c) with at least three (3) Business Days’ prior written notice, grant the Substantial Holder the right to, at the Substantial Holder’s expense, inspect the books and records of the Company and to discuss the business, operations and conditions of the Company with the Directors, officers, employees and accountants of the Company, provided that the Company may exclude any materials or disapprove any inspection to the extent reasonably determined by the Company to protect the Company’s proprietary information or trade secrets.
DIVIDENDS AND RESERVES
DECLARATION OF DIVIDENDS IN GENERAL MEETING
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, the Company, in general meeting, may declare dividends, but no dividend shall exceed the amount recommended by the Directors.
Inclusion.p: INTERIM DIVIDEND
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the Reserved Matters, the Directors may, from time to time, pay to members such interim dividend as it appears to the Directors to be justified by the profits of the Company.
Inclusion.p: DIVIDENDS FROM PROFITS ONLY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: No dividend shall be paid otherwise than out of profits or shall bear interest against the Company.
Inclusion.p: CREATION OF RESERVES OUT OF PROFITS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may, before recommending any dividend, set aside out of the profits of the Company such sums as they think proper as reserves which shall, at the discretion of the Directors, be applicable for any purpose to which the profits of the Company may be properly applied, and pending any such application may, at the like discretion, either be employed in the business of the Company or be invested in such investments (other than shares in the Company) as the Directors may, from time to time, think fit subject to the Reserved Matters. The Directors may also without placing the same to reserve carry forward any profits, which they may think prudent not to divide.
Inclusion.p: ENTITLEMENT OF DIVIDENDS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Subject to the rights of persons, if any, entitled to shares with special rights as to dividend, all dividends shall be declared and paid according to the amounts paid or credited as paid on the shares in respect of which the dividend is paid, but no amount paid or credited as paid on a share in advance of calls shall be treated for the purposes of this Article 125 as paid on the share. All dividends shall be apportioned and paid proportionately to the amounts paid or credited as paid on the shares during any portion or portions of the period in respect of which the dividend is paid; but if any share is issued on terms providing that it shall rank for dividends from a particular date that share shall rank for dividend accordingly.
Inclusion.p: CALLS TO BE DEDUCTED FROM DIVIDENDS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Directors may deduct from any dividend payable to any member all sums of money, if any, presently payable by him to the Company on account of calls or otherwise in relation to the shares of the Company.
Inclusion.p: DIVIDEND AND BONUS FROM ASSETS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Any general meeting declaring a dividend or bonus may direct payment of such dividend or bonus wholly or partly by the distribution of specific assets and in particular of paid-up shares, debentures or debenture stock of any other company or in any one or more of such ways and the Directors shall give effect to such resolution, and where any difficulty arises in regard to such distribution, the Directors may settle the same as they think expedient, and fix the value for distribution of such specific assets or any part thereof and may determine that cash payments shall be made to any members upon the footing of the value so fixed in order to adjust the rights of all parties, and may vest any such specific assets in trustees as may seem expedient to the Directors.
Inclusion.p: PAYMENT OF DIVIDEND IN CASH
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Any dividend, interest, or other money payable in cash in respect of shares may be paid by cheque or warrant sent through the post directed to the registered address of the holder or, in the case of joint holders, to the registered address of that one (1) of the joint holders who is first named on the register of members or to such person and to such address as the holder or joint holders may in writing direct. Every such cheque or warrant shall be made payable to the order of the person to whom it is sent. Any one (1) of two (2) or more joint holders may give effectual receipts for any dividends, bonuses, or other money payable in respect of the shares held by them as joint holders.

Inclusion.p: FINANCE FOR THE COMPANY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The finance for the business of the Company shall be provided by (i) additional equity financing and/or (ii) loans and other credit facilities from the Company’s bankers and other parties on such terms as the Board may, subject to the Reserved Matters, agree.

None of the members shall be required to provide any form of security or comfort in respect of any banking or credit facility granted to the Company or in relation to it or its businesses. In the event that undertakings, guarantees or any other securities are provided by the members or any of their respective related corporations to any third party or parties in connection with any credit or banking facilities to the Company, the members shall, unless otherwise unanimously agreed, provide the same in proportion to their Shareholding Proportion (or in such other proportion as may be agreed by all the members), and on a several basis.

Inclusion.p: CAPITALISATION OF PROFITS
CAPITALISATION OF PROFITS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: The Company in general meeting may, subject to the Reserved Matters, and upon the recommendation of the Directors resolve, that it is desirable to capitalise any part of the amount for the time being standing to the credit of any of the Company’s reserve accounts or to the credit of the profit and loss account or otherwise available for distribution, and accordingly that such sum be set free for distribution amongst the members who would have been entitled thereto if distributed by way of dividend and in the same proportions on condition that the same be not paid in cash but be applied either in or towards paying up any
Inclusion.p: amounts for the time being unpaid on any shares held by such members respectively or paying up in full unissued shares or debentures of the Company to be allotted, distributed and credited as fully paid up to and amongst such members in the proportion aforesaid, or partly in the one way and partly in the other, and the Directors shall give effect to such resolution.
APPROPRIATION OF CAPITALISED PROFITS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Whenever such a resolution as aforesaid shall have been passed, the Directors shall make all appropriations and applications of the undivided profits resolved to be capitalised thereby, and all allotments and issue of fully paid shares or debentures, if any, and generally shall do all acts and things required to give effect thereto, with full power to the Directors to make such provision by the issue of fractional certificates or by payment in cash or otherwise as they think fit for the case of shares or debentures becoming distributable in fractions, and also to authorise any person to enter on behalf of all the members entitled thereto into an agreement with the Company providing for the allotment to them respectively, credited as fully paid up, of any further shares or debentures to which they may be entitled upon such capitalisations, or, as the case may require, for the payment up by the Company on their behalf, by the application thereto of their respective proportions of the profits resolved to be capitalise, of the amounts or any part of the amounts remaining unpaid on their existing shares, and any agreement made under such authority shall be effective and binding on all such members.

Inclusion.p: AUDIT
AUDIT OF ACCOUNTS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Once at least in every year the accounts of the Company shall be examined, and the correctness of the profit and loss account and balance sheet ascertained by one (1) or more Auditor or Auditors, subject to the provisions of the Act and any modification or re-enactment thereof for the time being in force in regard to audit and Auditors.

Inclusion.p: NOTICES
SERVICE OF REGISTERED ADDRESS, MEMBER
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A notice may be given by the Company to any member either personally or by sending it by post or by facsimile to him at his registered address supplied by him to the Company for the giving of notices to him. Where a notice is sent by post, service of the notice shall be deemed to be effected by properly addressing, pre-paying, and posting a letter containing the notice, and to have been effected in the case of a notice of a meeting on the day after the date of its posting, and in any other case at the time at which the letter would be delivered in the ordinary course of post.
Inclusion.p: NOTICE TO JOINT HOLDERS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A notice may be given by the Company to the joint holders of a share by giving the notice to the joint holder first named in the register of members in respect of the share.
Inclusion.p: NOTICE TO PERSON IN CASE OF DECEASED OR BANKRUPT MEMBER
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: A notice may be given by the Company to the persons entitled to a share in consequence of the death or bankruptcy of a member by sending it through the post in a prepaid letter addressed to them by name, or by the title of representatives of the deceased, or assignee of the bankrupt, or by any like description, at the address, if any, in Singapore supplied for the
Inclusion.p: purpose by the persons claiming to be so entitled, or, until such an address has been so supplied, by giving the notice in any manner in which the same might have been given if the death or bankruptcy had not occurred.
NOTICE OF GENERAL MEETINGS
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: (1) Notice of every general meeting shall be given in any manner herein before authorised to:
Inclusion.p: (a) every member
(i) every person entitled to a share in consequence of the death or bankruptcy of a member who, but for his death or bankruptcy, would be entitled to receive notice of the meeting; and
(ii) the auditor for the time being of the Company.
(2) No other person shall be entitled to receive notices of general meetings.
WINDING UP
WINDING UP OF COMPANY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: If the Company is wound up, the liquidator may, with the sanction of a special resolution of the Company and subject to the Reserved Matters, divide amongst the members in kind the whole or any part of the assets of the Company, whether they consist of property of the same kind or not, and may for that purpose set such value as he deems fair upon any property to be divided as aforesaid and may determine how the division shall be carried out as between the members or different classes of members. The liquidator may, with the like sanction, vest the whole or any part of any such assets in trustees upon such trusts for the benefit of the contributories as the liquidator, with the like sanction, thinks fit, but so that no member shall be compelled to accept any shares or other securities whereon there is any liability.

Inclusion.p: INDEMNITY
INDEMNITY TO OFFICERS OF COMPANY
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Every Director, managing director, agent, auditor, secretary and other officer for the time being of the Company shall be indemnified out of the assets of the Company against any liability incurred by him in defending any proceedings, whether civil or criminal in which judgment is given in his favour or in which he is acquitted or in connection with any application under the Act in which relief is granted to him by the Court in respect of any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust.

(2) all persons who are or subsequently become shareholders of the Company, (collectively, the "Relevant Parties").

(B) The Transferee is the [subscriber/transferee] of [●state the number of shares] [Ordinary Shares/Series B CPS] (the "Transferred Shares") in the issued capital of the Company [by virtue of the instrument(s) of transfer in respect thereof executed by [•state the name of the Transferor] (the "Transferor")].

(C) By the terms of the Shareholders' Agreement, it is a condition precedent to the registration by the Company of the [subscription by/transfer to] the Transferee of the Transferred Shares that the Transferee executes this Deed.
NOW THIS DEED WITNESSETHas follows:
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: In this Deed:
Inclusion.p: (a) all terms and references used in this Deed and which are defined or construed in the Shareholders' Agreement but are not defined or construed in this Deed shall have the same meaning and construction in this Deed; and

(b) all references to "Shareholders' Agreement" are to the Shareholders' Agreement as from time to time amended, modified or supplemented, including the amendments, additions and variations thereto agreed between the parties thereto as contained or evidenced by the following documents:
[state the documents, if any]

Inclusion.p: (a) that in consideration of and upon the registration in the Company's Register of Members of the Transferee as the holder of the Transferred Shares, the Transferee will as from the date of the registration of the Transferee as a holder of the

Transferred Shares observe and discharge all the terms and conditions of the Shareholders' Agreement which are applicable to it as a Shareholder in all respects as if it had been a party thereto, and references to "Party" or "Parties" in the Shareholders' Agreement shall, where applicable, refer to or include the Transferee, as the case may be;
(b) [that the liability of the Transferee by virtue of this Deed to each of the Relevant Parties shall be joint and several with the Transferor;] and
(c) that this Deed is enforceable against the Transferee by any of the Relevant Parties.

These provisions shall however not apply to Garena Interactive, Visionnaire Ventures Fund I L.P., SB Pan-Asia Fund, or the Series B CPS issued to Eduardo Luiz Saverin pursuant to the Shareholders’ Agreement.]

Inclusion.p: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Shareholders’ Agreement, and to the furthest extent permitted by law,
(a) Agreement to Vote
Subject to sub-clause (b) below, the Transferee agrees and undertakes to refrain from exercising any voting rights attached to the Shares.
(b) Irrevocable Proxy and Power of Attorney

(i) The Transferee irrevocably authorises and appoints each and both of the Founders as its or his proxy and attorney (acting singly or jointly) with full power and authority in its name or otherwise, to exercise the voting rights attaching to the Transferee’s Shares (which voting rights shall be split equally between the Founders), whether at a general meeting or in a written resolution, in the Shares now or hereafter directly or indirectly owned or beneficially held by the Transferee, on behalf of the Transferee whenever required and as each of the Founders may choose at their sole and absolute discretion, and to execute, sign, seal and deliver all appropriate instruments related thereto.

(ii) The Transferee agrees to ratify all and whatsoever that the Founders may lawfully do or cause to be done while acting in pursuance of the authority conferred upon them hereunder, and to indemnify the Founders against all costs, charges, expenses and losses which the Founders may incur in the lawful execution of the powers hereby conferred upon the Founders.

(iii) The Transferee grants each and both of the Founders the full power to substitute, appoint or discharge from time to time one or more attorneys in the name of the Transferee and on behalf of the Transferee, and grants the Founders the right to secure the performance of the Transferee’s duties hereunder.
Inclusion.a_left_sidehead: Remedies relating to Voting Provisions Regarding Shareholder Matters.
Inclusion.p: (a) Covenants of the Company.

The Company agrees to use its best efforts, within the requirements of applicable law, to ensure that the rights granted hereunder are effective and that the Parties enjoy the benefits thereof. Such actions include, without limitation, the use of the Company’s
best efforts to cause the exercise of the Transferee’s voting rights in the Shares as provided herein.
(b) Specific Enforcement.

The Transferee acknowledges and agrees that the Relevant Parties will be irreparably damaged in the event any of the provisions herein are not performed by the Transferee in accordance with its specific terms or is otherwise breached. Accordingly, it is agreed that each of the Company and the Founders shall be entitled to equitable remedies including specific enforcement of Clauses 3 and 4 herein or an injunction to prevent a breach of the said provisions, in any action instituted in any court of Singapore.
(c) Remedies Cumulative.
All remedies provided hereunder or by law or otherwise afforded to any Relevant Party shall be cumulative and not alternative.]

This is the Disclosure Schedule (the "Disclosure Schedule") delivered pursuant to that certain Amended and Restated Subscription and Shareholders’ Agreement, dated as of 2 July 2014 (the "Agreement"), by and among Redmart Pte. Ltd., a Singapore corporation (the "Company"), Garena Interactive Holding Limited, Visionnaire Ventures Fund I L.P., SB Pan-Asia Fund, Roger Emmett Egan III and Vikram Prakash Rupani among others.

The numbered and lettered sections of this Disclosure Schedule correspond to the numbered and lettered paragraphs contained in Schedule 4 (Representations and Warranties) of this Agreement. Any disclosures made under the heading of one section of this Disclosure Schedule shall apply to and/or qualify disclosures made under one or more other paragraphs only to the extent it is readily apparent from a reading of such disclosure that such disclosure is applicable to such other paragraph or paragraphs of Schedule 4 (Representations and Warranties). Unless otherwise defined, any capitalised terms in this Disclosure Schedule shall have the same meanings assigned to such terms in the Agreement.

Nothing in this Disclosure Schedule is intended to broaden the scope of any representation or warranty contained in the Agreement or to create any covenant. Inclusion of any item in this Disclosure Schedule shall not constitute, or be deemed to be, an admission by the Company that (a) such item is material or establish a standard of materiality; or (b) such item did not arise in the ordinary course of business.

div.a: Schedule 4: Representations and Warranties 3(a) – Changes Since Latest Available Accounts

Inclusion.p: Schedule 4: Representations and Warranties 3(a) – Changes Since Latest Available Accounts
The Company has been operating as a going concern with support of the capital raised from shareholders.
3(e)&(f) – Changes Since Latest Available Accounts
The Company is currently in negotiations with respect to a new bank financing facility for rental guarantees, warehouse related capital expenditure and other general corporate purposes.

Inclusion.numbered_2_para: – Related Party Transactions
Inclusion.p: A cousin of one the Founders is currently employed as an intern with the Company

Inclusion.numbered_2_para: – Related Party Transactions
Inclusion.p: The Company has borrowed S$750,000 in the form of a personal loan from Wong Meng Weng. The loan is to be repaid out of the subscription proceeds of the Series B CPS. Wong Meng Weng is not currently a shareholder, but has, in addition to the personal loan, invested in the company through Series B Convertible Loan Agreements which upon Closing will be converted into Series B CPS.
Holywell Pte. Ltd. holds an interest in Lam Soon, a supplier of cooking oil, paper products and other household items sold by the Company.

Inclusion.numbered_2_para: – Contracts
Inclusion.p: The Company only intends to issue Series B CPS to the holders of Series B Convertible Loan Agreements upon the relevant lender delivering to the Company a duly signed Deed of Ratification and Accession.
